loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan and her family live in Lap Phuoc hamlet, in the Tan Lap commune in Ham Thuan Nam district.

With no father at home, Loan takes care of her three children. The two oldest children (one boy and one girl) are in the 6th & 3rd class, respectively, and the youngest son is still too young for school.

Loan works as a day laborer and raises chickens. Their average income is $11 USD per month/person. She wishes to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow in order to save funds for her children’s school in the near future. She hopes to pay back the loan over the next seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung and his family reside in Lap Phuoc hamlet, in the Tan Lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Hung collects garbage at the local market while his wife works at a Brick-kiln but does not have a regular schedule for working there. Together, they support their three children who are all in school (3rd, 6th and 9th grades, respectively).

Their average income is$ 12.50 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow to save and to continue their children school. They will pay the loan back after seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien and her family live in Lap Phuoc hamlet, in the Tan Lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Chien's family consists of a total of five members: Chien and her husband, as well as their three children. The youngest daughter is in the 7th grade and the other two work as day laborers. The father had a heart attack so currently does house work.

Chien spends her days selling rice spaghetti on a daily basis. Together, their average income is $10 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow so that in can further reproduce. They plan to pay it back over the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S., 43, is a mother of four school-aged children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling Khmer noodles at an open-air market, where she can earn about $5 profit each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is self-employed as a mechanic and generally makes around $2 a day.

Mrs.Mom S. hopes to use this loan to purchase utensils and some other equipment for her food stall. The remainder of the money will go to buy spare parts for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and some other equipment for her stall and buy spare parts for her husband’s business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 35 years old. He has 4 children, and three of them are in school. His mother lives with him. She is very old and sick, and he is responsible for her treatment. He has an old general store in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new goods and a new ice box for the shop. He will also renovate the shop by making new shelves. He wants to increase his income and develop his shop to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new goods and a new ice box for the shop.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai O., 46, lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is employed as a laborer, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together they can generally earn around $5 profit each day. One of her children works in a rubber plantation collecting rubber sap from the trees and can typically earn about $2.40 each day, whilst the other three are students.

Mrs. Thai O. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so he can use his own motorcycle to operate a business and thus generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business ( a motor-taxi)

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: A. Gulsara has been engaged in business for over 10 years. She is divorced and has one child. Her business is located in Chkalovsk, Khujand. She sells men’s clothes such as sportswear, jackets, T-shirts and so on. She brought her goods herself from Bishkek and Istaravshan. She goes to purchase goods two times per month. The turnover of her goods is high, and she regularly repays her loans on time. She has shown herself to be a responsible person during her partnership with MicroInvest. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase warm clothes for the coming winter season.

loans.use: To purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Jossefina Manuel

texts.pt:
Jossefina Manuel M. is the accountant the group Mussumbuluco. The group joined the program in 2005 and has 4 members, each member started with a loan of 1.800MT. The group had problems with some members quitting but is now in the 6th cycle of the program. They request a loan of 9.240MT.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Jossefina Manuel M. é tesoureira do grupo Mussumbuluco. O grupo entrou para o programa em novembro de 2005 e era composto na altura por 4 membros e cada membro começou com um empréstimo de 1.800MT. O Grupo teve alguns problemas anteriormente e houve a desistência de um dos membros. O grupo vai agora para o 6º ciclo e agora é composto por três membros e o empréstimo total que o grupo vai tomar é de 9.240 MT.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Ni Komang Suryani

texts.id:
Even though they are renting a place, this doesn't stop Komang Suryani from working towards her dreams. She and her husband Putu Kartana, are happy for being able to farm pigs. With a loan of Rp 1.600.000 from Dinari, they bought 3 piglets. After 6 months time of hard work they manage to reap a profit of Rp.400.000 per pig. With this income, She use to raise her children Gede Suryantara 3 years old and Kadek Dewi 5 months old.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun tempat tinggal Komang Suryani hanya menumpang, tetapi tidak menyurutkan niatnya untuk tetap berusaha. Dengan suaminya, Putu Kartana, dengan senang hati mereka sepakat memelihara babi.Dengan modal Pinjaman Dari Dinari Sebesar Rp 1.600.000-Komang Suryani membeli 3 (tiga) ekor Bibit.Dan dipelihara selama 6 (Enam) bulan. Melalui usaha ini keuntungan sangat banyak diterima.Dalam 6 (Enam) bulan Komang Suryani mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp.400.000 per ekor babi.. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.Dan biaya kedua anaknya yang masih kecil.yang bernama Gede Suryantara berumur 3 (tiga) tahun dan Kadek Dewi berusia 5 (lima) bulan.

loans.use: Membeli pakan dan bibit babi - buying pig feedings and piglets.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
Aziza M., 26 sells underwear. She is married. Aziza has a high school education. She learned the business by helping her mother. Five years ago, Aziza opened her own business with sales volume of $100. When Aziza learned about and applied for a MicroInvest loan, she used the money to increase her sales. The $100 loan that Aziza received in 2003 helped her to purchase a new sales location and increase the variety of goods sold. While expanding her business, Aziza acquired many new clients. In the future, she plans to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махсудова Азиза занимается торговлей нижнего белья. Азизе 26лет, замужем, образование среднее. Набрала опыт, в торговле помогая своей матери в. Свою деятельность начала пять лет назад, в то время её товарооборот составлял 100$. Через некоторое время узнав о программе она решила получить займ и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. В 2003году Азиза получила кредит в размере 100$. После получения кредита и целевого использования она увеличила наименование товара, приобрела новое место для торговли и приобрела много клиентов. В дельнейшем планирует приобрести ещё одну точку торговли.

loans.use: To open another sales location

loans.name: Virgílio André

texts.pt:
Virgílio André L. is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children. He sells used clothes at his home in the neighborhood of Mahotas in Maputo. He joined the program in February of this year, then he requested a loan of 3.000MT. He is in the 2nd cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 5.000MT to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Virgílio André L. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 3 filhos. Vende roupa usada na sua residência situada no bairro Mahotas em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro deste ano com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 5.000MT para pagar em 6 meses.

loans.use: Strengthen business

loans.name: Fayzali

texts.en: Fayzali C. is a 52 year old habitant of the Yavan district. He has high level education. He is married and has one child.  Currently, he works as an electrician in a state organization. Fayzali has been cattle farming for 20 years. This kind of activity has served as an additional source of income. With the loan amount, the client is going to buy three cattle. This loan is going to help to increase the cattle amount and give opportunity for the local habitant to obtain cattle closer to home and for a cheaper price. The client plans to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to buy three cattle

loans.name: Ni Komang Ayu Sumber

texts.id:
Even though a house wife, Komang Ayu Sumber Astuti has a hobby of rearing pigs. With a capital of Rp.500.000, Komang Ayu bought 2 piglets for fattening. Her profit is Rp.75.000 per month. With the financial assistance from Dinari, Komang Ayu bought additional 3 piglets and increased her monthly income to Rp. 225.000. With this income Komang Ayu helps her husband Made Sugita to raise her 3 children who are still schooling. They lived in their own made house.

Translated from bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga Komang Ayu Sumber Astuti mempunyai kegemaran memelihara babi.Dengan modal Rp.500.000 Komang Ayu memelihara 2 ekor babi untuk penggemukan . Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.75.000 perbulan . Biaya per hari yang diperlukan untuk pakan adalah Rp.20.000.Dengan pinjaman di Dinari, Komang Ayu membeli bibit babi sebanyak 3 ekor, sehingga kini babi yang dipelihara sebanyak 5 ekor. Komang Ayu mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 225.000.- perbulan. Dengan keuntungan yang diperoleh tersebut, Komang Ayu bisa membantu suaminya I Made Sugita untuk menghidupi 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah. Mereka tinggal bersama dirumah yang mereka bangun sendiri, walaupun sangat sederhana.

loans.use: Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan - Buying piglets.

loans.name: Muminadjhon

texts.ru:
Muminadjhon V. is married and has 3 children. She has high school education. Muminadjhon sells household goods. Her children attend school and her husband drives a taxi and helps his wife to deliver the goods. Muminadjhon used to borrow the goods from the suppliers. When she became a MicroInvest borrower, Muminadjhon’s business assets amounted to $500. Since taking the loan, Muminadjhon started to pay cash to purchase her goods. She opened a store in center of Kayrakkum. Muminadjhon acquired a number of clients-wholesalers. In the future, she plans to open another location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобова Муминаджон мать 3 детей, замужем, образование среднее. Занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Дети учатся в школе, муж работает таксистом, также помогает жене в торговле, он привозит товар. Раньше брала товар у поставщиков в долг. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда её активы составляли 500$. После получения займа она стала покупать товар за наличные, открыла магазин в центре городка Кайраккума, приобрела много клиентов оптовиков. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open another place of business

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en: Ismoil A. is 35 years old, with a secondary education. He is married and has 3 children. After graduating school, he worked hard and became a taxi driver. For many years now, he has worked as a driver in many various cars. Currently, he works as a taxi driver and provides his services to local residents. This activity is the main source for his income. With his loan. the client is going to fix gas equipment and other minor repairs.  This loan will give people opportunities to have taxi services available to them. The client will pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to fix gas equipment,  and  minor repairs

loans.name: Virgínia Jaime

texts.pt:
Virgínia Jaime M. does accountanting and sales for the Mahungueles, she sells plastic kitchenware and chickens. Vitória Maria Jango is the other member of the group, she sells cooking oil. They both live in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. The Magungueles joined the FDM fund in 2005, they are in the 7th cycle of the credit program and ask for a loan of 11.840MT.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Virgínia Jaime M. é tesoureira do grupo M.. A outra membro do grupo é a senhora Vitória Maria Jango. A primeira vende loiça plástica e faz criação de frangos e a segunda vende óleo alimentar. Ambas vivem no bairro Magoanine em Maputo. o Grupo entrou para o programa em Outubro de 2005 e vai para o 7º ciclo e vai tomar um empréstimo total de 11.840MT.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Hanifa I. has been selling perfumes and “a thousand of small items” for 12 years. She has high school education. Hanifa is a widowed mother of 4 children. Each of Hanifa’s grownup children has their own family. Hanifa started her business by selling “a thousand of small items.” In 2005, she received her first MicroInvest loan. Then, she had $250 in business assets. After receiving and carefully investing multiple MicroInvest loans, Hanifa added perfumes to her product selection and moved to a cozier store under more favorable conditions. In the future, Hanifa plans to add underwear to her selection of products.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исмоилова Ханифа занимается продажей парфюмерий и тысячи мелочей вот уже 12лет. Вдова, мать четверых детей, образование среднее. Каждый из детей имеют отдельную семью. Начала свою деятельность с продажи тысячи мелочей. В 2005году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда её активы составляли 250$. После неоднократного получения зама и целевого использования она добавила в ассортимент товара парфюмерию, перешла на другой магазин более уютное и с хорошими условиями. На будущее планирует добавить в ассортимент и нижнее бельё.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods and add underwear to the product selection

loans.name: Nasredin

texts.en: Nasredin T. is 28 years old. He is married, and has an education within economics. After graduating his university, he worked as an accountant at a firm. For three years he worked as a taxi driver, and he now plans to provide taxi services from his own car. Nasredin’s car is currently very old and requires repairs, which hinders the amount of income he receives. Nasredin would like to sell his car, and with the help of a loan purchase a new one. The loan would also help him expend less of his income on oil. This loan would help him obtain more business and run it more efficiently, and serve more people by taxi. Nasredin plans to repay his loan in the period of 12 months.

loans.use: buying car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase Shop Stocks

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru:
Adolat K. has been selling traditional Tajik pita-like bread for 14 years. A divorced mother of 6 children, she had to sell bread to make a living, while her son went to Russia to work as a seasonal laborer. In 2005, Adolat K. turned to MicroInvest for help. Then, she had only one trading spot. After receiving the loan, Adolat increased the volume of goods sold and purchased another sales location for her daughter. By now, Adolat doubled her assets. In the future, she wants to expand the business by selling a greater assortment of bread and acquiring another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хидирова Адолат занимется продажей лепешек 14лет. Разведенная, мать шестерых детей. От нелегкой жизни она начала торговать лепешками, а сын поехал на заработки в Россию. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда она имела только одно место для торговли. После получения займа и шагового увеличения она увеличила товар и приобрела еще одно место для торговли, где торгует её дочь. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза больше. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить товар и приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To increase assortment of bread and open another sales location

loans.name: Nghik

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghik K. C., 56, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help support her family, Mrs. Nghik K. C. is employed as a worker at a rubber plantation collecting rubber sap, while her husband works as a tire repairman. Together they can earn only the meager amount of $2 each day. Two of their children work at a garment factory and the other works with his mother at the plantation.

Mrs.Nghik K. C. hopes to use this loan to invest in buying rubber from someone’s plantation and she then will resell it at a good profit. She believes your trust and support can help her entire family generate additional profits from this investment.

loans.use: To invest in buying rubber from someone’s plantation to resell at a good profit

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru:
Dilfuza N. sells food and household products. She is married, has 3 children and a secondary education. Her husband helps her in her business. She started her business by selling food products. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2004. Back then her assets were valued at $200 and she got a loan for $100. After receiving the loan and using it fully she acquired a large store and added household products to her inventory. Today her assets have doubled. Dilfuza plans on using the new loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурматова Дилфуза- занимается продажей продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле своей жене. Начала свою деятельность с продажи продуктов питания. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда её активы составляли 200$, она получила займ в размере 100$. После получения займа и целевого использования она приобрела большой магазин и добавила ассортимент хозяйственные товары. Сейчас ее активы увеличились в два раза больше.В будущем планирует увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty K. is a married woman with five children; her youngest child is in senior one while the others are in tertiary institutions.

Resty is the treasurer of Zinunula Women’s group which she joined in 1997. She has been operating a retail shop in Kayunga town for over 15 years. She sells a variety of household items such as sugar, rice, soap, bread, bottled water and other soft drinks. Resty started using loans in 1997 and her first loan was for US$30. Over the years, she has serviced loans ranging from US$100 – 600 and paid back with no difficulty. Resty has been able to buy a plot and build a house in Kayunga town, as well as buy some household items with her previous loans.

loans.use: Resty wants to buy 20 bags of sugar, 30 cartons of wheat flour and 2 bags of rice.

loans.name: Toji

texts.ru:
Toji Y. has a happy family, he is a father to four children and has a secondary education. The elder daughter is married, his wife and children help him in his trade. He started his business after factories closed and many became unemployed. He has been selling food for 15 years. Toji became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. After receiving and fully using the loan, he expanded his product line, acquired a place of business and improved his quality of life.

Toji plans to use this loan to expand his place of business. His daughter is pictured in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

У Юнусова Точи счастливая семья он отец четверых детей, образование среднее. Старшая дочь замужем, жена и дети помогают ему в торговле. Начал заниматься торговлей, после того как заводы и фабрики закрылись, и многие остались без работы. Торгует он продуктами питания вот уже 15лет. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начал кредитоваться в 2006году. После получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил наименования товара, приобрел новое место для торговли, а также улучшил уровень жизни. В будущем планирует расширить место для торговли. На фото его дочь.

loans.use: to extand place of business

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
N. Kate is a widow aged 42 years and has two children. Fortunately, her children have finished tertiary education and are working. Kate sells all types of vegetables and fruits such as dodo, tomatoes, onions, avocados, garlic, green pepper, cabbages and carrots. Fruits include mangoes, passion fruits, oranges, yellow bananas and others.

She owns three stalls in Kayunga central market. Kate started her business in 1998 and has been in Kayunga market for nine years. She is hardworking and in the future, plans to own a lockup shop in the market so as to earn a greater income.

loans.use: To buy a stall in the market.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat S. sells food. She is married, has 3 children and a specialized secondary education. Her husband is in Russia earning money and her children are in school. She started her business 2 years ago because life was difficult. Karomat started borrowing through MicroInvest in 2006, back then her assets were worth $230. After multiple loans she increased her inventory. Today her assets are valued at $400.

Karomat plans to move into wholesale sales in the future. Her business partner is in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Каромат занимается продажей продуктов питания. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее специальное. Муж на заработках в России, дети учатся в школе. Начала свою деятельность 2года назад. Поскольку трудно стала жить. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала кредитоваться в 2006году, тогда её активы составляли 230$. После неоднократного кредитования она увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы составляют 400$. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу. На фото ее партнер по бизнессу.

loans.use: to switch to wholesale sales

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Bahriniso K. has been selling sweets for 7 years. She is married, has 3 children and a secondary education. Previously she received her products from deliverymen and her place of business was not very good. She started borrowing through MicroInvest in 2004 and received a $100 loan. After receiving a loan and step by step expansion, Bahriniso increased her inventory and thereby expanded her place of business and started traveling to purchase products herself. She also improved her standard of living.

Bahriniso plans on using this loan to shift toward wholesaling. Her daughter is pictured in the photo.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Бахринисо занимается продажей кондитерских изделий вот уже 7лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей, образование среднее. Раньше брала товар у поставщиков, также место её торговли было не очень хорошее. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала кредитоваться 2004году, она получила займ в размере 100$. После получения займа и шагового увеличения Бахринисо увеличила товарооборот и тем самым расширила место своей деятельности, стала ездить за товаром сама. Она также улучшила уровень жизни. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.На фото ее дочь.

loans.use: To move into wholesale sales

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kari

texts.id:
With Rp.1.600.00 finance from Dinari, Ni Wayan Kari and her Husband Wayan Buda will use to farm pigs, because they are capable of doing this business. Before getting this financial assistance, Ni Wayan only had 1 pig with a cage made out of only bamboo. With Dinari's help she now has additional 3 piglets. Ni Wayan Kari is 54 years old this year and her child Ari Susanta age 20 years old lives with her. The house which they are living right now is from their own hard work. In the past 6 months Ni Wayan Kari managed to earn Rp. 400.000. She didn't need to worry about marketing, as her had regular buyer for her pigs. With the earnings, she will use it to finance the house hold expenses.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun dengan modal meminjam Ni Wayan Kari dan Wayan Buda suaminya,tetap memikirkan masa depan mereka.Modal dari Dinari Rp.1.600.000,- digunakan untuk memelihara babi.Karena usaha ini bisa menjangkau kemampuan dan ketrampilan yang dimiliki. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman, Ni Wayan Kari memelihara satu ekor babi di kandang yang hanya terbuat dari bambu sebagai pembatasnya. Sekarang Ni Wayan Kari sudah bisa membeli 3 (tiga) ekor babi untuk penggemukan. Ni Wayan Kari berumur 54 tahun dan memiliki satu orang anak bernama Ari Susanta yang berumur 20 tahun.Rumah yang ditempati sekarang adalah jerih payah mereka berdua.Dalam 6 (enam) bulan Ni Wayan Kari meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Ni Wayan Kari tidak mperlu khawatir dengan pemasaran babinya, karena sudah ada langganan yang membeli babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk tambahan keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan - Buying piglets

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa N. is married with three children. She has been selling fish in Kayunga central market for the last four years. She started taking out loans three years back from Feed The children Uganda 's community banking program. She has been servicing her current US$400 loan well. She is a very hardworking and enterprising lady.

She recently traveled to Busia on the borderof Kenya and Uganda and noticed that the demand for fish was higher there than in Kayunga. After her visit, she made a test and surprisingly found that she had sold all that she had taken there with her. To-date she runs two stalls in Kayunga and Busia. However, her funds are limited and don't allow her to stock enough for her customers, hence she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy five large baskets of dry fish twice a week.

loans.name: Ni Putu Wartini

texts.id:
Ni Putu Wartini has started this pig farming business, since it has the potential to expand fast. Ni Putu Wartini raised 1 mother pig with a profit within 6 months for about Rp 1,500,000 (about US$165) obtained from piglets sales. Monthly living expenses are about Rp500,000 (about $55). The income from that 1 mother pig is not sufficient to cover their living expenses. Therefore Wartini is in highly need to increase her capital so that she would be able to raise 3 mother pigs, with the hope to she could harvest 6 times that year. Her optimistic calculation is every mother pig could bore 10-12 piglets, and after being raised for 4 months, could be sold for Rp250,000 (about $27.50)/piece. Forward looking her business could expand for continued life of their family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Wartini sudah merintis usahanya beternak babi karena usaha ini dapat berkembang dengan cepat.Ni Putu Wartini memelihara 1 ekor induk babi,dengan keuntungan per 6 bulan Rp 1.500.000.- yang didapat dari penjualan bibit babi. Sedangkan untuk biaya hidup keluarga mereka, setiap bulannya kurang lebih Rp. 500.000.- Dari penghasilan 1 ekor induk babi ini, dirasa kurang mencukupi untuk biaya hidupnya. Karena itu Wartini sangat memerlukan tambahan modal usaha agar bisa memelihara 3 ekor induk babi dengan harapan dalam setahun Wartini bisa panen 6 kali. Perhitungannya, setiap induk babi melahirkan anak 10 – 12 ekor dan setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan, bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- per ekornya. Dan harapannya kedepan usahanya akan tetap berkembang dan menjadi besar untuk kelangsungan hidup kelurga mereka.

loans.use:
To buy animal feed and a mother pig to increase animal population

Membeli Induk babi untuk meningkatkan jumlah populasi ternaknya dan pakan

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married man with one child. He has the best video library and public address system in Kayunga town. He has been in this business for eight years and has seen it grown over the years. He started with 20 Video tapes and now has over 200 video tapes and 100 DVDs. His daily income is about US$60 and he hopes this number will increase this season. He is planning to buy more DVDs, especially Nigerian films commonly called “Ekinigeria”, because they are watched by a good number of the population.

loans.use: Edward wants to buy a new VCD, DVD writer and a modern music system to attract a good clientele.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn O., 53, lives with her husband and seven children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling different types of beans and earns approximately $2.40 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works on a piece of farmland growing crops (vegetables, etc.) Two of her children are self-employed as construction workers; another is employed at a garment factory and the rest are students.

Mrs. Orn O. and her husband are humbly requesting a loan to purchase a well frame to enable them to produce wells for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a well frame  to enable them to produce wells

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia K. is a 26 year old entrepreneur in Kayunga town. She is a sub-dealer of Uganda Telecom, a telecommunications company which operates all over Uganda. On top of working, Sylivia attends weekend classes at Mukono University, where she pays for her own tuition.

She says loans have helped her since 2005 and she looks forward to being the biggest phone dealer in the whole of Kayunga. Besides the phone business, she rears chicken and pigs, which earns her about USS100 net profit in a month. As a major sub-dealer, she is normally able to receive special phone offers from Uganda Telecom but due to not having enough cash, sha has had to forego the phone offers, which has dampened her earnings. Thus, she would like to take out a loan to buy Nokia phones to sell to her clients.

loans.use: Sylivia wants to buy Nokia phones to sell, especially model 1200 which is in high demand.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K. did not have the chance to attend college but this has not hindered him from becoming the best welder of metal windows and door frames in the whole of Kayunga Town. He has been in this business for the last 10 years.

His first loan was for US$120 and he paid it back on time. This encouraged him to take on other loans ranging from US$200- 500, all of which he paid back without any hassle. The demand for his products is high, especially in this season when people want to hurry construction on their houses so that they are ready by Christmas and New Year. The additional income he will earn this season will help him support his 5 children.

loans.use: To buy angle line bars, plates and metal bars to make doors and windows.

loans.name: I Putu Danu

texts.id:
The business he is in besides a tenant farmer is also being a pig farmer. Today he raise 1 mother pig with a loan of Rp 1,300,000 (about US$150), then danu bought 4 piglets and a sack of Pollard (local brand) pig feed . Daily expenses could reach Rp10,000 (about $1.10) each day. Feeding was done twice a day, at 8:00 AM, and 4:00PM. His other time was used to work on the fields. Usually 4 piglets were raised for 3 months, then sold to the processor for Rp1,400,000 about (US$154) with a nett profit of Rp500,000 (about $55). From that profit Putu Danu supports a wife and a son who is still in Grade school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni selama ini selain sebagai petani juga beternak babi. Saat ini babi yang dipelihara ada 1 ekor calon induk, dengan pinjamam Rp 1.300.000,- kemudian Danu membeli 4 ekor anak babi dan satu karung pakan babi yaitu Pollard. Biaya yang dikeluarkan dalam satu harinya mencapai Rp.10.000,- . pemberian pakan dilakukan sebanyak 2 kali yaitu jam 08.00 wita dan jam 16.00 wita, waktu selebihnya dipakai untuk menggarap sawah ladangnya. Biasanya 4 ekor anak babi hanya dipelihara selama 3 bulan dan kemudian dijual ke penggepul dengan harga Rp.1.400.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih selama 3 bulan Rp.500.000,- dari keuntungan tersebut Putu Danu dapat menghidupi 1 orang istri dan 1 orang anak laki-laki yang sekarang duduk di tingkat Sekolah Dasar.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Nghim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghim S., 37, is a widow and lives with her two children and her elderly parent in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family, she works as a labourer, earning around $2.40 each day, while her two children are employed at a factory, earning together $5 each day.

Mrs. Nghim S. hopes to use this loan to invest in purchasing rubber from someone’s plantation to sell at a good price to generate additional income.

loans.use: To invest in purchasing rubber from someone’s plantation to re-sell at a good price

loans.name: Ni Putu Kalih

texts.id:
Ni Putu Kalih has a pig farming business that she already have for a while to help her husband's tenant farmer income. Ni Putu Kalih only raise 1 mother pig which is highly pregnant. Pregnancy time is only 3 months, and usually it gave birth to up to 8 piglets. These piglets were raised for 3 months, and feed cost for the 3 months could reach Rp 300,000 (about US$33). Raising and feedding was done 2 times a day, at 7:00 AM, and 3:00PM. So far income from raising could reach up to Rp2,400,000 (US$264). Nett profit after 6 months could reach up to Rp1,100,000 (about $121). That profit was used for family expense with a husband and a child, and to repair her home.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Kalih mempunyai usaha beternak babi yang sudah ditekuni sejak lama untuk membantu mendapatkan tambahan pendapatan suaminya yang bekerja sebagi seorang petani. Ni Putu Kalih hanya memelihara 1 ekor babi Induk yang sedang hamil besar, masa hamil hanya 3 bulan dan biasanya melahirkan sampai 8 ekor anak.Anak babi hanya dipelihara selama 3 bulan biaya perawatan dan pakan selama 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp.300.000,-Pemeliharaan dan pemberian makan dilakukan 2 kali sehari yaitu jam 07.00 pagi dan jam 3.00 sore.Hasil penjualan selama pemeliharaan dapat mencapai Rp.2.400.000,- jadi keuntungan bersih selama 6 bulan mecapai Rp.1.100.000,- dari hasil keuntungan pelihara ternak babi dipakai untuk kehidupan keluarganya dengan suami dan 1 orang anaknya, dan dipakai untuk memperbaiki rumahnya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for her fish shop.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
A. Dilbar is a pretty business lady. She is married and has one child. She loves him very much and often takes him with her to the market. He is 5 years old, and she teaches him to read at her trade place during her free time.

Her mother is her business partner. She gave Dilbar money to open her business and introduced her to Microinvest, as she herself is one of the active clients of this organization. Their business is located in Ckalovsk, Khujand. They have two trade places and have common working capital. Her mother goes to purchase goods from Istaravshan, Khujand, and they sell the items in both places. Dilbar has many clients. As she is a mother, she helps young parents to choose clothes for their babies with great pleasure.

Presently she has a high turnover of her goods, and she plans to spend her future loan to purchase warm clothes for her little clients.

loans.use: Purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sriyani

texts.id:
Since marrying Nyoman Sedana 18 years ago, Ni Luh Sriyani is belssed with 5 children, mostly still very small. To support family economy, Ni Luh opened a food stall at her pace. Besides food stall Ni Luh also sells household goods items, like soap, shampoo, candy and cigarettes. According to her cigarettes are her best selling product, since most people living nearby are building laborers, especially if sold by piece, so that profit made are allright. Ni Luh opens her food stall from 7:00 AM till 10:00PM, and her daily profit averaged between Rp40,000-50,000 (about US$4.40-$5.50). With this business Ni Luh is able to support her husband, a building laborer in the family economy. Her hope as parents are their children to complete school education without too much problems, especially from cost issues.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak menikah selama 18 tahun dengan Nyoman Sedana, Ni Luh Sriyani di karuniai 5 orang anak yang sebagian masih kecil-kecil, dan untuk mnopang perekonomian keluarganya Ni Luh membuka warung makan di tempat tinggalnya. Selain sebagai warung makan Ni Luh juga menjual kebutuhan rumah tangga seperti sabun mandi, shampo. Permen dan rokok, menurutnya rokok paling laku karena orang-orang disekitar tempat tinggalnya banyak yang berprofesi sebagai buruh bangunan, apalagi kalau dijual eceran maka keuntungan yang didapat agak lumayan. Ni Luh membuka warungnya dari pagi pukul 07.00 sampai malam pukul 22.00 dan keuntungan yang didapatkan berkisar antara 40.000 – 50.000 rupiah/hari. Dengan usaha seperti itu Ni Luh mampu membantu suaminya sebagai buruh bangunan dalam menunjang perekonomian keluarga. Harapan sebagai orangtua adalah anak-anak bisa menyelesaikan pendidikan disekolah dengan tidak mengalami kesulitan terutama masalah biaya.

loans.use:
To buy food products and adding household goods sales needs

membeli bahan makanan dan menamah kebutuhan rumah tangga untuk jualan

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
G. Harriet is 42 years old. She is married and has four biological children and five dependants. One of her children has finished college and is working while the rest are in secondary school.

She operates a stationery shop in Kawuku trading centre on Kampala- Entebbe road. She started this business way back in 1992 after working for her auntie in the same business for more than six years. Besides selling scholastic materials, she rears pigs and chicken. She received her first loan of US$30 in 1998. Ever since then, she has been accessing loans from Feed The Children Uganda till October 2006 when it changed to operate as PEARL Microfinance Ltd.

G. has taken out loans ranging from US$110- 400 and has paid back all these loans promptly. She gets work for typing from Nkumba University students who reside in the neighbourhood.

loans.use: To buy a new computer to be able to handle the increased work load from her printing business.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Despite very difficult life circumstances, Mariya brings joy to many people through her small business making and selling Piroshki, a delicious ethnic food. Piroshki consists of a bread pocket that is cooked in oil and filled with cabbage, cherries, and other tasty fillings.

Mariya has two sons with disabilities – one who is 19 and another who is 14. Her husband, Zinoviy, had run a business similar to Mariya’s but is now also disabled.

Her business is a major source of income for their family. Mariya has been in this food business for about 10 years and makes around $800 USD per month. She loves to work and is an honest and responsible business owner.

Mariya has requested a loan of $500 USD to purchase supplies of flour, sugar and oil that she uses to make the Piroshki. We are delighted in this opportunity to help Mariya continue to be successful in her business and to earn a valuable living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Ni Komang Sudiartini

texts.id:
The business of Komang Sudiartini is Pig farming. Today she only raise 5 piglets she bought for Rp200,000 (about US$22)/piece. Food given are traditional, from cooked banana tree trunk mixed with Pollard (wheat shells), given twice a day, mornings and evenings. Expenses for 3 months are about Rp200,000 (about $22). As usual after it was felt large enough, that is after 3 months raised they could be sold. Sales could reach Rp 2,000,000 (about $220) per harvest. Profit after 3 months is Rp800,000 (about $88), used to supplement her tenant farmer husband income, and provide needs for her 2 children who are still in Grade school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang ditekuni Komang Sudiartini adalah beternak babi, saat ini hanya memelihara 5 ekor anak babi yang dibelinya dengan harga Rp.200.000 per ekornya. Pemberian pakan yang dilakukan yaitu dengan pakan tradisional yaitu, pakan yang terbuat dari batang pohan pisang yang direbus kemudian dicampur dengan Pollard (dedak gandum), pemberian ini dilakukan 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore hari, biaya pakan selama 3 bulan bisa mencapai Rp.200.000,- . Seperti biasa penjualan setelah dirasa cukup besar yaitu selama 3 bulan pemeliharaan. Hasil penjualan sampai Rp.2.000.000,- sekali panen. Hasil keuntungan selam 3 bulan yaitu Rp.800.000,- dipakai untuk membantu pendapatan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dan memenuhi kebutuhan 2 orang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed stock and availability of animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pengadaan bahan makanan ternak

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is a hard-working entrepreneur from Novomoskosk, a city in south central Ukraine. She and her husband, Nikolay, have one son. She runs a business where she sells women’s clothing at the busy central market in Novomoskovsk.

Nadya started her business five years ago and has run it with both extreme care and seriousness. It is an important source of income for her family of three. She sells around $1200 USD worth of clothing in a typical month.

Nadya has requested a loan of $500 USD so that she can purchase additional clothing inventory and to continue developing her business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to grow her business further and help feed her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing inventory

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow who supports herself with her small market business selling women’s clothing. She operates her business from a small but abundantly stocked kiosk at the bustling central market in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. She sells a variety of clothing including women’s pajamas, slippers and shirts.

Nina has been running her business for about three years now. She is a friendly, careful entrepreneur who is true to her word. In profits, Nina makes about $300 USD per month. Her goal is to be able to earn enough so that she can improve her currently poor living conditions.

Nina has requested a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new inventory for her business. We are happy for this additional opportunity to help Nina as she works to provide for herself in the future.

loans.use: To purchase apparel inventory

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir and his wife Larysa have a successful business selling blankets and bedding material at a busy outdoor market in Novomoskovk, Ukraine. Larysa originally started the business. When Vladimir began observing its growing success, he decided to join her and get involved with the business.

Vladimir is a calm and considerate entrepreneur with a very strong work ethic. He has clear communications skills which help him establish good working relationships with customers.

Vladimir has requested a loan of $1000 USD to help purchase new inventory for he and his wife's business. They would like to increase their inventory so that they can attract new customers.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with a daughter named Karina. Vladimir and his family live in Izyum, Ukraine. He runs a business selling household items and office supplies. His business is located in a very favorable spot in downtown Izyum. Previous loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have provided the opportunity for him to open a new vending facility. To date, Vladimir has been in this trade for approximately six years.

Vladimir has now hired employees to work for him. They are all very polite, respectful and customer-friendly. This helps to produce a positive impact on his business. Moreover, clients are attracted by the individualized and personal approach Vladimir’s employees has to each customer.

Vladimir would like to obtain a loan of $1,200 USD to expand his family business. His venture has seen considerable growth since Vladimir received his first loan with “Nadiya Ukraine”. He has not only been able to increase his turnover capital and develop his business, but he was also able to generate enough profit to perform full reconstruction of his apartment.

Vladimir is hoping to see further consistent growth in his trade after utilizing this loan. Profits generated will be invested in his daughter’s college education. One day, Vladimir hopes to earn enough to buy his daughter her own apartment.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas N., 38, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, where she can earn on average about $13 each day in revenue. Her husband and one of her children, meanwhile, work at a carpentry shop, earning together about $4.30 each day. The other children are students.

Mrs. Meas N. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding extra grocery products and to buy a motorcycle for her business transportation needs.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding extra grocery products and to buy a motorcycle for her business transportation

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Meas Neng has successfully repaid this Kiva loan.

Thanks to your investment, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Ni Ketut Karsi

texts.id:
Although her hut is very simple, since made from woven bamboo sheets and wood, her business as pig farmer is moving along. Today Ketut Karsi only raise 1 mother pig. Food given was also simple, from banana tree trunk that was cooked and then mixed with rice shells fed twice a day morning and evenings. Usually pregnancy time for pigs are only 3 months, and it could produce 6 to 8 piglets. raising for 6 months cost about Rp400,00 (about US$44). After it was felt large enough, that is usually 3 months raising piglets, they are ready to be sold. That could reach up to Rp 2,000,000 (about $220) each harvest and 3 months profit after feed expenses would be Rp1,600,000 (about $176) used to support her tenant farmer husband, and 2 children, who dropped out school after 1st year college. Ketut Karsi hope the capital to be obtained from Dinari could add the mother pigs to be raised, so that her income would increase, given living expenses has increased too.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun keadaan rumah yang masih sangat sederhana yaitu terbuat dari gedek dan kayu namun usaha yang ditekuni sebagai peternak babi tetap berjalan. Saat ini ini Ketut Karsi hanya memelihara 1 ekor induk. Pemberian pakan yang dilakukan masih sangat sederhana yaitu, pakan yang terbuat dari batang pohan pisang yang direbus kemudian dicampur dengan dedak padi, pemberian ini dilakukan 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore hari, biasanya masa hamil babi hanya 3 bulan dan dapat melahirkan bibit 6 sampai 8 ekor anak babi. Pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan menghabiskan biaya sampai Rp. 400.000,- . Setelah dirasa cukup besar yaitu 3 bulan pemeliharaan anak babi siap dijual. Hasil penjualan bisa mencapai Rp.2.000.000,- sekali panen dan keuntungan selama 3 bulan setelah dikurangi biaya pakan yaitu Rp.1.600.000,- dipakai untuk membantu pendapatan suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dan memenuhi kebutuhan 2 orang anaknya yang sudah putus sekolah pada tingkat pertama, Ketut Karsi berharap dengan modal yang diberikan oleh Dinari bisa menambah jumlah induk yang dipelihara agar pendapatannya semakin banyak mengingat kebutuhan hidup yang semakin banyak pula.

loans.use: To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

loans.name: Mohi

texts.ru:
Mohi A. has been selling children’s clothing for 19 years now. She is married, has 3 children and a secondary education. Her husband sells small items, her older children have their own family and the two younger ones study in school.

Mohi started her business because life was hard. In 2003 she received a $70 loan from MicroInvest. At that point her assets were worth $100. Slowly, after receiving repeated loans and using them fully, she increased her inventory and expanded her place of business and of course increased her standard of living. In the future Mohi plans to add additional types of products to her product selection.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллоева Мохи занимается торговлей детской одежды вот уже 19лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей мелочей, старшие дети имеют отдельную семью, двое младших учатся в школе. Начала заниматься торговлей, поскольку жить стало трудно. В 2003году она получила кредит в МЗФ «Микроинвест», в размере 70$. В то время её активы составляли 100$. Постепенно после получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования она увеличила товарооборот, расширила место деятельности и конечно же улучшила уровень жизни. В будущем планирует добавить в ассортимент другие виды товаров.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with one son and has been in the pharmacy business for 5 years. Her business is located in Kayunga Town. She has acquired a plot of land and wants to grow her pharmacy into a wholesale business. She wants to target the market as there is no wholesale drug shop in Kayunga.

In the future she hopes to open up a maternity wing because mothers - especially young ones- suffer a lot with complications during childbirth in Uganda. Expanding her business will enable her not only to help others but also to increase her income and help her support her family.

loans.use: To buy malaria drugs, pain killers, antibiotics and mosquito nets for wholesale trading.

loans.name: Saidahon

texts.en:
M. Saidahon is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She has been engaged in trade since 1999. Her business is trade of children's clothes and is located in Ckalovsk, Khujand. She brings her goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. She is divorced and lives with her parents. Her parents are pensioners, and she supports them financially.

Presently she has good turnover of her business. She says that her trade place is profitable as it situated in the passage of the market. Every person who comes to the market for purchases has a good opportunity to see all of her assortment, as she tries to arrange her goods on the walls at her trade place.

Of course she has days when she does not sell anything, but she does not worry. She always believes that tomorrow will be better then today. She has great plans for her future: she wants to increase her working capital and save enough money to buy her own shop in the center of Ckalovsk. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of $1200 for 14 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ashmatllah

texts.en: Ashmatllah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of three children. He was a driver and then he wanted to start selling cars. Now he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra basic materials he needs to expand his car sales. He wants to make a good income and save enough money to afford to send his three children to a good school in the future. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy extra basic materials

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs.Uch S., 47, is a widow and lives with her five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a small booth selling Vietnamese noodles, earning about $2/day in profit. Two of her children work at construction; another is employed at a factory, and one drives a horse cart transporting passengers.

Mrs. Uch S. plans to use the money from this loan to purchase a horse for her son to operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her son to operate his business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary and Sarah started their business in 2000 after finishing college. They pooled their capital and each contributed USD $200. Their stationery shop is well located in the town centre and it attracts a good number of customers. Over the years they have been growing and presently they have two computers and two photocopying machines. Their daily sales are about USD $200 and they think it will increase when they buy another computer and generator. They want to expand by buying the generator given the electricity problems currently experienced in the country. They also hope to start training people in computer skills, hence their need to buy a computer. They have joined hands together to be able to achieve their dream.

loans.use: Mary and Sarah want to buy a standby generator and a computer.

loans.name: Nghuon

texts.en: Mrs. Nghuon S. N., 50, is a widow and lives with her five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her oldest daughter (pictured here) work producing mortars and pestles made from stone and selling them to the wholesalers, earning together on average about $4 each day. Mrs. Nghuon S. N. has to support her four school-aged children who are currently in secondary school. She has humbly applied for a loan to enable her to purchase more stone and other raw materials to keep investing in her business, which is growing from day to day.

loans.use: To purchase stone and other raw materials for her business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Nghuon Sok Nghun has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is married with six children and has been in the tailoring business for 10 years. He makes gent’s suits and currently employs two people. He is the only one who makes gentlemen's suits for weddings in Kayunga, therefore he has market for his suits, but needs more money to be able to meet the growing demand. He therefore plans to buy new sewing machine and materials.

loans.use: Ibrahim wants to buy a new sewing machine and materials for making suits for gents.

loans.name: Gloria Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Gloria is single, in addition to being a teacher in a rural school she also sells used clothes. This is the first time she is requesting a loan, she plans on using this loan to buy construction material and buy more used clothes to resell. She sells them in a market in XaXai. She does not have children yet, but with her business she hopes to be able to help her future husband in supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria e solteira e e professora numa escola em uma zona rural.Para alem de ser professora ela tem o negocio de venda de roupa usada. e Faz este negocio durante o tempo em que nao esta a trabalhar.E a primeira vez que vai tomar dinheiro emprestado. Ela pretende usar este valor para juntar com os poucos rendimentos que ela tem para a compra de materia de construcao e adquirir mais fardos de roupa usada para a venda. Ela faz o seu negocio num mercado localizado na cidade de Xai-Xai.Ela ainda nao tem filhos. Pensa um dia casar ter e filhos. Com o seu negocio podera apoiar o possivel futuro marido nas despesas do lar.

loans.use: buy construction material and increase inventory

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Mrs. Nub N., 37, lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling bread in front of a secondary school, where a number of students pass by. She usually can make around $2/day in profit, while her husband can earn around $1/day from selling ice-cream in front of the school. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for transportation for their business needs, so that it is much easier and faster for them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for their business transportation needs

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Nub Nath has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Mateus V. is a hard working father of 7 children who are all in school. He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction material. He joined the FMD program in 2006. He has requested and repaid various loans which he used to buy essential articles for his home, now he wants to improve his house. He is in the 5th cycle of the program and has been a responsible borrower.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Mateus V. e trabalhador, ele quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra do material de construcao. Ele entrou para o programa de Credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006. Ele e casado e pai de 7 filhos todos a estudar. Os sucessivos emprestimos que tomou permitiram-lhe comprar alguns artigos para a sua casa e agora pensa em construir uma casa melhorada. Ele esta ja no quinto ciclo e tem sido um bom cliente.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Ricardo Camelane

texts.pt:
Ricardo M. was born and raised in the province of Inhambane, in the south. He is married father of 3 children all of whom are in school. He joined the FDM in 2006. Ricardo sells cell phone accessories, school materials and beauty products to support this family. His first loan was of 200$, now he is requesting a loan of 375$ in order to increase his inventory. Ricardo is determined and hard working. In the future he plans on saving enough money to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo M. e natural da Provincia de Inhambane ao Sul do Pais. ele e casado e tem 3 filhos. todos os sus filhos vao a escola. Entrou para o Programa de credito do FDM em 2006.Ele venda muma miscelaea de artigos tais como alguns acessorios para celulares, algum material escolar, e artigos de beleza para senhoras. O seu negocio esta a crescer. Por isso subiu de valor de $200 que tomara no ciclo anterior para $375 que vai tomar agora. Ele e um cliente muito empreendedor e determinado. No futuro com os rendimentos do negocio pensa melhorar a sua moradia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.en: Luz is a 33-year-old mother with a beautiful 7-year-old daughter and a second child due to arrive in a few months. Her husband works as a programming coordinator for a television station in Santo Domingo.  Luz buys silver jewelry wholesale and sells it to customers in her community.  She also sells makeup accessories.  She has come to us for a loan of $350 to acquire new inventory to sell, and to introduce gold-plated jewelry to her product line.  She’ll repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell and introduce gold jewelry to her product line

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Võ Thị Thịnh, 33 years old, lives in Nghi Trung, Nghi Lộc. She is a bridal make up artist for 5 years now. When she contracted her first loan from "Quỹ Tình thương" fund, she started a business selling shoes. In the following years, she had contracted bigger loans to invest in a bridal beauty salon. Her husband, Trần Thái Hòa, helps her out in his free time. They have a 6 years old son. Ms Thịnh's plan is to expand her bridal business. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy more make up accessories and bridal dresses

Translated from Vietnamese by Khanh Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Võ Thị Thịnh, 33 tuổi, sống tại xã Nghi Trung, Nghi Lộc làm nghề trang điểm cô dâu được 5 năm nay. Khi mới bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ Tình thương chị chỉ vay 75 USD về để buôn bán dày dép. Những năm tiếp theo chị vay mức vốn lớn đề đầu tư vào cửa hàng trang điểm cô dâu. Anh Trần Thái Hòa chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm việc đồng áng cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ trong công việc kinh doanh. Anh chị đang có 1 cháu trai lên 6 tuổi. Dự định của chị Thịnh là tiếp tục mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Chị đã làm đơn đề nghị vay 950 USD để mua dụng cụ trang điểm và áo cưới.

loans.use: buy wedding dress for hire, making up tool

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Having just a small piece of land and 2 kids to raise, things are very difficult for Ms Nguyễn Thị Định and her husband, Nguyễn Trọng Đại. Since Mr Đại became a demobilized soldier more than 20 years ago, the family's financial situation is fragile. Being that they did not have higher education, their wish is to be able to provide a good education for their children. So when "Quỹ Tình thương" fund got implanted in the district of Nghi Lộc in 2001, Ms Định jumped at her only chance to realize her wish. She contracted a loan of 75 USD to buy ducks for breeding. She made a small profit but that was a big motivation for her to continue. In 2004, she switched to beer brewing. This business is much more profitable. Her revenue from beer brewing is about 125 USD a month. Her wish had been realized: her 2 children are now attending university. She's requesting a new loan of 425 USD to expand her beer brewing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khanh Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chỉ trông vào mấy sào ruộng, việc nuôi 2 con ăn học là điều không dễ dàng đối với chị Nguyễn Thị Định. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Trọng Đại là bộ đội phục viên từ hơn 20 năm nay nên kinh tế gia đình rất khó khăn. Bản thân không được học hành nhiều nên hai anh chị rất muốn con cái được học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Một cơ hội để chị có thể thực hiện được ước muốn đó là khi Quỹ Tình thương về hoạt động tại huyện Nghi Lộc vào năm 2001. Chị đã tham gia và vay mức 75USD về chăn nuôi vịt. Số lãi ban đầu tuy ít ỏi nhưng là nguồn khích lệ lớn để chị vay những vòng vốn tiếp theo. Năm 2004, chị chuyển sang buôn bán bia hơi. Việc buôn bán này khiến thu nhâp gia đình tăng lên đáng kể. Hàng tháng chị Định thu về khoảng 125 USD. Mong muốn của chị Định đã và đang thành hiện thực: hai con chị hiện nay đều đang học đại học và cao đẳng. Sắp tới chị dự định vay 450 USD để tăng lượng bia bán ra hàng ngày.

loans.use: to put beer in her pub

loans.name: Antoli

texts.en:
Antoli is 44 years old and owns a small fried-foods store. She is well-known for her stuffing, kippers, donuts, yaniqueque (Johnny cake) and other foods. She has been in this business for a long time, and it has allowed her to provide her five children with a good education and also help her husband, who is temporarily unemployed. Their children all go to the local public school, where they also practice different kinds of sports.

Antoli feels this is a good time to expand her business and acquire new customers. She has come to us for a loan of $250 to give a brand-new face to her store and buy the new materials she needs to prepare a wider range of fried foods for her customers. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and acquire new customers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tư was one of the first member of the "Quỹ Tình thương" fund in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An. Her first loan was only 50 USD. She invested that money in vegetables farming being that vegetables are consumed a lot, they are always served in farmer's everyday meals. This vegetables farming business suits her fine in term of providing her a revenue and the ability to make payment toward her loan. During her 6 year membership, she always participates in the activities organized by "Quỹ Tình thương" and she fulfills her responsibilities in term of repayment. Ms Tư has 3 children, all married and having their own family. They want her to retire now that she is 55 years old. Ms Tư does not agree with them. Her reason is that she is still in good health so she would continue to work and to contribute to the society. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD to buy fertilizer and pigs to breed, in time for the new year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tư là một trong những người vay vốn đầu tiên của Quỹ Tình thương tại huyện Nghi Lộc, Nghệ An. Với mức vay ban đầu 50 USD chị đầu tư vào việc trồng rau vặt, một món ăn thường ngày trong bữa cơm của người dân nông thôn, Nghệ An. Đây là một công việc phù hợp với khả năng sử dụng cũng như hoàn trả của chị Tư. Trong 6 năm tham gia Quỹ chị luôn T.ân thủ đầy đủ quy định và tham gia mọi hoạt động chi nhánh tổ chức. 3 con chị hiện đã trưởng thành và có gia đình riêng đều muốn mẹ được nghỉ ngơi. Nhưng chị quan niệm còn lao động được còn là người có ích cho xã hội. Ở T.ổi 55 chị tiếp tục xin vay 325 USD mua phân bón cho vườn rau và một vài con lợn để bán trong dịp Tết.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and some pigs

loans.name: Gildo Jorge

texts.pt:
Gilda M. was born and raised in Inhambe. He joined the FDM program in 2006. He is married, and doesn't have any children yet, but he wants to have at least one in the future. Gilda sells tableware and kitchenware to support his family. With this loan he plans on increasing his inventory in order to keep up with demand. In the future, Gilda wants to save in order to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Gildo M. e natural da Provincia de Inhambane. Entrou para o Programa de credito do FDM em 2006. E casado mas infelizmente nao tem nenhum filho e ele gostaria de ter pelo menos 1 filho.Ele vende loica. Com o dinheiro do emprestimo quer aumentar as quantidades de loica a adquirir nos armazens para poder diversificar o tipo de louca que vende na sua banca de acordo com as exigencias dos seus clientes. No futuro pensa com os rendimentos melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.en: Rosa María is 33 years old, married and the proud mother of a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a self-employed blacksmith. She works as a saleswoman for an Italian company that sells hair-care products and accessories. In order to earn extra money, she also sells children's clothing, such as pants and underwear. Her business is doing very well, but now that she is a mother she would like to tap into her experience in sales to earn extra income. To achieve that goal, she has come to us for a loan of $350 to open a new business selling silver jewelery.  She will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To expand her business by offering a  new line of products

loans.name: Evelin Polanco

texts.en: Evelin Palanco is 23 years old, married and has a 7-year-old daughter. Her husband is a proud man who works in a law office. Evelin's life is very busy because she is a self-employed saleswoman who buys clothes in the capital and resells them in her town.  One way she attracts new customers is by allowing people to buy on credit and repay her at the end of the week. Demand for her clothes is high, and Evelin would like to expand her business -- and her income -- by acquiring new inventory. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $350, which she will repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy new products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carlos Guilherme

texts.pt:
Carlos Guilherme is a mechanic and lives in Xai Xai. He joined the program in 2005, since then his business has been doing well and he was able to start saving. He wants to improve the conditions of his house. He has 7 children of whom 4 are in school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos Guilherme vive em Xai-Xai e e mecanico. Ele entrou para o programa em 2005. Porque o negocio lhe corria bem ele conseguiu juntarrendimentos e agora quer construir uma casa melhorada. Ele tem 7 filhos dos quais 4 estao a estudar.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Mukarama

texts.en: Mukarama Nasretdinova is 45 years old, she holds secondary school education. She is married and has 5 children. After graduating, Mukarama studied a course in sewing. For fifteen years she has worked in an atelier as a sewer. Ten years ago she became interested in a business which her sister has started. Her sister sewed bags and sold them in a market. Mukarama first borrowed money from her sister and also started sewing bags and widened her business.  Currently she rents a booth in a market and sells bags. For the loan amount of $1000 the client is going to increase sales, buy new materials and renew the range of goods. Take into account that the client is selling bags in a market, her goods have big demand, and sellers and buyer can obtain bags for low prices. The client is going to pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: to increase a turnover, trough buying materials and begs for food and other necessary things

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet operates a retail shop in Kayunga Town which she has run for 5 years now. It started as a very small shop selling a few items but has now grown into a retail shop. She sells household items such as sugar, salt, rice, detergents, cooking fat, soft drinks and packed snacks. Her daily sales range between USD 50-90. She is located near the hospital, and people there are her major customers. She wants to start selling passion fruit juice because people go to the other side of town to buy the same. This will generate extra income and consequently improve the business and her living standards.

loans.use: Harriet wants to buy sugar, rice, cooking fat, wheat flour and a commercial juice mixer.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is a married woman with four children. She has been in business for the last seven years. She deals in shoes and clothes. She hopes to turn her shoe business into a wholesale shop to be able to sell in big quantities and therefore increase her income. She will also be able to supply many retail traders in Kayunga town, hence reducing their costs of shopping from Kampala which is 78 km away from Kayunga town. She anticipates sales of USD $70 daily after stocking the highly demanded shoes from China.

loans.use: Hanifa wants to buy two boxes of ladies' shoes and one box of children's shoes.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred deals in automobile parts, a business he has done for 13 years. He is married with two children and he is a member of Zinunula Group. He supplies mechanics around Kayunga with spare part batteries. He is locally based but internationally focused; that’s why he wants to venture into direct importation. He has earned some savings which he hopes to top up with this loan to be able to import batteries from Japan to be able to sell to his customers. This will increase his income. Additionally, the garages around Kayunga will benefit when their needs are met. He has paid back loans ranging from USD $200- $500 on time and he is an honest man.

loans.use: Fred wants to Import batteries from Japan to sell to garages around Kayunga and Mukono.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two grown children. She lives in Zaporozhye and owns a small kiosk in the local Malyi Rinok (“Small Market”). Valentina sells cosmetics at affordable prices. She has been in this business for 7 years. Currently, she has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly profit is about $600. 

Valentina is hoping to open a new vending facility which will allow her increase her sales. That is why she is requesting a loan of $1200.  Valentina is very enterprising and strong-willed and has learned to tackle all sorts of problems. She knows how to rise above failure and go on bravely. Valentina is determined to get more profit which would not only help her support her family but keep her business moving forward as well.

loans.use: To increase retail stock

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a grown daughter. They live in Primorsk. Tatyana runs a small retail business selling food items, like baked goods, beverages and snacks. Her business is located in the local vending pavilion called “Looch” (“Ray”). It’s a favorable location as there are no other markets in this area of Primorsk. Tatyana loves people, she works hard to meet the demands of her customers  by offering a wide variety of groceries. Presently, her turnover capital is about $4000. Monthly profits amount to about $1500. 

Tatyana would like to borrow $1200 to increase the assortment of her inventory, reconstruct her vending facility and add a few more vending stalls to her pavilion. She knows that success doesn’t come easy. However, she willingly embraces all the difficulties and challenges that come along the way. We believe Tatyana’s ability to think creatively and identify opportunities in her environment will help her succeed and repay the current loan.

loans.use: To reconstruct his vending facility and increase stock

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind, 55 years old, is married and a mother of 5 children. She lives in the city of Aley, in the mountains. Hind has been doing handicraft work since the age of 19. She produces beautiful and unique pieces of embroidery. Hind works upon request, but she also tries to participate in locA. fairs from time to time in order to keep her name known on the market. Through the revenue she receives from her work, Hind has been able to help her husband cover their family's basic needs and better their children's lives.

Hind has already received a loan from Majmoua in the past. This time, she needs a loan of $300 to buy the necessary materials to produce her embroideries.

Hind is part of a group loan with other women in her village. The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending theory is based on the idea that small loans and group solidarity help to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages collaboration in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool toward economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroidery work

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Senora Nilda B. is married to Jose Gerardo Gonzalez. She has a 3 year old son, and she works selling various household items, including pots and pans, plastic goods, glasses, plates, table clothes, etc. Her business is located in the Luque Market. She has been there for 2 years, and has a good customer base. She is requesting the loan to increase her inventory and her average sales. Her husband is a brick layer and works as an independent contractor. On his free days he helps with the business. She used the loan she received to buy merchandise such as kitchen furniture and haberdashery items.

La señora Nilda Bordón está casada con el señor José Gerardo González, tiene un hijo de 3 años y se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería y bazar. En él ellos tienen ventas de cacerolas, artículos de plásticos, vasos, cubiertos, platos etc. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de Luque donde tiene una buena clientela y opera en el ramo desde hace dos años. Ella solicitó el crédito para aumentar su inventario y así acrecentar su promedio de ventas. Su marido, quien es albañil y trabaja en forma independiente, en sus días libres le ayuda con la atención del negocio. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de mercaderías como ser menajes de cocina y artículos de mercería.

loans.use: Buy merchandise - kitchen furniture, plates, table clothes, plates, thread, needles, ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA., 39 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children. She lives in the city of Aley, in the mountains. NawA. specializes in handicraft and "crochet" work. She learned these skills from her mother and other family relatives. NawA.'s living conditions are not very good. Her husband is a daily worker and is not able to find a stable job. For a long time, NawA. has been the main family's bread-winner. She needs a $300 loan to purchase basic materiA. for her handicraft and crochet work.

NawA. is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually comprised of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending theory is based on the idea that group solidarity helps to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages collaboration in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool toward economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Purchase of material for her handicraft and "crochet" work

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Mrs. Eulalia is married to Mr. Sergio Camacho. She has four children and all of them work independently. For seven years she has been running a cafeteria, serving breakfasts and lunches to over 100 employees of the Nestlé company. She is requesting this loan to expand her business and in this way provide more comfort to her customers. In her cafeteria she prepares menus and lunches daily, and she also sells drinks and sweets, among other products.

For the past three years that she has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya, she has been a very responsible client. Her children who work independently are also clients of the Fundación.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Eulalia está casada con el señor Sergio Camacho. Tiene cuatro hijos y todos trabajan en forma independiente. Desde hace siete años ella se dedica al servicio de comedor, sirviendo desayunos y almuerzos a más de 100 empleados de la empresa Nestlé. Solicita el crédito para realizar una ampliación de su negocio así poder dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Ella prepara en su comedor minutas y el almuerzo diario, además de vender bebidas y golosinas entre otros productos.

Desde hace mas de 3 años que trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, siendo una cliente muy responsable. También sus hijos que trabajan en forma independiente y son clientes de la Fundación.

loans.use: To expand her commercial location.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with 6 children and is a poultry and dairy farmer. She has been in this business since 1998 and is a member of Twegatte Women’s Group where she works as the treasurer of the group. She hopes to buy feeds once given the loans and her future plan is to set up a modern farm at her home place in Bukeka. She supplies schools and some traders from Busia with eggs and the milk is sold to the local community.

loans.use: Judith wants to buy animal and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
