Basilio G. is 47 years old and married to Mrs. María Esquivel. He has three children who are currently enrolled in elementary school. Since 1998, he has dedicated himself to the raising of cattle as well as the production of construction materials such as brick, roof tiles and other products derived from clay. Don Basilio tells us that two years ago his wife began suffering from an illness that prohibits her from helping him with the business. He continues working with the help of his children who are learning the business along the way. Don Basilio hopes that his wife will recuperate soon and return to helping him there by allowing the continuation of their children's success in education. The loan will be used to purchase cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Christian G., Kiva Volunteer.

Basilio G. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado con la señora María Esquivel; tiene tres hijos y todos son menores de edad que están cursando la primaria. Desde 1998 se dedica al faenamiento de vacunos y además a la producción de materiales para la construcción, tales como ladrillos, tejas y otros productos derivados del barro cocido. Don Basilio nos cuenta que hace dos años su señora sufre de una enfermedad que la imposibilita de ayudarlo en el negocio; hoy en día sigue trabajando, pero con la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes de esta manera aprenden este oficio. Don Basilio tiene el deseo y la esperanza que su esposa se recupere y le pueda ayudar otra vez y así seguir educando a sus hijos para que puedan salir adelante. El préstamo lo utilizo para compra de vacas para faenar.

loans.use:
Purchase of cattle

compra de vacas para faenar

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina’s family consists of five children. Her husband works abroad and sends money monthly. Valetina’s child vary in age and since they all depend on her, she struggles to provide them with security, good health and all of their needs. The business is located on ‘Tarata y Esteban Arce’ street in the city of Cochabamba. The title for her booth is in her husband’s name. Valentina has many years of experience selling women’s clothing exclusively, especially items from Korea which are in highest demand. There exists a lot of competition but Valentina differentiates herself by paying close attention to her customers and is very capable in offering great styles, both imported and those ready for export. The merchandise she is looking to purchase if imported from Korea, is of varying prices, of high quality and fall in line with the current desired fashions. Valentina has proven that she is very loyal to our institution. This is her forth loan request and she has always demonstrated responsibility and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

Valentina tiene una familia compuesta por cinco hijos, el esposo trabaja en el extranjero y envía dinero en forma mensual para su familia. Los hijos de Valentina tienen diferentes edades y como todos dependen de ella, se esfuerza trabajando para brindarles seguridad, salud y para cubrir todas sus necesidades. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle Tarata y Esteban Arce de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene un puesto fijo que esta a nombre del esposo. Valentina tiene muchos años de experiencia en el rubro de la comercialización de prendas de mujer exlusivamente, de prefencia la que es de Industria Coreana, ya que son de mayor demanda en el mercado. Si bien existe mucha competencia en este rubro y en esa zona la diferencia se encuentra en la calidad de atención que brinda Valentina a sus clientes, es una persona muy hábil para ofrecer la ropa de mujer tanto importada como exportada. La mercadería que adquirirá es de damas, industria coreana, los precios son variables (un poco más elevados que la nacional), son de buena tela y acorde a las exigencias de la moda actual. Valentina es una cliente fiel a nuestra institución, ya que esta solicitud es la cuarta y siempre demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of Seasonal Merchandise

Compra de mercadería por temporada

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is married with three children who all are in primary school. She owns and operates a textile shop specializing in kid’s wear which she has done for the last three years. The shop is located in Kayunga Town. She plans to restock her shop with fast moving kidswear since Christmas is nearing. She is targeting the seasonal market.

loans.use: She wants to buy five bales of children cotton clothing.

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
Claudelina E. is 65 years old and widowed. She lives in her own house with her 4 children, all of them older. Even at her age, Claudelina really wants to work, as widowhood is double the responsibility to give a better quality of life to her children.

She has an inn where she sells milk and dairy products. She tells us that in 1992, she started selling milk in small quantities to her neighbors. As time passed she grew her customer base, as milk is well accepted, for the need that all creatures have to consume it, and more because it's a natural product. One of her children sells dairy products, this helps considerably with the income for the family.

She will use the loan to buy food supplements for the dairy cows. Their area, and almost the entire country, is suffering from a prolonged drought, and because of that the cows need supplemental food to be able to produce the milk that Claudelina hopes to sell to her customers.

Claudelina E. tiene 65 años de edad, es viuda, vive en casa propia con sus cuatros hijos, todos mayores de edad, a pesar de su edad se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar ya que al enviudar era doble la responsabilidad para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Tiene un tambo con la venta de leche y sus derivados. La señora Claudelina nos cuenta que en el año 1992 comenzó a vender leche en pequeñas cantidades a sus vecinos y con el correr del tiempo fue agrandando su clientela, ya que el producto que comercializa, es de gran aceptación, por la necesidad que tienen las criaturas de consumirla y más aún si es un producto natural. Con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos que se dedica a la venta de desmamantes de las lecheras, que también genera un ingreso considerable a la familia. El préstamo lo desea utilizar para la compra de forrajes para sus lecheras, ya que en la zona, y casi en todo el país, se está sufriendo de una gran y prolongada sequía y por lo tanto, las lecheras necesitan de suplementos alimenticios para poder producir la leche necesaria para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase food supplements for dairy cows

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro has a very large family with children of various ages. They are a very united family since they share the earnings of the businesses they are involved in. Isidro is experienced in construction. Due to the lack of skilled construction workers, Isidro finds himself in high demand. His wife and children have helped by selling refreshments in the pampa marketplace for several years. Working as a team has helped with their success. Isidro helps sell refreshments when not busy with construction jobs. The migration of skilled construction workers abroad has had little impact and qualified construction workers find a lot of demand for their work. The loan will be used to expand the refreshment business. As the warm season approaches, the family expects demands for their refreshments to increase. Isidro and his wife have sufficient credit history with various small financiers. They have aligned themselves with the institution and this is their forth loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidro tiene una familia muy grande con hijos de distintas edades, son una familia muy unida ya que comparten el trabajo y las ganancias que les aporta los negocios a los que se dedican. Isidro se dedica a la construcción es maestro albañil donde tiene mucha experiencia, actualmente la mano de obra es escasa en nuestro país y debido a esto es que tiene mucha demanda de trabajo. Por otra parte la esposa y los hijos venden refrescos en el mercado de la pampa desde hace varios años atrás y conocen muy bien su mercado, el trabajo en equipo hace que el mismo de buenos frutos, el esposo también colabora en la venta de refrescos cuando no tiene obras que hacer. La competencia debido a la fuerte migración de mano de obra a países extranjeros es mínima y por ello los albañiles calificados son bastante demandados. El dinero esta destinado a la ampliación del negocio de los refrescos, ya que como comienza la época de calor incrementará la demanda de los mismos. Isidro y su esposa tienen bastante experiencia crediticia en diferentes financieras pequeñas, pero ahora se fidelizaron con la Institución y la presente solicitud es la cuarta secuencia.

loans.use:
BUSINESS CAPITAL

CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena V. is 60 years old and lives in her own home. She is a widow and mother of six adult children; three of which are married. Elena tells us that since 1990 she has dedicated herself to the business of renting out chairs and tables that are used for various social events. As we previously mentioned, Elena became a widow at a very young age and had to shoulder the responsibility of supporting her family without the help from her husband. Her husband had started a business as a carpenter along with the help of their eldest son. Today, the business is in the hands of one of her sons. The loan will be used to purchase additional chairs and tables for her business. With the year’s end approaching, the demand to rent tables and chairs increases.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena V. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en casa propia, es viuda con seis hijos, todos mayores de edad; de los cuales tres ya esta casados. La señora Elena nos cuenta que desde el año 1990 se dedica a la actividad de alquiler de sillas y mesas para eventos sociales, particulares y otros. Como ya hemos mencionado anteriormente, Elena enviudó muy joven y tuvo que sobrellevar la responsabilidad de mantener su familia sin el respaldo de su marido, quien en vida tenía una pequeña carpintería, en donde por la necesidad de generar un ingreso para su familia, trabajó por un tiempo con su hijo mayor; hoy en día la carpintería sigue funcionando a cargo de uno de sus hijos. El préstamo lo utilizo para comprar sillas y mesas para alquiler ya que en épocas de fin de año aumenta la cantidad de demanda de alquileres.

loans.use:
Purchase of tables and chairs

Compra de sillas y mesas

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is married with three children and has been operating his business for the last three years. He employs five people who help him in his business. He sells Bagiya products (these are baked ring-like biscuits) in Kayunga Town. They are mainly bought by school children and thus he supplies ten school canteens around Kayunga town. He is very hard working he has bought a motorcycle and a plot from his savings. The motorcycle makes about USD $6.00 per day. He hopes to grow his business and therefore increase his income, while at the same time offering employment to young people in his village of Bukeeka.

loans.use: Steven would like to buy 30 cartons of wheat flour for making Bagiya products

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en: Anatoli is married with five children all in secondary school. He sells bicycle spare parts and repairs bicycles. His business is located in Bukeeka Village on the way to Lake Kyoga where most of the fish in Kayunga market is caught. He has operated this business for the last five years. He repairs bicycles and sells spare parts. His main customers are the fish mongers and they come from Kayunga town, as well as Bukeeka Village where a majority of members in the village own bicycles. The loan will help him to restock the spare parts and hence be able to meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: Sanyu wants to buy bicycle spare parts tyres, spokes, ball bearings, and break shoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca H. is 62 years old and is married to Mr. Francisco Jimenez, with whom she has 3 adult children. They live in the San Francisco neighborhood of the city of Ybycui. Both come form humble backgrounds and Francisca took a job as a domestic worker early on to help her husband, who manufactured and sold charcoal briquettes, support their family.

Because their combined income was not enough to provide for their children and keep them in school, Francisca borrowed money from a sister who lived and worked in Argentina to start a new business seliing clothes door to door. Soon she was able to rent a small space and her business grew as she was able to offer a larger inventory.

This loan will be used to purchase more seasonal clothing to meet her clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca H. tiene 62 años de edad y está casada con el Señor Francisco Jiménez; tienen tres hijos, todos ellos mayores de edad, viven en el barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Ybycuí.

Ambos provienen de familias muy humildes y como una alternativa para ayudar a su marido para la manutención de su familia consiguió trabajo como empleada domestica, ya que su marido se dedicaba a la fabricación y venta de carbón vegetal, actividad que no generaba tanto ingreso ya que dejaba poca ganancia.

Viendo la necesidad, como sus hijos ya iban creciendo y debían estudiar, y sus ingresos no eran suficientes, se animó a pedirle prestado a su hermana que trabajaba en Argentina un pequeño capital para iniciar una nueva actividad, la venta de ropas casa por casa, en poco tiempo llegó a montar un pequeño salón y así aumentó su negocio. Hoy día con mayor cantidad de inventario de mercaderías.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ropas de temporada, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes y el negocio es rentable.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, such as polo and dress shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Ilda Clara Salvador

texts.pt:
Ilda is a widow. She lives with her 3 children, in a neighborhood near the city of Xaixai. She joined the Women's fund for development in 2006, she started her business of raising and selling chickens. Ilda is now in the 3rd cycle of the program. She is requesting this loan to buy more chicken feed and vaccines.

If the business continues to grow she plans on buying more chicken and more chicken coops. Her children are all in school, the 2 oldest are in pre-university preparations school. Ilda's in-laws live in another city and cannot help her supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilda e viuva. Vive com os seus tres filhos num bairro periferico da cidade de Xai-Xai e e trabalhadora. Ela entrou para o programa de credito do FDM em 2006, altura em que iniciou o negocio de criacao e venda de frangos. Ela agora esta no terceiro ciclo. Com o valor que pretende tomar ela quer comprar racao e vacinas para os pintos que acaba de meter na capoeira.

Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem como tem sido ate entao , ela pretende aumentar as suas capoeiras para poder meter uma maior quantidade de pintos relativamente aos que tem metido ate entao. Isto porque a demanda esta a crescer. Os seus filhos todos estao a estudar estando os dois mais velhos no ensino Pre-universitario. Os sogros de Ilda vivem numa outra Provincia e nao tem condicoes de apoia-lo no sustento dos filhos.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed and vaccines

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Nambooze has been a client for the last ten (10) years. She operates a shop in Kayunga District, in a small trading center called Bukoloto. Margaret is a good client who knows how to allocate her money. She sells used clothes which she buys from Kampala. She has been able to graduate from moving from one market to the other selling her clothes, to getting a shop where she operates from consistently. The shop she operates in was as a result of saving and loans she obtained from Feed The Children Uganda for the last ten years. She started with a loan of USD $30 and to date, she services loans of USD $800. She sells her clothes to both retailers and wholesale customers.

loans.use: Margaret wants to buy six bales of ladies dresses and skirts.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica is a single mother of two children: a boy and a girl. She decided to start her own business to be able to support her children, to provide them with education, food and shelter. She began her business two years ago, selling products by catalog and then she began helping a friend sell shoes and later continued to do so independently. Her business allows her to cover her family's expenses. She wants to continue growing her business to improve her quality of life and success of her children.

Veronica is requesting a $250 loan which she will use to buy merchandise and offer products more rapidly as well as fill her pending orders. She plans to repay the loan within 5 months. She and her children thank you very much for helping them succeed.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos una mujer y un hombre, es por ellos y la necesidad de mantenerlos y darles educación, alimento y vivienda, que decidió poner su propio negocio, esto fue hace dos años atrás empezando a vender productos por catálogo y luego comenzó a vender zapatos ayudándole a una amiga y luego ya siguió por su cuenta, con su negocio a podido solventar los gastos de su familia y desea seguir creciendo con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y así sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

Verónica esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y así poder ofrecer sus productos de manera más rápida y cumplir con los pedidos que ya tiene, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y sus hijos te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma J. is 45 years old and is married to 47-year-old Ramon Ruiz. They have five children; four have moved away from home and one attends high school. In 1995, Irma started a small grocery store with her husband's help. He had to immigrate to Argentina to work and save enough capital to get started.

After 3 years, don Ramon returned home and they started their small business. At first they only sold staples, such as yerba mate, rice, sugar, soap and cooking oil. Later, as they were able to reinvest their earnings, they added a small dining room where they serve fast foods and even have catered events on their large patio on Saturdays. Thanks to these activities they have been able to finance their children's studies and live with a measure of dignity.

This loan will be used to purchase rice, sugar, meats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma J. tiene 45 años de edad, está casada con Ramón Ruiz, de 47 años, tienen cinco hijos; uno de sus hijos está en la secundaria y cuatro restantes ya viven en casa diferentes. Irma empezó a montar una despensita en el año 1995 con la ayuda de su marido, quien tuvo que emigrar a la Argentina para poder trabajar y conseguir un capital inicial. Luego de tres años el Señor Ramón volvió a su país y comenzaron con el negocio, en principio en la despensita vendían productos varios, tales como, yerba mate, arroz, azúcar, jabón, aceite, entre otros, ya con un capital adquirido del propio negocio empezaron a montar un pequeño comedor de comidas rápidas e incluso realizaban eventos los días sábados, ya que tenían un patio amplio, gracias a esta actividad está pudiendo solventar los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y llevar una vida digna. El crédito lo utilizará en la compra de azúcar, arroz, carne, etc.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, meats, etc.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
My name is Glenda, and I'm dedicated to selling seasonings and spices. I buy these in bulk in large bags and then I divide them up into smaller bags to sell in convenience stores, markets and to neighbors. The income allows me to help with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me llamo Glenda y me dedico a la venta de condimentos, estos los compro en bolsas grandes y luego lo divido en bolsas pequeñas para vender en pulperias, mercaditos y vecinos. Los ingresos que percibo me ayudan con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase seasonings, bags and other items.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is mother to four children who still live at home. She lost her husband five years ago and lives alone with her children. Her small grocery is located in her home, where she also has a storage space that she rents out to street vendors who work the "La Hoyada" market. This provides her with additional income to help cover her expenses.

She never looked back, even after losing her husband, and always had faith in her will power and desire to move forward after widowhood. She currently would like to borrow $500 to buy inventory for her grocery store and to expand her storage area so that she can rent additional space to the market vendors. She will repay the loan over a period of six months. In order to reach her goals, she appeals to all generous hearts to help her secure this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia es madre D. 4 hijos a los que aún cobija en el seno D. su hogar, hace 5 años sufrió la pérdida D. su esposo y actualmente vive sola en su casa aquí esta ubicada su bodega y un pequeño almacén que acondicionó para guardar los productos D. los vendedores D. mercado D. “La hoyada”, en calidad D. guardianía; actividad que le genera un ingreso extra para cubrir algunos gastos. A pesar D. la ausencia D. esposo nunca dió marcha atrás, siempre confió en su voluntad y fe para progresar tal como lo demostró desD. que quedó viuda. Actualmente necesita D. 500 dólares para poder adquirir productos D. primera necesidad, mejorar la bodega y ampliar el almacén D. guardianía y se compromete a devolverlos en un plazo D. 6 meses, tiempo más que suficiente para cumplir con su compromiso crediticio. Para llevar a cabo su propósito apela a cada uno D. los generosos corazones con el deseo D. obtener pronto una respuesta positiva.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her grocery store and to make improvements to the space

loans.name: Yazmin Alejandra

texts.es:
Yazmin is an enterprising single woman with high hopes of moving ahead in life. She started her business because she had no other means of paying for her education. Her mother helps her make and sell corn tortillas, and part of the money goes to helping her parents with household expenses as well as her education. She started two years ago after helping her mother make tortillas at home and decided to turn it into a business. Little by little, she has become better known and has taken on more customers.

Yazmin is requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase ingredients to make the tortillas as well as a new stove to increase production. She plans to repay the loan within five months. She is very grateful for your support in helping her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yazmin es una mujer soltera muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante en la vida, ella empezó con su negocio por que no tenía los medios económicos para poder pagarse sus estudios, por lo que decidió trabajar para poder estudiar, su mamá le ayuda en su negocio de venta de tortillas de harina, ya con su negocio aparte de pagarse sus estudios ayuda a sus papas con los gastos del hogar, empezó hace 2 años atrás ayudándole a su mamá a hacer tortillas para su casa y ella fue la que decidió poner el negocio, y poco a poco se ha hecho conocida y tiene cada vez más clientes.

Yazmin esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y además para poder comprarse una estufa nueva que le ayuda mucho para agilizar la producción de sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella te agradece mucho tu apoyo para continuar con su negocio y poder crecer con el mismo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and a new stove

loans.name: Baba

texts.en: Baba is 45 years old and married with seven children.  He runs a small business selling groceries in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Although Baba’s shop looks well stocked, most of the goods are taken on credit and it is more expensive than when the goods are purchased in cash.  In addition he pays his installments on a daily basis. With seven children Baba spend most of his profit on school fees.  He is planning to increase his stock and build his own capital and for these reasons, he is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase inventory with cash to avoid losing profits by taking credit.

loans.name: Betty Emerita

texts.en:
Mrs. Betty is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the district of la Peca, Province of Bagua, Department of Amazonas. She is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Bagüinas and sells fruits for a living. She started her own business in order to be in control of her own income and to improve her quality of life and that of her family. The business is growing more every day, which allows her to cover all the necessities for her and her family. In the future, she is aiming to acquire her own kiosk and she is working hard in order to accomplish that goal, so she can employ other people. With a recent loan for S/. 500.00 (Approximately US$160.00) obtained from Manuela Ramos, she will purchase a larger amount of fruits such as apples, grapes, peaches, pears, oranges in boxes and by the hundreds. She is also into the production of extract from NONI (fruit with healing attributes) among others. Her business requires her to be well supplied in order to satisfy the needs of her customers from the surrounding area, considering that she receives weekly purchasing orders from public organizations and from villagers from nearby districts.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Betty tiene 25 años, vive con su cónyuge y una hija en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, Departamento de Amazonas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bagüinas y se dedica a la venta de frutas, inició su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. El negocio esta creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades tanto de ella y de su familia. Para el futuro quiere tener un kiosco propio, para lo cual está trabajando bastante, y de esta manera llegar a cumplir su objetivo y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.) comprará más cantidad de frutas como manzanas, uvas, duraznos, peras, naranjas en cajas y cientos. También se dedica a la producción de extracto de NONI (fruta curativa) entre otros, ya que necesita tener su negocio bien surtido para atender a sus clientes de la misma localidad, pues tiene pedidos semanales de entidades publicas y de pobladores de los distritos aledaños.

loans.use: Buying fruits for wholesale.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.en:
Isidoro L. is 38 years old, married to Mrs. Luciana Viveros, and is the father of 3 children, one in secondary school and the other two in elementary school. They all live in his mother-in-law’s house, located in downtown Acahay. In order to open his grocery store in 1990, he was supported by his parents and relatives. He started with a small amount of capital and supplied his small grocery store with basic foods such as: pasta, rice, sugar, mate, flour and others. It has been a great success, since it is located in a well populated neighborhood and these products are daily essentials. In addition to the aforementioned activity, Isidoro works as a middleman selling bricks and other materials in the construction industry. This is a very important supplementary income in order to improve the quality of life for him and for his family. The loan will be used for purchasing groceries, and bulk products to be packed for selling, such as rice, flour, sugar, corn, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidoro L. tiene 38 años de edad, casado con la señora Luciana Viveros, tienen 3 hijos, uno de los hijos está en la secundaria, y los otros dos en edad escolar. Todos viven en la casa de su suegra en el centro de la ciudad de Acahay. Para poder empezar a montar la despensa, en el año 1990, con la ayuda de sus familiares, padre y madre, comenzó con un pequeño capital, desde ahí Isidoro empezó a surtir su pequeña despensa con productos de primera necesidad, tales como: fideo, arroz, azúcar, hierba mate, harina, y otros, con gran éxito por la ubicación ya que está en un barrio muy habitado y estos productos son necesarios para la comida diaria. Además de esta actividad, Isidoro trabaja como intermediario en la venta de ladrillos y demás materiales para la industria de la construcción, esta actividad es un suplemento muy importante para poder aumentar su ingreso y aumentar su nivel de vida y la de su familia. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías, productos a granel y envasarlos para su venta tales como arroz, harina, azúcar, maíz, etc.

loans.use: Purchasing rice, flour, sugar, corn, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata J. sells cosmetics in the open air market in Magburaka, Sierra Leone.  Forty seven years old and a mother of four children, she assists her husband to pay some of the family expenses.  She would like to increase her stock to generate more income.  She needs a loan of $200

loans.use: Increase her cosmetics business to help her family earn more income.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Señora Carmen is a native of Bague, is 38 years old, and has two young children. She belongs to El Alto Mayo Community Bank, and works in the business of selling clothing and undergarments to women, men, and children. Her shop in located in the second block of the Central Market in the city of Rioja, in the Department of San Martín. She has carried out this work for some 15 years. Señora Carmen is very kind and attentive to her clients, and is occupied in pulling her business forward for the benefit of her family and to be an example to her children. The loan of 3,000 Sol (US$964) recently approved for her by Manuela Ramos is marked for the purchase of several dozen undergarments for girls (4 dozen), several different types of jeans for women and men (2 dozen for each) and boys and girls (1 dozen each), and dress pants for children and adults (1 dozen for each). She seeks to satisfy her clients in all their tastes and to always be on the sharp edge of fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmen, es natural de Bagua, tiene 38 años de edad y 2 hijos, ambos menores de edad. Pertenece al Banco Comunal El Alto Mayo, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, así como ropas interiores. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central (2do piso) de la ciudad de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Desempeña esta actividad hace 15 años. La señora Carmen se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes, se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para sus hijos. El reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 3,000 (US$ 964.00 aprox.), lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores por docenas, para niñas (04 docenas), pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros (02 docenas de cada uno), para niños y niñas (01 docena de cada uno), polos deportivos para caballeros (02 docenas), blusas sport para damas (02 docenas), pantalones de vestir para niños y adultos (01 docena de cada uno). Busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater clothing stock

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Isabel is 57 years old and has 5 children. She belongs to the Ayaymaman Community Bank, and works in the sale of floral arrangements. She decided to start her enterprise because she liked the business and was the first to open a market for flowers in Moyabamba, Department of San Martín. With a loan of 2,000 Sol (US$643) approved by Manuela Ramos , Isabel will purchase a greater volume of flowers, of better diversity, which she will take in from the capital of Lima and abroad from Ecuador, as well as accessories and preservatives to prepare the flower arrangements so she can better attend to her clients with her quality work. She is also considering purchasing clothing bundles to put on sale in her space at market. One of her daughters now helps her in the business and in the upkeep of their home. Her goal is to expand the business since, grace of its transactions, she is also able to help other people (housing and food to two elderly persons and two children).

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Isabel, tiene 57 años y 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayaymaman, se dedica la venta de arreglos florales. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque le gusta el negocio y fue la primera en abrirse camino en el negocio de las flores en Moyabamba, Departamento de San Martín. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ( US$ 643.00 aprox.), comprará flores al por mayor, de diversas variedades que son traídas de la capital (Lima) y de fuera del país (Ecuador), así como accesorios y conservantes para preparar los arreglos florales y atender bien a sus clientes con un trabajo de calidad. También piensa invertir en la compra de ropa usada por fardos para ponerlo a la venta en sus puestos de venta que tiene en el mercado. Una de sus hijas ahora le apoya en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, su meta es crecer en el negocio porque gracias a esta actividad ella también puede apoyar a otras personas (brinda casa y comida a 2 ancianos y 2 niños).

loans.use: Purchase of greater inventory of flowers

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is thirty four years old and sells cotton materials in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same town and as parents they are trying to provide a good life for their family.  This mother is interested in expanding her business and is asking for a loan of $175.

loans.use: To expand her clothing sales in the market.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa K. is fifty five years old and married with six children.  He owns a small store selling onions in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loan Mustafa would some times buy fresh vegetables from the village and supply them to the market women.  This is because he wants to diversify his business for more profit. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $350. He said, it is more profitable to access loans from SMT than to take goods on credit from the big merchants.

loans.use: Diversify his business by purchasing fresh vegetables and supplying them to the market vendors.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 49 years old and has five children. She's a member of the Entrepreneurial Women Community Bank and lives in the Moyobamba district of San Martin province. She supplies food stands and kiosks with fast foods, tamales, humitas (according to Wikipedia, in Peru and principally in the central Andes region, humitas are prepared as savory dishes with fresh corn combined with lard, salt, and fresh cheese or with fresh corn with lard, sugar, cinnamon and raisins for a sweet dish. Peruvian humitas are prepared with corn wrapped in corn husks and can be cooked in boiling water, placed in a pachamanca oven, or steamed), juanes (similar to a tamal, except made with rice, spices, a stuffing, and wrapped in the leaf of the bijao, or Heliconia bihai, an Amazonian plant often seen in florist shops because of its extravagant flowers. The stuffing can be fish, chicken, or even simply yuca). She also caters events such as weddings and birthdays. In addition to her catering and food sales, Isabel sells shoes.

She decided to start this business because it is profitable, she enjoys doing it, and her cooking is well received. This way she generates her own income and helps support her home and family. She is very happy with her work because it has allowed her to educate her children. Her goal is to expand by opening a small grocery store and snack shop, thus creating more jobs in her community.

She will use this loan to purchase the ingredients for her products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, chickens and spices) in wholesale quantities. She will also purchase an inventory of shoes in various sizes and models to meet her clients' demand. Her daughter, who lives in Chiclayo, helps her mother by sending her orders from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en el distrito de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de refrigerios, atiende a kioscos y snaks, abastece con tamales, humitas y juanes, también atiende con este servicio a instituciones, eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc., paralelamente se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Decidió iniciar este negocio porque se dió cuenta de que es rentable y le agrada, y que su sazón tiene buena acogida. De esta manera genera sus propios ingresos y aporta en la economía de su hogar. Está muy contenta con lo que hace porque esta actividad le permitió educar a sus hijos, su meta es crecer en el negocio, tener un negocio de abarrotes (bodega) y un snack, con ello poder dar trabajo a más personas. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1000.00 ($ 321.00 aprox.), comprará los ingredientes básicos para la elaboración de juanes, tamales y humitas (sacos de arroz, botellas de aceite en gran cantidad, huevos por javas, gallinas y condimentos), también comprará zapatos en variedad de números y modelos para atender los pedidos de sus clientas, actividad que le apoya su hija quien vive en Chiclayo y desde allá le envía los pedidos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for her catering business.  To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is the young mother of three. She has sold general goods since she was a girl. She now keeps a stall at La Hoyada market where two of her children help her. The third child is in school and takes care of himself. Isabel's husband helps to support the family by selling goods on the Ucayali River. They work together to provide a good life for their children and dream of seeing them complete their education and becoming successful professionals. They also hope some day to buy their own stall in the market. Isabel is asking for a loan of $975 to buy the merchandise her customers ask her for daily and to finance her husband's river trading. The whole family is grateful for your generosity and eagerly awaits your answer.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es una joven madre de tres hijos, la actividad que realiza desde muy temprano es la venta de productos de pasamanería, con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos en el mercado de “La Hoyada” ya que uno de ellos estudia y se mantiene por sí mismo. De manera adicional para contribuir con los gastos familiares su esposo se dedica a la venta de mercaderías y artículos diversos durante los viajes que realiza por el río Ucayali, de esa manera los dos colaboran con la educación de sus hijos y tratan de incrementar su calidad de vida.Isabel contempla como uno de sus planes más importantes para el futuro hacer que sus dos menores hijas lleguen a ser profesionales y además poder comprar un espacio propio dentro D. mercado donde actualmente ofrece estos productos.Isabel solicita 975 dólares para poder comprar la mercadería que le hace falta para cumplir satisfactoriamente con cada uno de los requerimientos que a diario le comunican sus clientes y para incrementar el capital D. negocio que administra su esposo cuando viaja por tan majestuoso río.Todos y cada uno de los miembros de esta familia agradecen tu generosidad y esperan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To stock a general store.

loans.name: Blasa

texts.es:
Blasa describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of three. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a sowing business to help him with household expenses, since she wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after she learned the trade she was offered a job. As time went on, the owner passed away, and Blasa always remembered how the owner had encouraged her to start her own business. So that's what she did, installing a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business.

Blasa is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests. The end of the year is fast approaching, and that is when demand is at its highest. She plans to repay the loan within five months. Blasa and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Blasa es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como obrero, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, tiene 3 hijos y decidió poner su negocio de costurera para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que quería que sus tres hijos tuvieran educación y con el sueldo de su esposo eso no se podía, ella empezó ayudándole a una señora que tenía un taller de costura y cuando terminó sus estudios de corte y confección le ofrecieron trabajo en ese taller, al pasar el tiempo la señora que la contrató falleció y siempre recuerda que esa señora la alentaba a que ponga su propio negocio y eso hizo, instalando su pequeño taller en su casa y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y a podido crecer con su negocio.

Blasa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar materia prima con la cual pueda realizar sus trabajos que le solicitan sus clientes sobre todo en esta época que se acerca fin de año y mucha gente demanda a hacer ropa, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por tu apoyo a que pueda continuar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase dressmaking materials

loans.name: Isata

texts.en: Thirty year old Isata T. is married with three children.  She started her business five years ago.  She sells items such as macaroni, tomato paste, and chicken stock.  With her profit, she assists her husband in meeting some of the family expenses. She is interested in expanding her business and in the future would like to rent a small grocery shop in the town of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: To achieve her dream of owning her own grocery shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 33 years old. She is married and has three children - all young boys. She is part of the Communal Bank Alto Mayo. She sells fresh vegetables in the Grau market, in the district of Rioja in San Martin. She has had this business for 6 years. To be able to offer the fresh vegetables she goes every dawn to a place in Cajamarca to purchase them, she also counts on a refrigerator to keep them fresh. Maria has always worried about the wellbeing of her family, and this motivated her to develop an activity that would give her income to support her home. She is characterized by her dedication, perseverence and optimism. With the recent loan received by Manuela Ramos for $160, she will buy more vegetables in cases, for example tomatoes, onions, potatoes, as well as lettuce, cilantro and other fresh vegetables by the kilo

La señora Maria tiene 33 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos varones (todos menores de edad), pertenece al Banco Comunal El Alto Mayo. Se dedica a la venta de verduras fresca en el Mercado Grau del Distrito de Rioja, en el Departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a este negocio hace seis años. Para poder ofertar las verduras frescas se traslada a comprar todas las madrugadas a la localidad de nuevo Cajamarca, además cuenta con una refrigeradora que le permite mantener frescas las verduras. Siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar familiar y eso la impulsó a desarrollar una actividad que le permita tener ingresos para aportar en su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser dedicada, perseverante y optimista. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.), comprará más verduras en cajas como por ejemplo tomates (01 caja diaria), cebollas, papas, betarraga, zanahoria en sacos de 50 Kg. (1 a 2 sacos diarios aproximadamente), además de lechuga, culantro, repollo y otras verduras frescas por kilos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Thanks to the help I have received in the past I've been able to improve my business, which sells personal hygiene products and cosmetic items, a little bit. My sales have increased because I've been able to better supply my business, and customers like the new products. I also sell some candy and drinks because I needed to stock my store a little more so it could grow. Thanks to the income, I've improved my family's finances a little bit. I need your help to keep my business growing and provide my children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a la ayuda recibida he podido acrecentar mi negocio un poco mas, mis ventas mejoraron ya que surti mi negocio y las personas les gustaron los nuevos productos. Tambien vendo algunos dulces y refrescos por lo que necesito surtir un poco mas el negocio para crecer. Gracias a los ingresos que he percibido he mejorado un poco mi ingreso familiar, necesito su ayuda para seguir creciendo y darles una mejor vida a mi hijos.

loans.use: Purchase personal hygiene products and other items.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. is running a small business in the market of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same town.  The couple work together to make ends meet.  Previously Kadiatu was engaged in selling onions and some vegetables.  With her previous loan, she diversified her business by including tomato paste, cooking oil, rice and curry powder.  At forty two years of age, with three children, her dream is to provide them with the best education.  She said  she would like a loan of $175 to allow her to  purchase the business items on wholesale to make more profit.

loans.use: Diversification of her business to increase her family's profits.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu S. is a forty five year old widow with four children.  Being the sole bread winner, she does gardening in the village to supplement her business income.  She decided to live in Magburaka town so her children could access education.  She invested her previous loan in hiring laborers to work in her garden while part of the loan was used to run her small business of selling peanut butter, sugar and onions.  She planted rice and vegetables and sells the surplus.  She said the petty trade enables her pay her loan installments before the harvest.  She therefore needs a loan of $175 to expand her petty trading for more profit that will be invested in the farm in the coming season.

loans.use: Expand her petty trading business to generate profits for her farm.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Luz and I have a small tire-repair shop. I've had this business for four years. I learned how to repair tires to give my customers a quality service, and they enjoy it when they come to see me because of the personal attention I give them. Demand for my services is high, since vehicles have tire problems every day. I'm very grateful for your support in helping my business grow so I can help my family out even more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola me llamo Luz y tengo un pequeño taller donde reparamos llantas de vehiculos, este lo tengo desde hace 4 años, he aprendido a reparar llantas para dar a mis clientes mejor servicio, ya que ellos se sienten a gusto cuando me visitan y les atiendo personalmente. La demanda del servicio es grande ya que a diario hay vehiculos reparando sus llantas. Les agradecere su ayuda para poder hacer que mi negocio crezca y de esta manera poder ayudar a mi familia un poco mas.

loans.use: Purchase materials to repair tires.

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba considers herself a very honest, hardworking, and nice person. She is married and her husband is a merchant. They have 3 children. She began her business because her husband used to be a security guard, and the salary he received wasn’t enough to support the family. Little by little, they got together some capital. Then her husband came down with a heart condition, and he could no longer work. They decided to invest their capital by buying small commercial properties and then renting them out. This was due to a stroke of good luck, because a friend of her husband’s offered them a piece of land at a good price and they were able to buy it. They began by building one small property and with the rent they received from that, they continued building. They now have 4 properties.

Columba is requesting a loan of $550.00 to remodel and make some repairs at one of their properties. They would also like to put a bathroom in another building, because it doesn’t have one. She offers to repay the loan in 5 months. She thanks you for your support in helping her to maintain this business and provide good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Columba se considera una mujer muy honesta, trabajadora y simpática, esta casada y su esposo es comerciante, ellos tienen 3 hijos, ella inició su negocio por que su esposo antes era vigilante y el sueldo que percibía no les alcanzaba para mantener a su familia y poco a poco juntaron un capital y su esposo enfermo del corazón, así que ya no podía trabajar, por ello invirtieron su capital en la compra de locales comerciales pequeños para luego rentarlos, y todo fue por oportunidad, ya que el amigo de su esposo les ofreció un terreno a un buen precio y pudieron adquirirlo, iniciaron construyendo un localcito y con la renta del mismo continuaron construyendo y a la fecha ya tienen 4 locales.

Columba ahora esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para remodelar y darle mantenimiento a sus locales, así como construirle el baño a uno de los locales que le hace falta, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella agradece mucho tu apoyo para continuar manteniendo su negocio y brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To remodel and make repairs to her business properties

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en: Idrissa is thirty two years old and married with four children. He runs a clothing and plastic sandals shop in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  He has been in business for more than five years. He would like to increase his stock for the Christmas season sales.  He said it will be season to make a good profit, therefore one should have good stock of clothes, with attractive fashions to attract more customers.  For these reasons he is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Increase his stock of clothing in anticipation of high demand during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Delvin

texts.en: Delvin owns a general store in the town of Magburaka, in Sierra Leone.  Married with four children, he buys his stock on credit.  “Though my stock levels look good, most of it was purchased on credit and this means a very small profit” said Devin.  “I need to have my own capital” he added.  His previous loan helped him purchase some goods in cash and the monthly repayments gave him the opportunity to start building his capital.  For this reason, he wants a loan of $350.

loans.use: Purchase his stock with cash to increase his profits.

loans.name: Mirely

texts.es:
Mirely is 42 years old and has 3 children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Flor del Mani. She lives in the district of Soritor, in San Martin. She has a business selling starch and its derivatives both wholesale and retail, which is sent to the coast to supply the customers in the region. She decided to start her business to be able to manage her own income, sustain her family and be an important person in life.

She is very content with what she does, because this business has permitted her to acquire many of her things. Her goal is to grow the business, buy a piece of land to have more space where she can dry her products, and be able to give work to the people who help her in this labor.

With the loan for Manuela Ramos, she will buy 10 hectares of yuca to attend to her clients even during the times when this product is scarce, because her customers are very demanding and she likes to be in good standing with them. She will also invest in the maintenance of her grating machine, and buy more calamine to dry the starch, as well as other materials necessary for the production of her product.

La señora Mirely tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Flor del Maní, vive en el Distrito de Soritor, en el Departamento de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de almidón y derivados al por mayor y menor, los cuales son enviados a la costa así como también abastece a clientes de la región. Decidió iniciar su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos, ser el sustento de su familia y una persona importante en la vida. Está muy contenta con lo que hace porque ésta actividad le ha permitido adquirir muchas de sus cosas, su meta es crecer en el negocio, comprar un terreno para tener mas espacio donde secar su producto debido a que creció el número de sus clientes, y así también poder dar trabajo a personas quienes la apoyan en esta labor. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000.00 ( $ 964.00 aprox. ), comprará 10 hectáreas de yuca para atender a sus clientes, a pesar de los tiempos en el que este producto escasea, por que tiene clientes muy exigentes y le gusta quedar bien con ellos, también invertirá en el mantenimiento de su máquina ralladora y en la compra de más calaminas para el secado del almidón y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboración de este producto.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase yuca and materials.  Maintenance for the grating machine.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
This is a follow-up to a previous loan. Thank to the support I have received in the past, I have been able to increase my sales. Now I need to better stock my business since Christmas time is approaching and my customers are looking to purchase clothing and small gifts at good prices. I need to purchase lotions, creams, shampoos and clothing to meet their demands. I'm grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Este es un credito subsiguiente, gracias al apoyo que he recibido he podido acrecentar mis ventas, ahora necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que vienen la temporada navideña y las personas buscan comprar ropa a buenos precios, igual que pequeños regalitos. Necesito comprar lociones, cremas, shampoo y ropa por lo que les agradecere su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase personal hygiene products and clothing for men, women and children.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha Roman is 26 years old and married to Pablo Olmendo who is 32 years old. They live in a neighborhood called Corazon de Jesus. They have their own house, and do not have any children yet. At one point, they had to emigrate to Argentina because in their village they had no opportunities for work nor to progress, so they took that detour. Mirtha had the good luck to find good employement as a housekeeper for a family. With great effort and sacrifice, getting through bad times, they were able to get the money to realize their only goal, to return to their country, start their own small business, improve the quality of their lives, and not have to leave their native city again. They returned to Paraguay, and thanks to their savings they began to buy and sell domestic appliances. In a short time they secured a good customer base, visiting them house to house and offering them very good prices. Today they also have exclusivity for a brand of motorbikes to sell to their customers. Mirtha would like to increase the volume of their business, and with the loan they will buy refrigerators, as they have various requests for the summer.

Mirtha R. tiene 26 años de edad esta casada con el señor Pablo Olmendo de 32 años, viven en el barrio Corazón de Jesús tiene casa propia y aún no tienen hijos. En un momento tuvieron que emigrar a la Argentina ya que en su pueblo no tenían oportunidades de trabajo ni de progreso así que tomaron ese desafió. Mirtha tuvo la suerte de que conseguir un buen empleo como empleada domestica en una casa de familia. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pasando necesidades y malos momentos lograron hacerse de capital tenían una única ilusión, el de volver al país, y montar un pequeño negocio que sea de su propiedad para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y no tener que volver a salir de su ciudad natal. Fue que volvieron a Paraguay, y gracias a sus ahorros iniciaron la compra y venta de electrodomésticos; en muy poco tiempo consiguieron muy buena clientela ya que les brinda comodidad realizando la visita casa por casa y ofreciéndoles muy buen precio hoy día también tiene la exclusividad de una marca de motos para la venta financiada a sus clientes. Mirtha desea aumentar el volumen de su negocio y con el préstamo comprara heladeras ya que tiene varios pedidos para este verano.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase refrigerators

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa de Carmen is 53 years old and lives with one of her two children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank El Bombonaje. She works selling various types of condiments in the central market in Rioja, in San Martin. She offers her clients pepper creams as well cilantro and garlic among other things. She works in this business because she likes it and she enjoys her customers. She has always been characterized by her strength and perseverence. She is a fighter. With the loan received by Manuela Ramos for approximately $160.00, she will buy cumin, garlic, cilantro, corn, coffee, different kinds of peppers. These will be processed and blended to be sold by the bag to meet her customer's needs. She will also buy seasonings in bulk to sell in smaller quantities.

La señora Rosa del Carmen tiene 53 años de edad y 2 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal El Bombonaje, se dedica a la venta de condimentos de todas las variedades, su puesto de venta se ubica en el mercado central de la localidad de Rioja, en el Departamento de San Martín. Atiende a su clientela con cremas de ajíes y algunas verduras frescas como: culantro, ajos, entre otros. Ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y así se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte, perseverante y luchadora. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.), comprará cominos y pimienta en granos (1 Kg. Diario de cada uno), ajos, culantro, albaca, maní, maíz, ajíes de diversas especies, café (5 Kg. aproximadamente semanal), luego, estos productos pasarán por un proceso de licuado y así podrá venderlos en el menudeo por bolsitas de S/. 0.10 a 0.50, según la necesidad de su clientela. Además comprará sazonadores en cajas y paquetes para vender al por menor.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase seeds and seasonings for her busines

loans.name: Morie

texts.en: Morie is thirty five years old and married with two children.  Her husband is a local fisherman who earns only little income to sustain the family expenses.  She sells kitchen utensils in the market of Magburaka town to supplement her husband’s income. With her previous loan, she increased her stock of plastic items demanded by her customers in the community.  She needs an additional  loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her variety of plastic goods for sale to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Zoila Liliana

texts.es:
Zoila is 48 years old and has 3 children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Las Baguinas. She has a small shop where she sells various novelties and gifts, located in the principal market in La Peca, in Amazonas. She decided to start her business to improve the income of her household, and to do something important in her life. Her business is growing considerably, and now helps cover the needs of her family. Sometimes her children help her.

Her goal in the future is to grow her business much more, and continue to support her family. With the recent loan for Manuela Ramos of approximately $320.00, she will buy various products wholesale, such as gifts for different occasiones, as well as games for children, in the dozens and the hundreds, to have her store well stocked, and be able to satisfy her clients in her community as well as those farther away.

La señora Zoila tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bagüinas, se dedica a la venta D. Pasamanería en su puesto ubicado en el mercado principal D. la localidad D. La Peca (Bagua Chica), Departamento D. Amazonas. Decidió iniciar su negocio para mejorar los ingresos del hogar y ser alguien importante en la vida. El negocio esta creciendo considerablemente, pues cubre las necesidades D. ella y su familia. Algunas veces sus hijos le ayudan, su meta en el futuro es hacer crecer mucho más el negocio y seguir dando apoyo a su familia. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 321.00 aprox.) comprará variados productos al por mayor como artículos para regalos para diversas ocasiones como cumpleaños, bodas, artículos para el peinado del cabello como peines, ganchos, carmines, como también juguetes para niños, todo esto por docenas y cientos, para tener la pasamanería bien abastecida, y así satisfacer a sus clientes D. la misma comunidad y D. los lugares aledaños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase various products wholesale for her store

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juanita and I'm dedicated to the selling personal items like lotions and creams as well as making and selling tortillas. For my age I have a lot of experience doing this type of work. My clients are neighbors and my children's co-workers. If I increase my inventory I can improve my income and be able to repair my home. That is my goal at the moment since it's raining hard and part of my roof is in bad shape. Help me get supplies so I can increase my sales and be able to fix my home.
Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
Hola me llamo Juanita y me dedico a la venta de lociones, cremas y elaboracion de tortillas. Por mi edad me he dedicado a este negocio del que tengo muy buena experiencia vendo tortillas y lociones, mis clientes son mis vecinas y compañeros de trabajo de mis hijos. Se que acrecentando mi inventario puedo tener mejores ingresos para poder reparar mi casa, esta es mi meta por el momento ya que las lluvias son fuertes y parte del techo se encuentra en mal estado. Ayudenme a tener material de trabajo para mejorar mi ingreso y poder darle prioridad de mejorar mi casa.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, corn meal, firewood and other items.

loans.name: Erodita

texts.es:
Erodita H. Chambi, is married and has three children. She works with her husband in a carpenter shop which is located in their home, creating distinct furniture mostly by request of their customers. They have been doing this for more than 8 years, and a few times they have done work for the public where the demand is great, mainly in large construction such as buildings, offices and others. Erodita will use the money to provision materials before the end of the year, the time when the price of wood goes up and it is much more expensive to do the work without income for the family

Erodita H. Chambi, casada y madre de tres hijos, trabaja con su esposo en un taller de carpintería propio ubicado en su domicilio, principalmente realizando trabajos a pedido, elaborando distintos muebles. Ya son más de 8 años en esta actividad, y muy pocas veces realizan trabajos para la venta en vía pública la demanda es mucha, principalmente para construcciones grandes como ser edificios, oficinas y otros. Erodita precisa de capital para poder aprovisionarse de materia prima, antes de fin de año, época en la que toda la madera y principalmente la venesta, que incrementa su precio y se hace mucho más costoso realizar los trabajos encargados sin tener ganancias para su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase prime material for their carpenter business

loans.name: Rosula

texts.es:
Rosula M. is 42 years old and married to Melanio Esquivel. They have 5 children, two who are older and three still in school.

Rosula started her business with savings from the money her husband earned as an employee of a public transportation company. In 2000, she rented a small space right in the terminal where her husband worked, where every day there was an interesting movement of people traveling, and so she saw a brilliant opportunity for this type of business. She started selling fast food such as empanadas, vegetable tarts, fried meats and snacks, and after she diversified her products with more elaborately prepared food.

Today this business is very viable, because she has an established customer base and also offers a catering service for many who can't go home to eat. The loan will be used to buy various merchandise. In addition to the her business serving meals, she also has a small dispensary.

La señora Rosula M. tiene 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor Melanio Esquivel, matrimonio con cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres en edad escolar. Rosula comenzó su negocio con los ahorros que genero con el dinero que ganaba su marido quien trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transporte público de pasajeros, en el año 2000, alquiló un pequeño salón justamente en la terminal de la empresa donde trabajaba su marido, en donde cada día había un movimiento interesante de personas que viajaban, por lo tanto vio una oportunidad brillante para este tipo de negocio. Comenzó vendiendo comidas rápidas tales como: empanadas, milanesas, croquetas, tartas de verduras, etc. y luego fue diversificando sus productos ya con comidas mas elaboradas. Hoy en día dicha actividad le es muy rentable, porque ya tiene una clientela formada e incluso ya ofrece servicio de catering para muchos que no pueden ir a comer a sus casas. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías varias, ya que además de la venta de comidas posee una pequeña despensa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, etc.

loans.name: Teodenila

texts.es:
Teodenila is 36 years old and single. She lives in the district of Bagua Grande, in the Province of Utcubamba in Amazonas. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Maria Teresa de Calcutta. She works selling ceviche (a typical dish of marinated fish). She started her business with the objective of improving her economic situation, because it was an independent business and because she had the knowledge to do it. The business has been growing little by little, permitting her to cover her needs and those of her family.

Her goal is to grow as a business owner, and she likes very much the work she is doing. The recent loan for Manuela Ramos of $321.00 approximately, will go to the purchase of all kinds of fish, and will also be invested in a piece of land because her dream is to have her own place, and be able to receive her customers in an appropriate and comfortable location, improving the quality of service and the profits.

La señora Teodenila tiene 36 años, soltera, vive en el distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia de Utcubamba, en el Departamento de Amazonas, pertenece al Banco Comunal María Teresa de Calcuta. Se dedica a la venta de cebiche, inició su negocio con la finalidad de mejorar su situación económica, porque era un trabajo independiente y por el conocimiento del mismo. El negocio esta creciendo poco a poco, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades tanto de ella y de su familia. Su meta es crecer como empresaria, ya que le gusta bastante el trabajo que realiza. El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 321.00 aprox.), servirá para comprar pescado de todo tipo y también invertirá en un terreno por que sueña con su local propio y poder recibir a sus clientes en un lugar apropiado, cómodo y mejorar su calidad de servicio e ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy fish, and to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia M. Salazar is single and just 22 years old. She is a member of the loan group “Asociación 8 de Septiembre” in Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. She sews skirts, which is a long family tradition, and it was her mother who taught her how to sew. Sonia buys fabrics, embroiders, and sews according to the requests of buyers. She studies Social Work in the Public University of El Alto. She lives with her mother and 7 other people, which makes life difficult for her. She needs capital to buy more raw materials, with the objective of improving her sales. In this way she can generate income to cover her education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia M. Salazar, soltera y con apenas 22 años de edad, es socia de la Asociación 8 de Septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella se dedica a la confección de polleras, una tradición familiar que viene de mucho tiempo atrás, fue precisamente su madre quien le enseño el arte de la confección. Sonia compra telas, borda, confecciona y vende a requerimiento o pedido. Actualmente Sonia estudia en la Universidad Pública de El Alto, en la carrera de trabajo social, vive en casa de su madre junto a 7 personas más, lo que hace difícil la vida para ella. Precisa de capital para incrementar su materia prima, con el fin de mejorar su venta y de esta manera generar ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de estudio.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for sewing skirts, which generates the income she needs to pay her education expenses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is 58 years old and has 7 children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Los Jazmines. She lives in the district of Moyobamba, in San Martin. Victoria has a business selling bread and pastries, which she started because she realized it was a way to generate her own income and be able to help in the finances of her home.

She has a stall in the market, but in addition she sells to the small restaurants in the area. She is doing very well. Now she counts on the support of her children in running the business, and with the activites of their home. Her goal is to continue building this business and making a high quality product. This depends on the success of her sales.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for $964.00 approximately, she will buy the ingredientes she uses most, such as flour, sacks of sugar, cartons of butter, yeast and other ingredientes.

La señora Victoria tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Jazmines, vive en el Distirto D. Moyobamba, en el Departamento D. San Martín. Se dedica la venta D. panes y dulces. Decidió iniciar su negocio porque se dio cuenta D. que era una alternativa para generar sus propios ingresos y poder aportar en la economía D. su hogar. Ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado pero además reparte a las bodegas D. la zona, le va bastante bien. Ahora cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos en el manejo del negocio y las actividades D. la casa, su meta es seguir adelante con esta actividad y seguir haciendo un producto D. calidad, ya que D. eso depenD. el éxito en sus ventas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 3,000.00 ( $ 964.00 aprox.) comprará los ingredientes que más utiliza como es la harina, azúcar en sacos, manteca en cajas, levadura y demás ingredientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase ingredientes for her bakery

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Carita Chura lives with her husband. They have a one year old son. She is a member of the association 8 of September de Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. Maria did not neglect her academic studies, so during the evening she is an assistant in the public school, and in the mornings she sells second hand clothing from America, managing a stall on Figueroa Street in La Paz.

Maria has had her own location for 6 years. In the beginning, she would choose a few garments from wholesalers to resell for her entry into Pro Mujer, and by means of the loan, she began to buy clothing wholesale and sell her merchandise retail, generating her own resources. She will use the capital to increase her merchandise even more, and buy clothing in bundles. In this way she can assure that her profits will meet the needs of her son, and allow him to complete his studies.

María Carita Chura, vive con su pareja y es madre de un niño de un año, socia de la asociación 8 de septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. María no descuida su formación académica, pues de noche ella asiste a una escuela pública, y en las mañanas se dedica a la venta de ropa usada americana, atendiendo un puesto en la calle Figueroa de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella posee el puesto, que es propio y que lo tiene hace 6 años. En sus inicios, ella escogía algunas prendas de mayoristas para la reventa a su ingreso a Pro Mujer, y mediante los créditos prestados, María comenzó a comprar ropa al por mayor y vender su mercadería al por menor, generando recursos propios. Precisa de capital para poder incrementar aun mas su mercadería, poder comprar ropa por fardos, de esta manera asegurar sus ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hijo y para poder culminar sus estudios.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy merchandise and clothing in bulk for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Beltran Blanco lives with her husband who has a pizza business. They have two children. She is part of the association 18 of September de Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto. Her main activity is the sales of spare parts for domestic appliances, in Uyustus in the city of La Paz. 8 years ago, Martha bought spare parts from wholesalers, primarily those that come from Peru and for all types of brands. She will use the capital to increase her merchandise, as well as make it more varied. This is right after the urgent need to generate more resources that enable her to make her rent on her stall, and to be able to sustain her home.

Martha B. Blanco, vive con su pareja que se dedica a la Pizzería, y es madre de dos hijos, pertenece a la asociación 18 de septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. Su principal actividad es la venta de repuestos para electrodomésticos en la Uyustus, de la ciudad de La Paz, hace 8 años en el rubro, Martha compra los repuestos de vendedores mayoristas, principalmente aquellos que provienen del Perú y para todo tipo de marcas. Martha precisa de capital, para poder incrementar su mercadería, además de hacerla más variada, esto a raíz de la imperiosa necesidad de generar mayores recursos que le permitan cumplir con el alquiler de su puesto, y principalmente de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise, cover the costs of the business and the household.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty Adriazola, is separated and has 2 children. She is a part of the association Wara de Villa Tejada in the city of El Alto. Her main activity is the sales of every day grocery items in the zone of La Ceja in El Alto. Generally she sells by request, to people she knows and trusts, to whom she sells on credit and afterwards charges a small amount of interest.

Betty started with Pro Mujer, requesting a small credit that enabled her to buy a few grocery items in this way, and generate resources by selling them. At this time, she will use the capital to increase her merchandise, taking advantage of wholesale prices which are definitely the most profitable with sales.

Betty A., separada y madre de dos hijos, pertenece a la asociación Wara de Villa Tejada en El Alto, su principal actividad es la venta y comercialización de víveres en la zona de la Ceja de El Alto, generalmente ella trabaja a pedido, entre aquellas personas ya conocidas y de confianza, a quienes vende al crédito y posteriormente cobra con un pequeño interés. Betty se inició con Pro Mujer, solicitando un crédito pequeño que le permitió la compra de algunos víveres y de esta manera generar recursos tras la venta de los mismos. Actualmente, Betty se precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, principalmente aprovechar la compra al por mayor, que definitivamente es más rentable al momento de la venta. CREDITO : $1500

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and take advantage of wholesale prices.

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
Julia works every day to provide for her young daughter and her aged mother. For her last 12 years she has had to provide for them alone, because her husband, from whom she is separated, has not lived up to his obligations. Julia has been endured periods of real poverty and strived in various ways to survive. She sold typical food on the street and worked seasonally in the fields and done other work until she was able to save enough to buy a cow six years ago. She is happier now that she has a certain level of security, enough to meet the basic needs of her family. She has a cow which she cares for and it has now given birth to a calf. She also keeps smaller animals which her family can occasionally draw on for food. Julia has learned enough about livestock that she has taken to buying and selling calves to support the household. Now that things are more stable, she is able to dream of seeing her daughter attend the university. She devotes all her energy towards seeing this dream come to fruition. She is asking for a loan of $425 to buy calves to raise and resell. With your help, Julia's dreams can become a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia es una mujer valiente que cada día se esfuerza por incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia, vive actualmente con su pequeña hija y su anciana madre, durante más de doce años ella tuvo que velar sola por el bienestar de estas dos personas debido a que cuando en común acuerdo y luego de haber dialogado con su esposo toman la decisión de separarse, él evadió e ignoró sus responsabilidades. Durante esta etapa existieron momentos de carencia económica que Doña Julia superó realizando una serie de actividades; como la venta de comidas típicas de su ciudad, trabajos eventuales en el campo y demás; hasta que pudo capitalizar sus ahorros y comprar una vaca hace seis años.
