Ahora está muy contenta porque ha podido lograr cierta estabilidad económica que le permite satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar; tiene una vaca que gracias a los cuidados y al inmenso cariño que le otorga ahora tiene su becerrito; además cuenta también con otros animales más pequeños para su consumo ocasional. Gracias al conocimiento que ha ido adquiriendo compra y vende los becerros de otras vacas y de esa manera procura bienestar a su hogar, estas actividades la han llevado a concebir un gran anhelo y es el de observar y poder compartir con su pequeña hija su etapa universitaria.Doña Julia ha centrado todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos en este deseo y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá hacerlo realidad por ello solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más becerritos que cuidará con suma diligencia para luego poder venderlos. Con tu colaboración ella podrá cumplir en poco tiempo su anhelo.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: José Magdaleno

texts.es:
José is a married father of two. His wife helps him with the business in her free time. The main reason he started his business was to move the family forward, allowing him to provide an education for his children and pay the bills. He started with a small convenience store about five years ago, but a year later he decided to convert it into a stationery shop and haberdashery because he saw more opportunity at the location for that type of business. Thanks to the store he's been able to cover expenses and he hopes to continue growing the business.

José is requesting a loan of $925, which he will use to purchase supplies to better stock his shop. He plans to repay the loan within six months. He and his family are very grateful for your support in helping improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

José es un hombre casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio en sus tiempos libres, la principal causa por la que puso su negocio fue para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos dándoles educación y también pagar las cuotas de su casa, al inicio empezó con una tiendita de abarrotes hace aproximadamente 5 años atrás, pero al año decidió cambiar el giro del negocio a papelería y mercería, por que vio que por la ubicación de su tienda le era más rentable ese negocio que los abarrotes, ya gracias a su negocio a podido solventar sus gastos y desea continuar creciendo con su negocio.

José esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y tener más surtido su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen tu apoyo para continuar mejorando su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase haberdashery and stationery supplies

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is a married mother of three, all of whom are in school. Her husband works for a company that makes brooms, and his salary isn't enough to cover all their expenses. So two and a half years ago Olga decided to help him by starting her own business. A friend turned her on to selling beauty products via catalogue, and she started selling items to neighbors, friends and relatives. Now she has a long list of steady customers and wants to keep at the job and help the business grow.

Olga is requesting a loan of $375 to fulfill her pending orders and offer a wider selection of products at better prices to her customers. She plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her family are very grateful for your support in helping the business move forward and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Olga esta casada y tiene tres hijos, todos están estudiando, su esposo es obrero en una empresa que hace escobas, y no le alcanzaba con el sueldo que ganaban para poder mantener a su hogar, por ella es que Olga decidió ayudarlo poniéndose a trabajar desde hace mas de dos años y medio, fue por invitación de una amiga a este tipo de ventas por catálogo y luego ella empezó a vender entre sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, y ya ahora su cartera de clientes es fija y desea continuar con su negocio y crecer con el mismo.

Olga esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 375 para surtir sus pedidos pendientes y ofrecer más surtido de productos a mejor precio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth R. Vargas is part of the association Inti de Villa Tejada, in the city of El Alto, where she carries out functions as head of the group.

Ruth works together with her husband in the creation of shampoo, a product that is the result of a small company the two of them have set up. SEL-DE is the name of their product, the name comes from the first few letters of the names of their children, Selena and Denisse Their main market is in the fairs of different cities, such as Oruro, Potasi, Uyuni and Desaguadero.

They buy the main material for their product from wholesalers who are in charge of the direct importation, making the production is less expensive. Ruth and her husband will use the capital to buy plastic bottles wholesale, looking towards the end of the year, the season when sales increase, but so do the prices to buy the material. Only in this way can they generate the resources necessary to satisfy the needs of their 4 children. Between them, the two little girls were the inspiration for the business.

Ruth R. Vargas, pertenece a la Asociación Inti de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto, donde cumple funciones de Jefa de Grupo. Ruth trabaja conjuntamente con su marido en la elaboración de Shampoo, producto que es el resultado de la pequeña empresa que han instalado entre los dos. SEL-DE es el nombre de su producto, el nombre proviene de las primeras letras de los nombres de sus dos hijas, Selena y Denisse. Su principal mercado se encuentra en las ferias de distintas ciudades, como ser la ciudad de Oruro, Potosí, Uyuni, Desaguadero. La materia prima para su producto la compran de mayoristas que se encargan de la importación directa, de esta forma les resulta más barata la producción. Ruth y su marido precisan de capital para poder comprar envases de plástico al por mayor, en vista de la proximidad del fin de año, época en la que se incrementan las ventas, pero tambien incrementan los precios de la materia prima. Solo de esta manera podrán generar los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus 4 hijos, entre ellos, las dos nenas que fueron la inspiración de su empresa.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bottles wholesale before prices go up at the end of the year.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa Q. de Mendoze is married and has 7 children. She is part of the association Dinamicas de Villa Tejada in the city of El Alto. Her principal activity is selling cinnamon ice cream, which she buys from a wholesaler to resell in all the fairs and sporting events in El Alto, as well as in La Paz.

Elsa works alone, and with only one provider who enables her to sell the product, she travels to other locations such as Desaguader, Patacamaya, SicaSica, Viacha, Tiwanaku and other cities, and only works Thursday through Sunday. It's been more than 6 years that she's been dedicated to this business, trying to generate sufficient economic resources to maintain her family and her 7 children. Elsa's intention is to be able to count on more capital and buy the product in greater quantity. This will make it possible to gain more business and generate more income.

Elsa Q. de Mendoza, casada y madre de siete hijos, pertenece a la asociación Dinámicas de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto. Su principal actividad es la comercialización de helados de canela, pero ella no los prepara, solo compra al por mayor y revende en todas las ferias y acontecimientos deportivos, tanto en el Alto, como en la ciudad de La Paz. Elsa trabaja sola, y con un solo proveedor quien le da las facilidades para la venta del producto, de esta manera ella realiza viajes a otras localidades, como ser Desaguadero, Patacamaya, SicaSica, Viacha, Tiwanaku y otros, y solo trabaja los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingos. Ya son más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad, tratando de generar los recursos económicos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia y a sus siete hijos. La intención de Elsa es poder contar con mayor capital y poder comprar el producto en mayor cantidad, lo que posibilitaría la contratación de dependientes que generen aún más ingresos.

loans.use: To buy her products in greater quantity and increase her income.

loans.name: Flora Florencia

texts.es:
Señora Flora is 34 years old. Her husband abondoned her and her 3 young children. Since then, she has taken matters into her own hands. She decided to move ahead with her life and to take care of her family.

During this time she did a lot of odd jobs just to pay the bills, but unfortunately she did not do well in any of them. Finally, at the request of her children, she decided to fix a little area in her humble home to accomodate for a telephone/radio booth (call center). She bought the equipment little by little and with a lot of sacrifice since most of the equipment was very expensive. Currently, this type of service is in high demand since this is the only way some people can communicate regularly with their loved ones, and due to Señora Flora's good customer service her clientele has increased.

Señora Flora and her children work from 5:30 am until 8:00 pm. They are requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD which they will use to upgrade the equipment in order to offer great service to the public and to increase the earnings for the family. In order to do this, they are asking generous people for support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flora tiene 34 años, su esposo la dejó en un completo abandono económico y moral junto a sus 3 hijos menores de edad cuando decidió marcharse; desde entonces tomó las riendas de su hogar y se propuso salir adelante y velar por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia. Durante este tiempo se dedicó a diversas labores y oficios para mantener su hogar, pero desafortunadamente en ninguna le iba muy bien; finalmente por iniciativa de sus hijos decidió acondicionar un ambiente de su humilde casa para establecer artesanalmente una pequeña empresa de radio y comunicaciones.Los equipos fueron comprados poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio debido a que el costo de estos aparatos eran muy altos. Ahora este servicio se ha convertido en uno de los más necesarios y gracias a la prestancia y cordialidad tiene mucha demanda en su localidad debido a que a través de este espacio pueden comunicarse regularmente con sus familiares. Doña Flora y sus hijos comprometidos con este trabajo inician su labor diaria a las 5.30 de la mañana y la finalizan a las 8:00 de la noche; en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que invertirá para renovar sus equipos con el fin de brindar un óptimo servicio a la población y así generar mayores ingresos económicos para su hogar, y para llevar a cabo este propósito recurre a las personas generosas con el deseo de obtener su apoyo.

loans.use: To upgrade equipment in order to offer great service to the public

loans.name: Juana Ines

texts.es:
Juana is married, and her husband is a taxi driver. They don't have children, but they do have a strong desire to move up in the world and have some assets for when they do have kids so they can offer them a high quality of life. With these high hopes she started a small beauty salon a year and a half ago because she studied the craft and wanted to develop professionally. Little by little the salon became successful and business grew. Juana tries to improve her craft every day, and she's sure she'll succeed because she's a very hard worker.

Juana is requesting a loan of $375, which she will use to improve her salon and set it up some more to improve the service she provides. She plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her husband are grateful for your support in helping them move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y su esposo es taxista, no tienen hijos pero desea superarse y formar un patrimonio para cuando los tengan y así poder ofrecer una buena calidad de vida, con estas ganas de salir adelante fue hace un año y medio que puso un pequeño salón de belleza ya que fue lo que ella estudió y quiere desarrollarse en su profesión y poco a poco es lo que esta logrando y creciendo con el mismo, por ello es que ella desea mejorar cada día más y lograr sus metas, las que esta segura de lograr por que es muy trabajadora.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para mejorar su negocio y acondicionarlo más para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Invest in the business and remodel the salon

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto is 29 years old. He has a lot of projects and dreams that go into the future. Humberto wanted to start a family with a woman he thought will grow old with him. But, unfortunately, life played him a trick. Soon after their union she died. And he was left alone, with his unfulfilled dreams.

He fell into depression for some time, but Humberto realized that there was a strong reason to live and keep going: Hipólita, his little sister, who needed his support and love and lives with him.

Humberto sells -door to door- nutritional supplements from Tien, a well known Peruvian brand. He wishes to widen the variety of products he offers to increase his sales. So he is asking for a loan of US$ 325. This amount will be invested in more Tien products to be sold. The increased income would help him support his sister and his parents. He would repay it in 6 months. A little help from you will go a long way.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Humberto de 29 años de edad es un joven soñador con innumerables planes para el futuro decidió formar su propia familia al lado de la mujer que él creía que lo acompañaría siempre, pero desafortunadamente el destino le jugó una mala pasada, al poco tiempo de convivir ella perdió la vida, dejándolo sólo y con todos sus planes y sueños por cumplir.

Sumido en una inmensa depresión se dio cuenta que aún tenia una razón por la cuál seguir luchando en este mundo. Su hermanita menor Hipólita, a quién apoya moral y económicamente en el seno de su hogar. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de suplementos nutricionales de la prestigiosa marca peruana TIEN en forma ambulatoria; su deseo es aumentar el monto de su capital con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad para la optimización de sus ventas, para esto solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares dinero que invertirá y le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para apoyar económicamente además de su hermanita a sus padres, él promete hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Humberto nos necesita, ayudémoslo a salir adelante junto a su familia.

loans.use: Buying a larger variety of products to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Nativity and her family have been selling food and snack food in area high schools for several years. Very early everyday, they prepare the vehicle that they use to transport the food to their awaiting clients.

Due to bad weather and the load the vehicle carries everyday, it has had several mechanical problems and the family has had to use its entire savings to repair it. Since some of the problems it has cannot be fixed, they have decided to buy a new vehicle.

For this purpose, they are requesting a loan of $500.00 to make the purchase. They are committed to working very hard so they can pay the loan back within 6 months. With the new vehicle they will be able to transport their products more easily, and they will improve their quality of life. Natividad and her family thank you for your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad y su familia hace varios años se dedican a la venta de productos de consumo en los colegios. Todos los días muy temprano preparan la movilidad que los ayudará a llevar los alimentos hechos por la reina de la casa para ofrecérselos a sus clientes que la esperan expectantes. Debido a las inclemencias del tiempo y a la carga diaria el vehículo motorizado esta sufriendo varios desperfectos y todo el ahorro que habían acumulado hasta hace poco se ha utilizado para repararlo; en vista de que hay algunas fallas que van a persistir, la familia en su conjunto a decidido adquirir un vehículo nuevo. A raíz de este hecho solicitan un préstamo de 500 dólares para realizar la compra y se comprometen a trabajar muy duro para retornarlos en un período de 6 meses, con él podrán agilizar el traslado de sus productos y mejorarán su calidad de vida. Natividad y su familia agradecen tu generoso aporte.

loans.use: To buy a new vehicle for the purpose of transporting food products

loans.name: Ruth Nelly

texts.es:
Ruth is part of the communal bank Mujeres Trabajadoras (working women), of Alfonso Ugarte in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of 2 children. Her husband, for health reasons, does not have secure work, so Ruth looked for a business opportunity that allowed income. With her first loan by Manuela Ramos, she decided to sell chickens.

She counts on the help of her husband. Managing the business together, they get up at 3am, and finish selling at 10am, tired but content. With the loan from Manuela Ramos of $966, she will buy more chickens, and with the balance she will build a shed to raise the 500 chickens.

Despite the difficulties with her husband's health, Ruth feels very content to work together with him, as well to have their own income to cover the needs of the house.

La señora Ruth pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras, del Jr. Alfonso Ugarte, Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Su esposo, por motivos de salud, no tiene trabajo seguro, por ello Ruth busca oportunidad de un negocio que le permita tener ingresos, es así que la invitan a Manuela Ramos y con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 decide vender pollos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, atienden este negocio juntos, se levantan a las 3 am. y terminan a vender a las 10 am., cansados pero ala vez contentos. Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 3,000 (US$ 966.00 aprox.). comprará más pollos (1 ciento de pollos), con la diferencia armará un galpón para criar 500 pollos en su casa. Ruth a pesar de las dificultadas con la salud de su esposo, se siente muy contenta de trabajar junto con él, además de tener ingresos propios para cubrir las necesidades de la casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy chickens wholesale, and install a shed to raise the chickens.

loans.name: Edward B.

texts.en: Edward is thirty two and married with three children.  He is the only trader selling cold soft drinks in the market center of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. His business was very small and with his previous loan he added beer and bottled water to his menu.  Edward is now in the process of expanding his business and is therefore requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expanding his selection of cold drinks for his business to generate a greater profit.

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: Hamidu is married with eight children.  As a blacksmith he has to work hard to buy food and other essentials for his family.  He makes hoes, cutlasses, and buckets, and sells them to the local farmers.  Hamidu also employs two workers to assist him with the production of tools and pays them on a daily basis.  With his previous loan, he was able to buy some scraps and tools.  For him to develop his business further, he needs more tools and materials that can be obtained locally.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $250

loans.use: To obtain more materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed is thirty six years old and married with three children.  He started his business by selling clothes in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loan, he added some shoes and plastic sandals.  He is requesting a further loan of $175 to purchase inventory.  His wife is also expected to join the business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Aruna

texts.en: Aruna is thirty two years old and sells used clothes.  With his previous loan, he increased his stock by three bails of clothes.   He also started selling clothes wholesale.  Aruna said, he supplies village retailers especially women with the clothes and collects the cash weekly.  He is married with two children and he is hoping is to grow his business further and to make enough money to educate his children and also support his wife to begin a business.  For these reasons, he is requesting a loan of $350

loans.use: Increase his supply of clothing for wholesale distribution.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo is a very hardworker. He is married and has 4 daughters, all of whom are married. He was laid off from the company where he worked for many years, and he had to continue taking care of his family. He saw the need to do something, so with what they gave him when he was laid off he assembled his own business repairing car tires. He learned what he needed to do, and for two years now he has had his shop and his business has been growing. He now has various regular clients and hopes to continue the business to improve the quality of life.

He is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for his shop, so that he can offer a better service to his clients. He has offered to pay back in the loan in 5 months. Camilo and his family appreciate the support that you give so he can continue to grow his business.

Camilo es un hombre muy trabajador, está casado y tiene cuatro hijas mujeres, todas están casadas, él fue liquidado de la empresa en la que trabajo por mucho años y tenía que seguir manteniendo a su familia, entonces se vio en la necesidad de hacer algo, así que con lo que le dieron en su liquidación armo su propio negocio de reparación de neumáticos de carros, oficio que sabía hacer y desde hace doce años esta con su taller y ha ido creciendo con el, ya ahora tiene varios clientes fijos y desea continuar con el negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Camilo esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para su taller y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por la cantidad de US $ 925, que ofrece pagar en 5 meses, él y su familia agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y su crecimiento.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is a forty seven year old carpenter.  He makes beds and school benches and other furniture that clients request. Married with five children, he used his previous loan to buy needed tools for his craft. The tools enabled him to improve the quality of production.  He is requesting a loan of $350 to buy timber and employ one carpenter to assist him.  Muhamed said, with the loan, he will be able to keep up with contracts and increase his profit.

loans.use: Purchase timber for increased production and hire an assistant carpenter.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en: Sento is married to a teacher whose irregular salary is insufficient to cater for family expenses.  Thirty two years old and a mother of two children, she has been in business for five years and she has seen her business increase with her previous loan.  She specializes in selling children’s wears.  Sento sells the clothes in the open market of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.  With the profit, she supplements her husband’s income especially providing education for her children.  She would like to increase her stock to grow her business and therefore is requesting a loan of $250.

loans.use: Expand her children's clothing business to attract more customers.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en: Isha sells food supplies in the market in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  She learned her business from her mother and was doing the same business before the civil war in Sierra Leone.  Isha is married with five children. With her husband’s meager salary as a driver, she plays a major role in providing for the family needs.  Isha said, she was able to pay her installment on time because she saves $1.25 daily with a Rotating and Savings club for the purpose. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase rice and sugar on wholesale.  Isha would like to diversify her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cooking oil, and onions on wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Niels Alejo

texts.ru:
J. makes many sacrifices for his family. He has worked in the fields since he was a small boy. Since his marriage he has also supported his family by weaving, a craft he learned from his father. Not long ago J. and his wife became parents for the first time. They currently live with J.'s family but this has become untenable and they would like to build a small home where the family can share the future. He is asking for a loan of $275 to invest in agriculture and weaving so he can make enough money to begin construction on a small home. Please help this young family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

J., es un abnegado padre de familia que se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde muy pequeño y a reforzado esta actividad, con el talento que posee para elaborar mantas gracias a la herencia de su padre. Poco tiempo después de haberse dedicado junto a su esposa a esta actividad han encontrado una gran forma de poder salir adelante.Esta joven familia tiene recién un pequeño hijo por quién esforzarse mucho, y es así que a diario perseveran en su labor con el anhelo de verlo siempre sano y fuerte en casa, ellos habitan el hogar de sus padres pero hasta hace poco y después de compartir mucho tiempo infinitas alegrías han llegado a tener algunos problemas, y muchas dificultades, razón por la cual desean poder construir una pequeña casita para poder estar juntos y así mirar el futuro con una perspectiva diferente.Para llevar a cabo este propósito solicitan un préstamo de 275 dólares para poder invertirlos en sus actividades agrícolas y textiles con el fin de poder generar un monto pequeño que les servirá de ahorro e inversión para la construcción de su pequeño hogar.Hagamos juntos que esta familia muy pronto pueda tener un hogar donde cobijarse..

loans.use: To invest in agriculture and weaving so a young family can build a home.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with four children.  She sells utensils in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Kadiatu’s business increased with her previous loan and she would like to expand it further.  At fifty years old, she is very much concerned about her children’s education especially those who are in college.  Although her husband does petty trading, his income is less than Kadiatu’s income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $250.

loans.use: Diversify and expand her business.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en: Jeneba is thirty three years old and a widow.  She sells palm oil in the open market in Makeni, Sierra Leone.  With her income, Jeneba provides food and education to her three children.  Her previous loan enabled her to purchase thirty five gallons of palm oil in bulk.  As the business is her sole source of income, Jeneba would like to expand the business to earn more profits.  She would like to join the group that sells palm oil to neighboring countries and for these reasons; she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase sixty gallons of oil for export purposes.

loans.use: Purchase additional palm oil in bulk to begin exporting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more natural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more electronics to fix and the pieces needed to repair them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials such as wood and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials for his furniture making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products for his new store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has 15 years of experience selling personal items and household goods. She was encouraged to start by a friend and her mother-in-law. She has participated in many microbusiness courses, which have helped her to always be responsible with the loans she obtains. She works every day of the week from 7 AM until 9 PM. On the weekends, she travels to the countryside, where she has some customers. Her parents also live there, and they help her out with the business.

Rosa wants this loan in order to be able to offer more products for sale. Flexibility in being able to invest in products is critical for her to be able to make profits. It is much better when Rosa has money to invest in wholesale goods. This will be Rosa’s second time borrowing from Mifex.

Rosa is a single mother. She has been separated for 6 years. She has 2 children. One no longer lives with her and the other works and helps her out. Her wish is to be able to complete her house and to remodel part of it to accommodate her business, and in that way to increase her income.

loans.use: Invest in more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in the materials necessary for sandal making

loans.name: Rayda Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is the humble mother of a family with four children and she works hard to educate them. She also works in agriculture, along with her husband, to generate the family’s income. They work hard at farming peas, which they sell in the market. This year had been very good, and after much effort, they had achieved a big harvest. Her husband went the market to the sell the fruits of their labor. When he was returning, happy because he knew their sacrifice had been well compensated, a group of thieves robbed him of the money he was carrying.

A little while after this regrettable incident, Claudia began to have frequent pain in her legs with no discernable explanation. She decided to undergo a series of treatments, however her condition worsened and eventually she was unable to move her legs. Reality seems bleak for this family, however, they maintain the hope that they will be able to get ahead. To do this, they will need the help of all of us. The family’s desire is to continue planting peas and increase their capital to be able to invest more in seed. For this purpose, they are requesting a loan of $325.00, with which they would be able to improve their quality of life and the health of their beloved Claudia. Let’s help this family to remain strong and united.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia es una humilde madre de familia que con mucho empeño educa a sus cuatro menores hijos y también se dedica a las actividades agrícolas junto a su esposo para generar el ingreso económico familiar se esfuerzan al máximo para producir, arvejas, que luego comercializarán llevándolas al mercado.Este año había sido muy provechoso y después de mucho esfuerzo habían logrado una gran cosecha, su esposo llevó al mercado para comercializar los frutos de su trabajo y cuando se disponía a retornar muy contento porque sabia que el sacrificio había sido bien recompensado una turba de desadaptados ladrones le quitaron el poco dinero que llevaba. Poco tiempo después de este penoso incidente Claudia empezó a tener dolores muy frecuentes en las piernas y la causa era incomprensible a razón de este hecho es que decide someterse a una serie de tratamientos clínicos sin embargo las dificultades se incrementaron y la dejaron sin poder mover las extremidades inferiores. La realidad parece muy sombría en esta familia, sin embargo mantienen la esperanza de poder salir adelante y para llevar a cabo sus propósitos requieren el apoyo de todos nosotros. El anhelo familiar es continuar con la siembra de arvejas y aumentar su capital para invertir una suma más alta en la compra de semillas por ello solicitan un préstamo de 325 dólares, con el cual podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y la salud de su querida Claudia .Hagamos que esta familia se siga manteniendo fuerte y unida.

loans.use: To buy an increased amount of seed for planting peas

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco V. is 53 year old and married. He lives in a house located on the same land as his business. His wife Antonia is 46 yeras old, and stays busy caring for the house and the children. They have 7 children who work in the small family business, the four youngest still live with their parents.

For more than 7 years Francisco has had his own business. He has a shop where he does repair and maintenance of motorcycles and bicycles. It's the only one in the zone with the infrastructure and trained people. All of Francisco's children are his assistants, and each one has a specialty in the new models and technologies. This professional and personalized service is a highlight of his shop, and guarantees quality work.

Francisco decided to work for himself 7 years ago, abandoning his bohemian life of music. His band was very successful during the 80's. His only objective was to educate his children and offer them stability and a way to get the most out of life. He will use the loan to buy merchandise such as spark plugs, filters, headlights, fuses, etc, for a value of $1000.

El Sr. Francisco V. tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive en una casa ubicada en el mismo terreno que su negocio, su cónyuge, Antonia de 46 años, se ocupa del cuidado de la casa, tienen 7 hijos, quienes trabajan en la microempresa familiar, de éstos los 4 más jóvenes aun viven con sus padres. Hace más de 7 años que don Francisco trabaja por cuenta propia, posee un taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas y bicicletas, es el único en la zona aledaña con la infraestructura y personal capacitado, todos los asistentes de don Francisco son sus hijos, cada uno está especializado en los nuevos modelos y tecnologías de los biciclos actuales. Esto destaca el servicio profesional y personalizado de este taller, garantizando así un trabajo de calidad. Don Francisco decidió trabajar por cuenta propia hace 7 años- abandonó su vida bohemia de músico, cuya banda fue muy exitosa en la década de los años 80, con el único fin de educar a sus hijos, ofrecerles estabilidad y un medio de ganarse la vida. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías: bujías, filtros, rayos, focos, fusibles etc. por un valor de 1.000 U$.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy merchandise - filters, spark plugs, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Héctor Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio and his wife and children struggle daily to overcome poverty, the curse of so many Peruvian farming families. They work hard to feed themselves by cultivating their small fields. Despite this, the family is optimistic and amiable. Recently, their three-year-old daughter contracted pneumonia and had to be hospitalized for many days. This health crisis exhausted the family's meager savings. They are asking for a loan of $200 to plant ollucos, a starchy tuber, with the goal of regaining independence and a decent quality of life. Please help make this family's dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Don Gregorio junto a su esposa e hijos tiene que lidiar a diario con el desafio de poder sobreponerse a la pobreza y a la miseria en la que están envueltas muchas familias que se dedican a la actividad agrícola en el Perú. Es por eso que día a día se esmeran mucho en el trabajo de sus pequeñas tierras para poder tener algo que comer, a pesar de la pobreza siempre han mantenido un espíritu optimista y afable, sin embargo ocurrió un hecho que los apenó mucho, su hija menor de tan solo tres años de edad, contrajo una neumonía muy terrible que la obligó a estar hospitalizada durante muchos días. Esta circunstancia inoportuna hizo que el poco dinero del cual disponían para su manutención, fuera utilizado para el restablecimiento de la salud de la menor. Debido a este hecho la familia solicita apoyo para incrementar su inversión en la siembra de ollucos y recurren a un préstamo de 200 dólares con el deseo de seguir cultivando sus tierras con la esperanza de mejorar pronto su calidad de vida. Hagamos que el deseo de esta familia se convierta en realidad.

loans.use: To grow olluco, a starchy tuber.

loans.name: Gloria Lina

texts.es:
Gloria is married and her husband is dedicated to harvesting nuts. They have one son who is already married. She decided to start her business because she needed an extra income to support their family finances. In their school zone, she was offered the opportunity to manage a small little store within the school and she still had a little business at home. She accepted the responsibility to carry out both businesses because she has to support her 82 year-old mother and 57 year-old brother who is handicapped. She sells Jafra (cosmetic) products from home for over 20 years now. She desires to continue with her businesses and improve them again because she is a very hardworking woman.

Gloria is requesting a loan for $550 to invest in the two businesses, especially the shop in the school and continue with their growth in order to support herself and her loved ones. She is offering to repay the loan in three months. She and her family greatly appreciate your support, which gives them the ability to move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gloria esta casada y su esposo se dedica al cultivo de la nuez, ellos tienen un hijo que ya esta casado, ella decidió poner su negocio por que necesitaba de un ingreso extra para apoyar en la economía familiar y en este ciclo escolar tuvo la oportunidad de que le ofrecieran el hacerse cargo de una tiendita dentro de una escuela que queda a la vuelta de su casa y acepto llevar a cabo ambos negocios por que tienen que mantener a su madre de 82 años de edad y a su hermano que es minusválido de 57 años. Ella vende productos jafra hace ya más de 20 años. Desea continuar con su negocio y con el nuevo sacarlo adelante por que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para invertir en los dos negocios, especialmente en la tienda de la escuela y continuar creciendo para su sustento y el de sus seres queridos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her businesses.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
Olga is a single woman, very hardworking and a fast learner. She was dismissed from her previous work and had to find a way to continue forward with her costs. She observed that there were not many shops in her area, so with the money from her dismissal, she opened her general store four years ago. She started by selling tinware, and later added everyday groceries, little by little growing the business and incorporating a refrigerator to sell soft drinks, milk, juices, etc. Most recently she has added sweets, fried snacks and bread. She hopes to continue growing her business.

Olga is requesting a loan of $1200 to stock her business with many products not sold in her area, to better serve her customers. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months. Olga very much appreciates your support in helping her grow her business.

Olga es una mujer soltera muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella fue despedida de su trabajo anterior y tuvo que ver la manera de salir adelante con sus gastos y manutención por lo que viendo opciones de negocios pudo observar que por su colonia no habían muchas tiendas y con parte de su liquidación empezó su negocio de abarrotes, esto fue ya hace cuatro años atrás y empezó vendiendo latería, y luego le agrego abarrotes principales, y poco a poco fue creciendo incorporándole un refrigerador para la venta de refrescos, leche, jugos, etc. Y últimamente puso los exhibidores de venta de dulces, frituras y pan. Ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Olga esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para surtir su negocio con muchos productos que hacen falta que vendan por su colonia y así poder satisfacer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo para ayudarla a salir adelante con su negocio y crecer aún más con el mismo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nery Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is 23 years old. She raises different types of animals out of her home, and she later sells them for a profit. She does this while taking care of her own family, her husband who is 24 years old, and her two daughters who are 5 and 3 years old.

This young couple like the rest do not own a home. They live with Nancy's parents. Her older brother also lives there. Nancy wishes to have a home where she can live and take care of her own family.

Since they live at home with her parents, they are responsible for taking care of them as well. To do this, they decided to start raising little animals in the small backyard so that they can sell them later at a profit. Nancy is aware that if she wants her own house she must work hard for it. This is why she works hard every day so that she can one day offer her daughters a place of their own where they can run free without any limitations.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase all the necessities needed to raise animals. Let's help Nancy to one day make her dream come true of owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy tiene 23 años y se dedicada a la crianza de diversos animalitos en casa para luego venderlos; sin descuidar la atención de su familia constituida por su esposo de 24 años y sus dos pequeñas hijas de 5 y 3 . .Esta joven pareja como muchas no tiene una casa propia en la que puedan desenvolverse cómodamente y hasta hoy están bajo el amparo del padre de Nancy . Las instalaciones de esta pequeña casita también la comparte con su hermano mayor motivo por el cual Nancy cuida y vela por el bienestar de una familia más. .El asumir esta sobrecarga de responsabilidades y gastos hicieron que se decidiera a trabajar criando animalitos pequeños en un espacio de la casa de su padre para luego venderlos cuando estos alcancen su madurez. Ella sabe que para alcanzar el sueño de una casa propia debe esforzarse y trabajar mucho.Por esta razón lucha día a día para poder ofrecerle a sus hijas un lugar donde ellas puedan crecer libres y sin limitaciones. Solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares para invertirlos en su chacra y mejorar la crianza de sus animales en custodia .Apoyémosla para que pueda cristalizar sus sueños en un futuro no muy lejano

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities to raise animals

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Celsa C. is 29 years old and married. She lives in a humble home with her husband Pedro Villalba who is 36 years old and helps with the income of the house. Celsa has a dispensary in her house, and her husband is a specialist in the preparation of chacinados. They have 2 children, 3 and 5 years old, who make up the harmonious family life.

Celsa and her husband manage the dispensary where they sell all types of every day items such as sugar, milk, meat, eggs, vegetables, etc, and a special compliment of chacinados which Pedro is in charge of. He prepares sausages, mortadela, ham, cold cuts, etc. When the company where Pedro worked had financial problems and collapsed, he was left unemployed, so he decided, along with his wife, to learn this business for himself.

The experience of 10 years of sales of these products, the knowledge of the consumer market, and the necessity to survive, are some of the pillars that sustain these enterprising people. They have hired other unemployed people, experimenting in the preparation of chacinados, so the enterprise is already giving work to others. The small company produces according to demand so there is no set schedule, nor days of work. They make the sales in the dispensary and by request. Today Celsa is requesting a loan to buy a meat shredding machine. The dream of these enterprising business owners is to offer the opportunity of work to many unemployed youths in the area.

Celsa C. de 29 años, es casada, vive en una humilde vivienda con su cónyuge el señor Pedro Villalba de tiene 36 años quien ayuda con los ingresos de la casa. Celsa tiene una despensa en su casa, su marido es especialista en la elaboración de los chacinados. Tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, de 3 y 5 años respectivamente, quienes comparten la armoniosa vida familiar. Celsa y su cónyuge, atienden la despensa donde venden todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, como azúcar, leche, carne, huevos, hortalizas, etc. y un complemento especial de ventas es la de chacinados de la cual se encarga exclusivamente don Pedro. El elabora chorizos, mortadela, fiambre, jamón etc. Cuando la empresa donde trabajaba don Pedro, tuvo problemas financieros y quebró, el quedó desempleado, decidió con su esposa emprender por cuenta propia esta actividad. La experiencia de 10 años en la venta de estos productos, el conocimiento del mercado consumidor, y la necesidad de sobrevivir, son algunos de los pilares que sostiene a estos emprendedores. Para producir calidad han contratado a otros desempleados experimentados en esta actividad (elaboración de chacinados), o sea que el emprendimiento ya está dando trabajo a otras personas. La microempresa produce de acuerdo a la demanda por lo tanto no existe horario, ni días de trabajo. Las ventas las realizan en la despensa y bajo pedido, hoy día Celsa está solicitando un crédito que será destinado a la compra de una máquina trituradora de carne además de los ingredientes para la elaboración para la compra de carne, especias. etc. El sueño de estos micros emprendedores es ofrecer la oportunidad de trabajo a muchos jóvenes desempleados de la zona.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy a meat shredder

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Maricela is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have a son who is 5 years old. Maricela had the opportunity to start her business because it was her father's business, but he became sick and could no longer manage it. He sold it so that she could take charge and help her husband with the costs of the family. Her husband's salary is variable and sometimes he doesn't have the means to pay his basic costs. Maricela took charge of her business five years ago and added to the products she sold little by little.

She is requesting a loan of $650 to grow her business and have more space to offer a greater quantity of products. She is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. Maricela and her family very much appreciate your support so she can continue to build her business.

Maricela esta casada y su esposo es carpintero, ellos tienen un niño de cinco años de edad, ella tuvo la oportunidad de hacerse de su negocio debido a que este era el negocio de su papá, pero el enfermo y ya no podía atender el negocio y se lo vendió para que ella se hiciera cargo del mismo, con esto ella pudo ayudar en el gasto familiar a su esposo ya que su sueldo es variable y a veces no tenían los medios para solventar sus gastos básicos, ella se hizo cargo de su negocio hace 5 años atrás incrementando los productos que vendían poco a poco.

Maricela esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 650 para poder ampliar su negocio y tener mayor espacio para poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Grow her business

loans.name: Altagracio

texts.es:
Altagracio C. is from the republic of Santani. He is 69 years old and married to Dionisia Martinez who is 65 years old. They have 5 children, two of whom are studying in high school en Santani, and the older ones have their own independent activities. Altagracio works in agriculture, and also makes cheese. He has 12 hectares of land, 4 dairy cows and 2 horses. They are very hard working people, with their work day starting at 4am every day of the week. They have a good customer base thanks to the quality of their products and their ability to meet their clients needs. Now they plan to cultivate sesame, and are requesting the funding for the costs of the cultivation.

El Sr. Altagracio Chávez es de Republicano, Santaní, tiene 69 años de edad, y está casado con la Sra. Dionisia Martínez de 65 años de edad. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando en el colegio, en Santaní, y los mayores tienen sus actividades en forma independiente. Don Altagracio, se dedica a la agricultura, y a la producción de queso. Tiene 12 hectáreas de terreno, 4 vacas lecheras, y 2 caballos. Son personas muy trabajadores y sacrificadas, su actividad laboral del día empieza a las 04:00 horas de la mañana y es de lunes a lunes, tienen una clientela numerosa gracias a la calidad de sus productos y a su cumplimiento con los clientes. Ahora tiene proyectado cultivar sésamo, para lo cual solicita una financiación para los gastos de cultivo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy sesame sees and cover the cultivation costs.

loans.name: Servando Enrique

texts.es:
Servando is married and has two children. He started a business selling natural products in order to support his family. His wife sells snack foods. When people saw the good results they can get from these products, the demand for them increased considerably. He has been increasing his number of clients, who in turn recommend him to others; in this way his business has grown.

Servando is requesting a loan of $550.00 to buy more merchandise so that he can support his family and have a better quality of life. He offers to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Servando es una persona casada con dos hijos, él con todo su esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de productos naturales para mantener a su familia junto con su esposa, quien trabaja en la venta de botanas, al ver la gente los buenos resultados de estos productos, la demanda por ellos se incrementó considerablemente y así han ido incrementando su cartera de clientes quienes a su vez lo recomiendan y con lo que han hecho crecer su negocio.

Servando esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 550 para la compra de más mercancía y poder sostener a su familia económicamente y tener una mayor calidad de vida, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen todo tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Paula Antonia is 52 years of age and only studied until the second year of high school. She lives in Caserio de Cochaya of the district of Salpo in the Province of Otuzco, in the Department of La Libertad. She has nine children, but only four depend on her. Since her early childhood she used to help her Mama in the sale of cheese and animals; at the age of 18 she began to work alone in the sale of cheese and quesillos (local Peruvian soft cheese used as an ingredient in cooking). With her earnings she started a little bodega. Then the Banco Comunal "Jesus Maria" formed, and with her first credit os S/300.00 (approximately $.96) that she received, she bought chickens and guinea pigs to breed and sell. Little by little she went buying other, bigger animals like ewes and cattle.

Actually livestock and producing quesillos and cheese, also since that which she produces does not manage to cover her orders, she also breeds and sells guinea pigs, chickens and ewes; and in her shop she sells meat and other products of primary necessity.

With the recent loan granted by Manuela Ramos for S/.800.00 she will buy ewes to fatten them up and have them to sell in the end of year celebrations. Mrs. Paula dreams of buying a house in Trujillo in order for her children who are studying there to live in and so not have to pay rent and be able to visit them more often.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Paula Antonia tiene 52 años de edad y solo estudio hasta segundo año de secundaria, vive en el Caserío de Cochaya del distrito de Salpo de la Provincia de Otuzco, del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 9 hijos pero solamente cuatro dependen de ella. Desde muy pequeña ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de quesos y animales, a la edad de 18 años empezó a trabajar sola en la venta de quesos y quesillos con sus ganancias empezó a implementar una pequeña bodega. Formó el Banco Comunal “Jesús María” y con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $.96) que recibió compró gallinas y cuyes para criar y vender, poco a poco fue comprando otros animales más grandes como ovejas y ganado vacuno.

Actualmente cría ganado y produce quesillos y quesos, también los compra ya que lo que produce no le alcanza para cubrir sus pedidos, también cría y vende cuyes, gallinas y ovejas; y en su bodega vende carne y otros productos de primera necesidad.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.800.00 ($ 258.00 aprox.) comprará ovejas para engordarlas y poderlas vender en las fiestas de fin de año. La señora Paula sueña con comprarse una casa en Trujillo para que vivan sus hijos que están estudiando y así no tenga que pagar alquiler y pueda visitarlos más seguido.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock - Compra de ganado.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo is married and has 4 children. He was unemployed without a way to sustain his family, so he looked for a way to start his own business to be able to face his costs. With much effort he iniciated his own business with very little merchandise. Selling cleaning products, little by little he was able to maintain his home and start to grow his business, incorporating the sales of grocery items, and improving the quality of service he offered.

Adolfo needs a loan of $800, which he offers to pay back in 6 months. He will use this loan to provide more cleaning products and continue to work hard to sustain his family. He and his family very much appreciate your support in helping them.

Adolfo esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos que al quedar desempleado y no tener disposición económica para poder sustentar a su familia, buscó la forma de hacerse de su negocio propio para poder enfrentar sus gastos y con mucho esfuerzo inició su negocio con poca mercancía en artículos de limpieza y con este poco a poco a podido mantener a su hogar y crecer en el mismo, incorporando la venta de abarrotes y mejorando la calidad del servicio que ofrece.

Adolfo requiere de un préstamo de USD $ 800, que ofrece pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, utilizando este préstamo para poder surtir de artículos de limpieza y así seguir trabajando duro para poder sostener a su familia. Él y su familia agradecen tu apoyo para ayudarlos a salir adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To be able to buy cleaning products for his store, and continue growing his business so that he can support his family.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha is a widow, and has two children for whom she is the only source of economic sustenance, and because of the misfortune they have found themselves with the death of her husband, she had to see the necessity of doing somethins to maintain her children. So, two years ago she commenced with much energy to form a little grocery store and now her children help her in the business, which has helped them to be able to move forward. Bertha is applying fo a loan of US $650, which she offers to pay in six months, to be able to buy more merchandise and be able to move forward with her two children who currently help her in the business. She is infinitely grateful for your help in being able to continue forward with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una persona viuda, y tiene dos hijos para los cuales ella es el único sostén económico, y a raíz de la desgracia que se les presento con el fallecimiento de su esposo tuvo que ver en la necesidad de hacer algo para mantener a sus hijos. Así, hace doce años comenzó con mucho esfuerzo a formar su negocio de tiendita de abarrotes y ahora sus hijos le apoyan en el negocio, el cual les a ayudado a poder salir adelante.

Bertha solicita un préstamo de USD $ 650, que ofrece pagar en 6 meses para poder comprar más mercancía y poder salir adelante con sus dos hijos que ahora le ayudan en el negocio, agradecen infinitamente tu ayuda para poder seguir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Claudia and Andres have form a family out of sacrifice and hard work in agriculture which they have been able to make a profit and saved some money, and now they have a small side business close to downtown Yuracmayo. Claudia spends most of her time and effort into this new venture.

Everything was going fine for this family, but a misfortune happened during their happiest time. One day, while the parents where working, the little one was at home playing and all of the sudden the baby suffered a terrible fall. He suffered trauma to his head, and they had to take him to the local hospital. The little one spent long months at the hospital at the care of his worried mother.

Just when they thought the worst was over and before the little one was completely heal, his older brother started suffering from strange blood evacuations through his ears. The pain and suffering the parents are going through is inexplicable, and they have since fallen into a deep depression. The small amount of money they had saved is not enough to pay for the hospital bills.

They can no longer spend time and money into their side business, and now they must work the fields to make ends meet. Andres has gone back to work the land because this is the only source of income for his family. They are requesting a loan in the amount of $425 to purchase vegetable seeds and to be able to make money and pay for the hospital bills for their two children. Let us reassure Andres that his hard work and dedication is not in vain. Let's help this family get some tranquility.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Claudia y Andrés han formado una familia que a costa de esfuerzo y sacrificio en el desempeño de su actividad agrícola han podido invertir también en la constitución de un pequeño nuevo negocio cerca de la plaza principal de la ciudad de Yuracmayo; al que Claudia le dedica ahora la mayor parte de su tiempo y esfuerzo. Hasta hace poco tiempo las cosas habían transcurrido de manera muy especial para los miembros de esta familia pero el infortunio se hizo presente en el momento de mayor felicidad. Un día de mucho sol mientras los padres desarrollaban sus actividades; el niño menor jugaba muy contento dentro de su hogar y al menor descuido sufrió una terrible caída que le ocasionó graves heridas en la cabeza por lo que tuvieron que internarlo en un nosocomio local por largos meses al cuidado de su preocupada madre. Cuando ya pensaban que había ocurrido lo peor y antes de que la recuperación sea del todo satisfactoria; su hermano mayor empezó a sufrir de extrañas evacuaciones de sangre, a través de los oídos, el dolor y preocupación de los padres por este inexplicable mal los ha sumido en una inmensa depresión y el poco dinero que habían ahorrado no ha sido suficiente para culminar con el tratamiento de su pequeño. El negocio acostumbrado y la nueva pequeña inversión que habían realizado no hace mucho tiempo también se han visto perjudicados a causa de estas circunstancias; en vista de que la necesidad los está apremiando y ya no cuentan con ningún sustento adicional. Andrés a decidido no abandonar sus labores agrícolas porque es la única ayuda con la que cuentan en este momento. Por ello solicita un préstamo por 425 dólares con el propósito de incrementar la siembra de vegetales en sus tierras para distribuirlos por las zonas aledañas a su localidad con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y poder continuar con el tratamiento y recuperación de sus dos pequeños hijos.Hagamos que el esfuerzo de Andrés le otorgue tranquilidad a su familia

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio has a business selling articles for the home. He has three children, but his income is not sufficient to maintain his family. His wife asked for his support in making an extra effort, to open a small general store to have more income and be able to pay for the basic needs of their children and the family. This project started two years ago, and she helps with the sales in the shop. Together they have been able to grow. Antonio is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more merchandise and stock his store with every day grocercy items to sell, providing for his family, growing his business, and improving the quality of life. He offers to pay back the loan in 6 months, and very much appreciates your support in helping his family move forward.

Antonio se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar y tiene tres hijos, sin embargo no es suficiente lo que él gana para mantener a su familia, su esposa le pidió apoyo para hacer un esfuerzo extra y tratar de poner una tienda de abarrotes para tener un mejor ingreso y solventar las necesidades básicas de sus hijos y de su familia en general, este proyecto se inicio dos años atrás y ella lo apoya vendiendo en la tienda y juntos han logrado hacerla crecer.

Antonio solicita un préstamo de USD $ 1,200, que ofrece pagar en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar mercancía y surtir su tienda de abarrotes para así poder mantener a su familia, crecer con el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Él está muy agradecido por tu ayuda que le brindas para salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his store, grow his business, provide for his family and improve the quality of life.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. María is 48 years old and completed her high school studies. She comes from Juanjuí, district of the Mariscal Cáceres province of the San Martín department. She has four children, but only two of them are her dependants. Because of her husband’s work, she moved to Trujillo, in the La Libertad department, and was forced to quit her business of shoe and clothes sales. She later seeked capital to start the business once more. Her neighbor invited her to participate in the “San Judas Tadeo” Communal Bank and, with her first loan of approximately $96, she bought guinea pigs, in order to raise and fatten them and then sell them. With subsequent loans she bought dairy products (cheese and butter), that she brings from Cajamarca and sells door to door. She presently carries out both activities. With the recent loan of approximately $386, received from Manuela Ramos, she will buy more pigs to raise, as well as poultry and food for these animals. Her dream is to be able to accumulate good savings, that will allow her to rest when she is no longer capable of working.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María tiene 48 años D. edad y estudió secundaria completa; es natural D. Juanjuí, distrito D. la Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres del Departamento D. San Martín; tiene 4 hijos, pero solamente dos dependen D. ella. Por motivos D. trabajo D. su esposo, vino a vivir a Trujillo, en el Departamento D. La Libertad, y tuvo que dejar su negocio D. venta D. zapatos y ropa. Luego buscó financiamiento para iniciar nuevamente un negocio; su vecina la invitó a participar del Banco Comunal “San Judas Tadeo” y con su primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300.00 ($96 aproximadamente) compró cuyes para criarlos y venderlos luego; con los otros préstamos adquirió productos lácteos (queso, mantequilla) que trae D. Cajamarca, los que sale a vender casa por casa; actualmente realiza ambas cosas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.1,200 ($ 386.00 aprox.) comprará más cuyes para criar, así como pollos y alimento para estos animales. Su sueño es tener un buen ahorro que le permita descansar tranquila cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry and pigs, and animal food.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and has a little boy. He was unemployed and facing economic difficulties, which was a critical situation for him because he is the only provider for his household and for his mother as well. So two years ago he recognized the necessity of beginning his own business by selling refreshments and chicharrones (crispy pork rinds). Upon seeing that sales were going well, he decided to sell tacos and hamburgers too, which gave him a profit and enabled him to provide for his family and for his mother. He is very happy with his business and hopes to continue moving it forward and improving his personal growth.

Antonio is requesting a loan of $550 to be able to stock the ingredients for his business and buy a stove, fixing the room where they prepare everything, and enabling him to continue providing for his little son. Thanks for all your support, because this is how Antonio can improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Antonio está casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, al verse en situación critica de desempleado y estar en una situación difícil económicamente ya que es el único sostén de su casa y su madre, se vio en la necesidad hace dos años de iniciar su negocio de venta refrescos y chicharrones, y al ver que le funcionaba la venta decidió vender también tacos y hamburguesas, lo cual le dio resultado, y puede mantener a su familia y a su madre, él esta muy contento con su negocio y desea seguir progresando y continuar con el crecimiento del mismo.

Antonio solicita un préstamo de USD $ 550 para poder surtir lo elemental del negocio y comprar una estufa, arreglar el cuarto donde preparan todo lo necesario y seguir manteniendo a su hijo pequeño, agradece toda tu ayuda porque así puede seguir adelante.

loans.use: Remodel and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Patricia Alejandra

texts.es:
Patricia is married and has two children. Her husband is a TV and radio repair man, and cannot earn enough money to fully support his family. After seeing the situation that he was in she started to buy paper products to sell and help out her family financially. In addition to playing the lottery (a typical game in Mexico) she began buying notebooks, sheets of paper, pencils, pens, and things like this. Little by little, she kept acquiring more things to get herself ahead.

Patricia is asking for a loan of $475, and hopes to pay it back in a period of 3 months. The loan is to be used to buy more paper products, and make her business bigger and therefore her sales too. Already, the people are asking for her products to buy. Having a larger assortment will assist her in helping to maintain her family. Thanks to all for your help so that I will be able to do better in my business.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia es casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo se dedica a la reparación de televisores y radios y no le alcanza su dinero para mantener a su familia, por ver la situación en la que estaba empezó a comprar papelería para vender y ayudar económicamente a su familia además de hacer lotería (juego típico en México), comenzó comprando libretas, hojas, lápiz, plumas y así poco a poco cada vez fui haciéndose de mas cosas, para poder salir adelante.

Patricia pide un préstamo de USD $ 475, esperando pagar el este en un plazo de 3 meses para poder comprar más papelería y poder hacer mas grande su negocio y por ende sus ventas, ya que la buscan mucho sus vecinas para comprar y tener mayor surtido y así poder ayudar en la manutención de su familia, agradece todo el apoyo brindado para mejorar en su negocio.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is widowed and has four children in school. She is a taco and hamburger street vendor. Ever since she became a widower the pension she received had been the only source of income for her family, but it was not enough. She had to look for another source of income, and she decided to dedicate herself to the sale of tacos and hamburgers seven years ago. She did this to be able to support her family, and to be able to get her children ahead by offering them an education and a better quality of life.

Juana is soliciting a loan of $200 in order to fix up her car for her tacos, which is her stand. She is offering to repay the loan within a 5 month period. With it she can continue to receive that income so that she can maintain her family. Thank you for the help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es viuda y tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, ella se dedica a la venta de tacos y hamburguesas ya que desde que enviudo es el único sostén de su familia y con la pensión que recibe no le alcanza, tuvo que buscar otra fuente de ingresos y decidió ponerse a vender tacos y hamburguesas desde hace siete años atrás para poder mantener a su familia y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 200 para poder mejorar su carro para tacos que es su puesto de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5 meses, con ello poder seguir recibiendo esa entrada de dinero para que pueda mantener a su familia, te agradece apoyo que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: Remodel

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha is a married woman, and started selling candy and refreshments in order to help her husband with the family expenses. Her husband works in a candy factory and does not receive a high income. Seeing the success that she had selling candy and refreshments she got excited to continue augmenting her supplies, so much so that she had to add on to her house to have more space for her business. This has helped her very much to cover the costs of her family and to help her husband with the same. She hopes to continue with her business and grow even more.

Bertha requires a loan of $275 UDS to buy more supplies for the store. She is offering to pay back the loan in 2 months and to continue helping her family. She thanks you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una mujer casada, y comenzó vendiendo dulces y refrescos para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. su familia ya que su esposo trabaja en una fabrica D. dulces y no percibe un buen sueldo; al ver el éxito que tenia por L. venta D. dulces y refrescos se animo a seguir aumentando su mercancía al grado D. que tuvo que ampliar su casa para darle mas espacio al negocio D. abarrotes, el cual le a ayudado mucho para poder cubrir los gastos familiares y ayudar a su esposo con los mismos, elL. desea continuar con su negocio y crecer aún más.

Bertha requiere D. un préstamo D. USD $ 275 para poder comprar más mercancía para surtir L. tienda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 2 meses y seguir apoyando a su familia, elL. te agradece el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: By supplies

loans.name: Luís Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis Eduardo is single and works in a food factory. Although he is not married he does not like to be an extra burden for his family, and his sister inspired him to sell clothing and shoes from the United States. He started approximately two years ago with a little bit of capital that he obtained when he was let go from is previous employment. Thanks to his effort he has been able to get ahead, and has been able to support himself. In addition to self employment, he wishes to continue with his business and grow into becoming a micro industrialist.

Luis is soliciting a loan of $650 USD, and is offering to pay it back in a period of 6 months. The loan will be used to buy bedding sheets and blankets, and clothing for children so that he can move forward with his business and have a better quality of life. Thank you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís Eduardo es soltero trabaja en una fábrica de alimentos, a pesar de que no está casado no le gusta ser una carga para su familia y su hermana lo animó para vender ropa y calzado traídos de Estados Unidos, comenzó hace aproximadamente dos años, con un pequeño capital que obtuvo cuando lo despidieron de su anterior trabajo y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y poder mantenerse, además de auto emplearse, el desea continuar con su negocio y crecer como microempresario.

Luís esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 650, ofreciendo pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses para poder comprar juegos de sabanas que también vende y algo de ropa para niños, para poder salir adelante con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida, muchísimas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is married and has six children. She started a shoe sales business approximately four years ago. At that time, her husband, working as a school teacher, struggled to make a living for the family and they found themselves in a bad financial situation. Her 20 years old daughter helps her with the business and they have incorporated clothes sales as well. Marina, a hardworking woman, wants to be able to continue with her business and to make it grow, as it has greatly helped her cover her household expenses.

Marina is requesting a $925 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to stock up on shoes and be able to help her husband make a living for the family. She thanks your support to her life quality improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina es casada y tiene seis hijos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 4 años la venta de calzado. En ese entonces, siendo su esposo maestro de primaria, le era muy difícil mantener a su familia y no estaban muy bien económicamente. Su hija de 20 años le ayuda con la venta de zapatos y poco después incorporaron la venta de ropa. Ahora Marina desea poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, ya que le ha ayudado mucho para solventar los gastos de su hogar y ella es muy trabajadora.

Marina está solicitando un préstamo de US$ 925, a pagar en un plazo de seis meses, para poder seguir surtiendo calzado y poder apoyar a su esposo en mantener a su familia, y agradece mucho tu apoyo a la mejora de su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Marleni Maruja

texts.es:
Senora Marleni is 38 years old. She completed her secondary education, and she lives in the neighborhood of the Virgin de la Puerta in San Isidro. She has 2 young daughters who depend on her.

Marleni has a general store in her house. Two years ago she decided to dedicate herself to this business, selling from her house to be able to take care of her children. She started with a few products such as rice, oil and milk. She wanted to grow her business but she did not have capital. Then her mother in law, who worked in a communal bank in Carabamba, told her about the institution and the communal bank "San Judas Tadeo". with the first loan of approximately $95 that she received, Marleni was able to open the store, buying other products such as sodas, crackers, bathroom tissue, etc.

Marleni tells us that she will continue to work as long as God allows her to, because she wants to continue to improve her situation, especially for her children.

La señora Marleni tiene 38 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa, vive en el barrio Virgen de la Puerta del sector San Isidro, del Distrito de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 2 hijas menores de edad que dependen de ella. Tiene una bodega en su domicilio. Hace doce años decidió dedicarse a la bodega vendiendo en su casa para que de ese modo pueda cuidar a sus hijas; empezó con unos cuantos productos como: arroz, aceite y leche; deseaba implementar su negocio pero no tenía capital, es ahí cuando su suegra socia de un banco comunal de Carabamba le informa sobre la institución y forma el Banco Comunal “San Judas Tadeo”, con el primer préstamos que recibió de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $96) pudo implementar la bodega, comprando otros productos como gaseosas, galletas, papel higiénico, etc. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,100 ($ 354.00 aprox.) comprará productos al por mayor para obtener mejores precios: arroz, leche, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. La señora Marleni nos dice que continuará trabajando hasta que Dios le permita porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia especialmente a sus hijas.

loans.use: Buy every day products such as rice, sugar, milk, etc for her store

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is originally from Creel, in Chihuahua. He is single, and due to the lack of employment in his area, he started his own business selling tortillas to help his family. Sadly, his mother died recently and it's been very difficult for him to get through this huge loss. He wants to grow his business and be able to offer care for his future family. This is why he is working so hard to improve the quality of the service he offers.

Fernando is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a new machine, which he hopes will increase his production and increase his area of business. He has committed to pay back this loan in 6 months, and he sincerely appreciates the support and confidence that you offer him. Be a part of his achievements with your support.

Fernando es originario de Creel en Chihuahua, él es soltero y ante la falta de empleo en la localidad inició su propio negocio con la venta de tortillas, para poder ayudar a su familia, lamentablemente su madre falleció hace poco y ha sido muy difícil para él superar esta gran pérdida. Fernando desea hace crecer su negocio y tener un patrimonio para ofrecerle a su futura familia, por lo que se esfuerza mucho para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece.

Fernando está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de una máquina nueva con lo que espera incrementar su producción y ampliar su área de servicio, él se compromete e regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Fernando agradece sinceramente el apoyo y la confianza que le brindas, forma parte de sus logros, decídete a apoyarlo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase machinery

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora is a very hardworking, enthusiastic woman. She is single and has 3 children. Dora has put great effort into improving her family's situation. On her own, looking for a better quality of life for her children, she used her savings to start her business. She makes tortillas, and the good quality of the products she sells has allowed her to increase her customers, and little by little grow the business.
