Right now, Dora needs a loan of $550 to buy a scale, to be able to improve the quality of the service she offers. She has committed to pay back the loan in 6 months. You can form an important part of the life of this family and help those who need it most. They appreciate your help.

Dora es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Dora ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, en busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos utilizó sus ahorros para emprender su negocio donde elabora tortillas, la buena calidad de los productos que vende le han permitido incrementar sus clientes y poco a poco ir creciendo con su negocio.

En estos momentos, Dora necesita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una báscula para poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia y ayuda a quien más lo necesita, ellos te lo agradecerán.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa lives in an area called Creel, in Chihuahua. She is married and has 3 children, who have been the motivation for her to start her own business selling shoes and lingerie by catalog. Her husband sells furniture, but sometimes there are bad seasons and it's very difficult to cover all the household costs. Thanks to Teresa's character, which enables her to get along well with others, and the good service she offers, she has grown her business.

To be able to cover the demands of her clients and buy more merchandise for the new season, Teresa is requesting a loan of $475 which she has committed to pay back in 6 months. You can be a fundamental part of the development of this business. Teresa and her family sincerely appreciate your help.

En la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua vive Teresa, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, ellos la han motivado a iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos y lencería por catálogo ya que su esposo se dedica a vender muebles pero en ocasiones pasa por malas temporadas y era muy difícil poder cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. Gracias al carácter de Teresa que le facilita relacionarse con los demás y al buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y comprar mercancía de esta nueva temporada, Teresa está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Decídete a formar parte fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, Teresa y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is single and has a young daughter. They live in her parents house. To be able to make progress with her family, she decided to undertake a business selling groceries. She arranged a room in the house, and started with very few products, but thanks to the good service she offered she has been able to grow her business, adding the variety of products to meet her clients demands.

Right now, Elizabeth needs a loan of $275 to buy merchandise, which she hopes will improve her business and incorporate the sales of other products very much in demand in her area. She has committed to repay the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part of the growth of this business if you decide to help. Please help those who need it most. Elizabeth and her family appreciate it very much.

Elizabeth es soltera, tiene una pequeña hija y viven en casa de sus padres. Para salir adelante con su familia decidió emprender su negocio con la venta de abarrotes, acondicionando una habitación, comenzó con muy pocos productos pero gracias al buen servicio que ofrece ha podido hacer crecer su negocio, incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Elizabeth necesita un crédito de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía con lo que espera surtir mejor su negocio e incorporar la venta de otros productos que son muy demandados en su localidad, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a apoyar a quien mas lo necesita, Elizabeth y su familia te lo agradecen mucho.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
"I need to finish the construction of a protective fence in front of my house. I have young children and I feel they would be more secure." I am requesting $1200 to finish this construction.

“Necesito terminar la construcción de la barda de enfrente en mi vivienda ya que tengo hijos pequeños y siento que estarían más seguros” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de la barda.

loans.use: Complete the construction of a protective fence

loans.name: Husnah

texts.id:
Husnah has a Fried soybean business. With a capital of Rp500,000 (about US$55)/day, Husnah bought raw soybean from a supplier or people who harvest soybeans. From her very simple kitchen, since she still use firewood as fuel, every day Husnah fried 1 kwintal (100kgs? or 220lbs?) soybeans. This was done daily from 9:00 AM to 2:00PM, and she could profit Rp60,000 ($6.60). From that profit Husnah provide the income for a husband and grandchild who now sits in 6th grade, since her husband does not have a steady income. The house she lived in was self built, with brick wall and cement floor. Loan from DINARI will be used to buy more soybeans so that every day she could fry 2 kwintals with the hope to increase her income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Husnah mempunyai usaha Produksi kacang kedelai goreng.Dengan modal Rp.500.000,-perhari,Husnah membeli kedelai mentah di supplier atau masyarakat yang sedang panen kedelai. Dari dapurnya yang sangat sederhana karena masih memakai perapian dari kayu bakar, setiap hari Husnah menggoreng 1 kwintal Kedelai ,yang dilakukan dari jam 09.00 wita sampai 14.00 Wita dan keuntungan yang diperolehnya sebesar Rp 60.000.- Dengan keuntungan tersebutlah Husnah bisa menghidupi suami dan 1 orang cucunya yang kini duduk di kelas 6 SD, karena suaminya tidak mempunyai penghasilan yang tetap. Sedangkan rumah yang ditempati sekarang dibangun sendiri, dengan dinding yang ditembok namun lantainya masih dari semen.Pinjaman dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk tambahan membeli kedelai agar setiap hari Husnah bisa menggoreng 2 kwintal dengan harapan penghasilan yang didapat akan lebih meningkat.

loans.use:
To buy more soybeans so that she could produce more

Membeli kacang kedelai lebih banyak lagi sehingga dapat memproduksi lebih banyak

loans.name: Ni Wayan Cenik

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Cenik is a hardworking women figure. In her busy day as a mother, Wayan Cenik has to help her husband increase the family income. Pig farming, and also selling animal feed is her daily activity. With a capital of Rp5000,000 (US$550) obtain from Dinari, Wayan Cenik would provide several animal feed needs for nearby farmers. From rice shells, wheat shells, concentrate to medicine for animals. From selling animal feed Wayan Cenik could obtain a monthly profit of about Rp700,000 (about $77). This profit is used to pay for her 3 children still studying. Wayan Cenik hope that the extra capital to be obtained could add her income so that her children could finish schooling.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Cenik merupakan figur wanita pekerja keras .Ditengah kesibukan sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga, Wayan Cenik harus membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga.Beternak babi sekaligus berjualan pakan ternak merupakan aktifitas usaha dalam keseharian hidupnya. Dengan modal Rp 5.000.000.- yang diperoleh dari Dinari Wayan Cenik menyediakan berbagai kebutuhan pakan bagi peternak yang ada disekitarnya. Mulai dari dedak padi, dedak gandum,konsentrat sampai obat –obatan untuk ternak.Dari usaha berjualan pakan ternak ini Wayan Cenik memperoleh keuntungan rata-rata perbulan hingga Rp 700.000.- Keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk membiayai 3 orang anaknya yang semuanya masih kuliah .Wayan Cenik berharap dengan tambahan modal yang diperolehnya bisa menambah pendapatannya supaya anaknya tetap bisa menyelesaikan sekolahnya.

loans.use:
To buy animal feed

Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
I am Sakina B. the mother of five children. I knit woolen sweaters and then stitch them on a machine that I bought through multiple installments. I am the only one to support my family and I alone cannot produce a large number of sweaters.

Therefore, I wish to hire another woman to help me in the business. I will also buy an additional sewing machine, various colored wool and threads to produce high quantity of sweaters. This in turn will generate decent profits. In order to buy the required material and therefore increase my business profits, I will require $300 USD in loans.

loans.use: To buy wool to make sweaters

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
I am Mumtaz B. and I live in Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, with my husband and six children. My husband is a wall painter, however, his income is not a steady source of money because he is just on on-call, contract work.

For a living, I make paper envelopes. A shopkeeper gives me the raw material (paper) and then I turn this into envelopes. Despite this dedicated and hard work, I am underpaid for my work.

I know that it is very important to get our children educated these days but I am not in a position to afford paying for their education. I wish to improve my income by purchasing the paper to manufacture the envelopes instead of making it for the shopkeeper. There is a large demand for paper envelopes and I believe that I have the right expertise to respond to this market demand. Therefore, I am asking for a loan of $225 USD.

loans.use: To buy paper for making paper envelopes

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
For a living, I add sequins on embroidered shirts that are ordered for a local boutique. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. Together, we have five children, of whom are studying.

Moreover, as my children are growing, so are their needs. The rickshaw is our major source of income, as I do not get sequins orders regularly. For sequined clothing, the number of orders really depend on the customer demand and season.

Currently, our rickshaw needs maintenance which will cost us up to $175 USD. However, we do not have the money to get it repaired. Therefore, we are asking for a loan of $175 USD which we will pay back over 12 months.

loans.use: To repair rickshaw

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
For the past 13 years, I have been stitching clothes for my neighborhood clients. My husband operates a catering shop. He started this business a couple of years ago by taking a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The income improved and enabled us to bring three meals on our table everyday.

I have two children who are not old enough to attend school. When they grow old enough, I will send them to school for sure.

We wish to expand our catering business because the wedding season will start right after the Eid (a Muslim festival). Thus, we need a $200 USD loan to buy additional items such as new tents, carpets, etc. that are required to take on big orders.

loans.use: To expand the catering business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C., 19, lives with her husband, one little child, and one of her parents in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her baby, while her husband, 20, provides income for his household by buying and selling recyclable products in his community. He typically makes around $3.60 each day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport their recyclable items further, more easily, faster and more effectively.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their recyclable items further, more easily, faster and more effectively.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Farhod and his wife (see picture) rent a point of sale on the central market. They sell fresh fruit and vegetables. Farhod purchases the produce, while his wife sells them. Farhod also does small jobs for private entities in order to bring home some extra income. The profit from the business and the small jobs make up the family budget. Farhod is 36 and he has three children. Farhod has been a client of MicroInvest for the past year and a half and is planing to continue borrowing funds in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Фарход и его жена (она на фото)арендуют торговое место на центральном рынке. Она продают свежие фрукты и овощи. Фарход ездит за товаром а его жена продает их. Кроме этого Фарход подрабатывает на разных работах у частных лиц. Все эти доходы составляют его семейный доход. Фарходу 36 лет, у него 3 детей. Фарход сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже 1,5 года и планирует и дальше получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса..

loans.use: For further expansions

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Mrs. Hing S., 40, lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her household, Mrs. Hing S. runs a small grocery booth in her area, where she is able to generate around $3 each day. In addition, three of her children are employed at a garment factory. Mrs. Hing S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ demand.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ demand.

loans.name: I Wayan Sudiartaya

texts.id:
"SUBAK" is the name of the organization that arrange distribution of rice-field water in Bali Island. This inherited from parents organization, started as traditional organization taht only distributed rice-field water. Today SUBAK not only arrange for water distribution, but also to provide business opportunities within this organization. I Made Sudiartaya as SUBAK head plays a big role in these business opportunities. In processing farming needs support materials like: fertilizer: Ponska, Urea, TSP (local brands), and also seeds for plants like rice, corn and soybean. With a capital of Rp6,000,000 (about US$675), I Made Sudiartaya would try to provide those support materials. I Made Sudiartaya would supply fertilizer and seed for 20 farmers working on an area of 15 hectares. The fertilizer would be bought from local distributor KUD in large quantity to obtain lower quantity discount price. I Made Sudiartaya thjen sold to the farmers depending on their needs. Problems facing I Made Sudiartaya are payment issues. The farmers would pay for fertilizer or seed by Harvest payment system (once every 5 months). Only after 5 months could I Made Sudiartaya obtain his profits. Payment were done by cash or farmers production like in dried shell rice, corn or soybean. In 5 months I Made Sudiartaya could get about 750kg in shell dried rice, or when cashed about Rp1,500,000 (about $167). I Made Sudiartaya would like to add more fertilizers and seeds to supply another 25 farmers working on an area of 30 hectares.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

’’SUBAK” itulah nama organisasi pengaturan air sawah yang ada di Pulau Bali.Organisasi warisan dari orang tua di Bali ini berawal dari organisasi tradisinal yang semula hanya mengatur pembagian air disawah . Saat ini Subak tidak hanya untuk mengatur pengairan saja tetapi juga banyak peluang usaha yang tersedia dalam organisasi ini. I Made Sudiartaya sebagai Ketua Subak banyak berperan dalam peluang usaha ini.Dalam pegolahan lahan pertanian diperlukan sarana penunjang usaha seperti Pupuk :Ponska, Urea ,TSP dan juga diperlukan bibit untuk tanaman seperti bibit padi, jagung dan kedelai. Dengan modal usaha Rp 6.000.0000,- I Made Sudiartaya berusaha menyediakan sarana tersebut diatas. I Made Sudiartaya menyediakan kebutuhan pupuk dan bibit untuk 20 orang petani dengan lahan seluas 15 Ha. Pupuk ini di beli di KUD dalam jumlah besar sehingga mendapat harga yang lebih murah. I Made Sudiartaya kemudian menjualnya kepada para petani sesuai dengan kebutuhannya masing-masing.Masalah yang dihadapai oleh I Made Sudiartaya adalah masalah pembayaran .Petani akan membayar pupuk atau bibit dengan sistem bayar panen ( 5 bulan sekali ).Setelah 5 bulan barulah I Made Sudiartaya bisa menikmati keutungannya .Pembayaran yang dilakukan bisa dengan uang kas atau hasil produksi petani berupa gabah kering, jagung atau kedelai. Dalam 5 bulan I Made Sudiartaya bisa mendapat gabah kering 750 kg atau bila diuangkan Rp. 1.500.000,-. I Made Sudiartaya bermaksud menambah pupuk aau bibit lebih banyak lagi supaya bisa melayani 25 orang lagi dengan luas lahan 30 ha..

loans.use:
To buy fertilizer for resell to farmers

Membeli pupuk untuk dijual kembali kepada petani

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Purnawati

texts.id:
As a wife, Gusti Ayu Purnawati has to help her husband to increase the household income. Pig farming while selling animal feed seems to be the right choice, since it could be done from home. With a loan of Rp 5000,000 (about US$550) Gusti Ayu would cover all feed assortment for pig farming. Types of animal feed, she sells are: rice shells, wheat shells, concentrate and medicine specially for pig farming. Capital needed monthly to buy sales items are about Rp5,000,000 (about $550). Since she already have customers, she only needs to wait for the buyers come to her home. Every month Gusti Ayu orders supply 2 or 3 times, or she could sell 6 tons of assortments of animal feed. With a profit of Rp350,000 (about $38.50) she could clearly use it to support the family's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang istri, Gusti Ayu Purnawati harus membantu suami dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga. Beternak babi dan sekaligus berjualan pakan ternak merupakan pilihan tepat karena semua aktifitas usaha dapat dilakukan di rumah. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dianari sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- Gusti Ayu melengkapi semua jenis kebutuhan pakan bagi peternak babi. Jenis pakan ternak yang dijualnya seperti : Dedak Padi, Dedak Gandum, Konsentrat dan obat-obatan khusus untuk ternak babi . Modal yang diperlukan per bulan untuk membeli barang dagangan sekitar Rp.5.000.000,-. Karena sudah memiliki langganan, Gusti Ayu hanya menunggu pembeli datang kerumahnya. Dalam setiap bulannya Gusti Ayu mengorder barang sebanyak 2 sampai 3 kali atau bisa menjual 6 ton pakan ternak dengan berbagai jenis. Dengan keuntungan Rp. 350.000.- per bulan jelas dapat dimanfaatkan untuk menunjang pendapatan keluarga.

loans.use:
Buying animal feed to supply customers from surrounding areas

Membeli pakan ternak untuk melayani pelanggan dari masyarakat sekitarnya

loans.name: Ni Wayan Suardani

texts.id:
Wayan Suardani started his livestock supplies store business since 2000. He sells daily essentials. But his daily profit from business of Rp 25.000 does not cover his expenditure. Wayan must obtain funding of Rp 500.000 (USD55), - s/d Rp 600.000, - monthly to cover living expenses and his son’s education. Most of the funding is to increase his livestock supplies business, selling livestock feed. Every fortnightly, Wayan orders between 2 to 2.5 tons of supplies. Selling livestock supplies supplement her fortnightly income of Rp 600.000 (USD70). Currently, Wayan is in need of additional funding of Rp 5.000.000 (USD550). With this funding she can increase her volume of business thus increasing her profit.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Wayan Suardani memulai usaha warungnya sejak tahun 2000.Barang –barang yang dijual adalah merupakan kebutuhan sehari –hari. Keuntungan yang di dapatnya perhari Rp. 25.000, tetapi dibanding dengan pengeluaran yang dikeluarkan masih belum menutupi.Wayan Suardani harus menyediakan dana Rp. 500.000,- s/d Rp 600.000,- perbulannya untuk biaya hidupnya dan pendidikan anaknya di SMP.Banyaknya permohonan akan pakan ternak membuatnya menambah dagangan dengan menjual pakan ternak babi. Jenis pakan ternak babi yang dijual seperti Dedak Padi, Dedak Gandum,Konsentrat. Setiap dua minggu Wayan Suardani mengoder 2 sampai 2,5 ton pakan dari supliyer. Menjual pakan ternak ini justru dapat menambah incomenya antara Rp. 600.000,- perdua minggu.Saat ini Wayan Suardani sangat memerlukan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-.Dengan modal inilah Wayan Suardani berharap bisa menjual lebih banyak lagi sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehpun bisa meningkat.

loans.use: Purchase livestock supplies for the demand within the community (Membeli pakan ternak untuk melayani pembeli dari masyarakat sekitar rumahnya)

loans.name: Rita Pascoal

texts.pt:
Rita Pascoal T. is a member of the Raquelina group, along with Ms. Amélia Xavier Chirindza. They both started the program in 2004, receiving loans of 960 and 1520 meticals [Mozambique currency] respectively, as their first loans. Rita sells beverages and basics at the market in Matola. They are now on their 9th loan cycle, receiving 12,920 and 7,640 meticals respecitively. Their businesses have grown continuously and they have both improved their housing conditions and the education of their children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita Pascoal T. é membro do grupo Raquelina a par da senhora Amélia Xavier Chirindza. Ambas entraram no programa em 2004 tendo tomado 960MT e 1520MT, respectivamente, como 1º empréstimo. A primeira vende bebidas e a segunda frangos e produtos de 1ª necessidade no mercado 19 de Outubro na Matola. Vão já para o 9º ciclo de empréstimo e vão tomar 12.920MT e 7.640Mt, respectivamente. Têm evoluído contínuamente, tendo conseguido ambas melhorar as condições de habitação e educação dos filhos.

loans.use: Business support.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kusumawati

texts.id:
36-year old, Ni Ketut Kusumawati, realized the difficulty in village life with increasing cost of living. Unemployed, her thought was to create a business of breeding pigs. 1 sow usually reproduces twice a year, approximately 40 piglets. Each piglet can be sold for Rp 150.000 (about USD20). Gross income can amount to Rp 3.000.000 (USD330) each half-yearly. Ni Ketut Kusumawati required additional capital of Rp 1.300.000 (USD150) to purchase another breeder sow to supplement her business thus generating more income to support her children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Kusumawati 36 tahun ini merasakan beratnya hidup desa .Biaya hidup yang semakin hari semakin bertambah harus terpenuhi setiap saat. Tidak ada peluang kerja lebih baik menciptakan sendiri itulah pikirnya . Ni Ketut Kusumawati memelihara induk babi. Satu induk babi bisa berproduksi 2 kali dalam setahun .Sekitar 40 ekor anak ( bibit ) dalam satu tahunnya. Satu ekor bibit babi dijual Rp.150.000,- .Keuntungan kotor bisa didapatkannya sebesar Rp. 3.000.000, per enam bulannya. Ni Ketut Kusumawati memerlukan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp 1.300.000 untuk membeli satu ekor induk babi lagi supaya keuntungan yang didapat semakin besar yang nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya ke tingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow - female pig (Membeli Induk Babi)

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Suarni

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Suarni owns a pig breeding business of the local Bali breed. Currently, she has 2 breeder sows. Her daily routine of feeding them were tedious but the rewards will be big and promising. Within about 5 months, her pigs produced about 8 to 12 piglets. And within a month can be sold for between Rp 100.000 – Rp 150.000 (about USD10 to 15) each. With the loan of Rp 1.400.000 (USD150), over 4 months Ni Nyoman Suarni generated profit of Rp 800.000 (USD90), monthly profit of Rp 200.000 to cover living expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Suarni mempunyai usaha ternak babi penginduk babi jenis lokal atau babi Bali. Saat ini Nyoman Suarni memelihara 2 ekor induk babi lokal . Setiap hari ritinitas yang dilakukan memberi makan babinya sekilas memang rutinitas yang sangat membosankan tapi mendatangkan pendapatan yang besar dan menjanjikan. Empat sampai lima bulan babinya sudah bisa beranak sekitar 8-12 ekor. Dalam waktu satu bulan kemudian babi sudah dapat dijual dengan harga berkisar Rp. 100.000,- s/d Rp. 150.000,-./ekor Dengan modal 1.400.000,- selama 4 bulan Ni Nyoman Suarni bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 800.000,- . Setiap bulan bisa mendapat penghasilan Rp.200.000,- untuk biaya hidup keluarga mereka.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow - female pig (Membeli Induk babi)

loans.name: I Nyoman Darma

texts.id:
Breeding pigs in Bali is not only carried out by women, as an example, I Nyoman Darma a father is not ashamed to do it as it good work and lucrative. Currently, Nyoman Darma raises the local Bali breed because the community requires this breed for religious ceremonies. Nyoman Darma raises the breeder sow, which in a year can produce twice, each time with up to 8 piglets. He needed this additional capital to purchase another breeder sow, which he had already readied a pen. With this additional breeder sow his consideration and output will increase.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha beternak babi di Bali tidak hanya dilakukan oleh kaum wanita saja contohnya I Nyoman Darma adalah seorang bapak yang tidak pernah merasa malu untuk melakukan suatu pekerjaan yang baik dan menguntungkan. Nyoman Darma pun bisa melakukan usaha beternak babi dan semuanya dilakukan dengan sabar. Saat ini Nyoman Darma memelihara babi jenis Lokal atau babi Bali. Karena masyarakat di Bali banyak membutuhkan babi jenis ini untuk upacara keagamaan. Nyoman Darma memelihara induk babi yang dalam setahun bisa berproduksi sebanyak dua kali, dengan perkiraan jumlah anak per satu kali panen sebanyak 8 ekor. Nyoman Darma sangat membutuhkan modal tambahan untuk membeli satu ekor induk babi lagi.Untuk keperluan itu, Nyoman Darma sudah menyiapkan kandang yang kosong. Dengan menambah jumlah induk babi, perhitungan Nyoman Darma jumlah penghasilannya pun bertambah.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sows (Membeli induk babi untuk menambah populasi babinya, sehingga dapat dijual untuk meningkatkan pendapatannya)

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Daler A. has been selling bicycle parts for 4 years. He started his small sales business to help his parents. In 2005, Daler joined MicroInvest. Then, his business assets were only about $30. After receiving the loan, Daler used the money to purchase additional inventory and gain additional clients. In the future, Daler plans to increase the inventory and move his business to a place with better conditions.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Далер 23 года. Занимается продажей запчастей для велосипеда, вот уже 4года. Чтобы помочь родителям он начал заниматься торговлей. В 2005году стал клиентом в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда его активы составляли 30$. После получения займа и целевого использования он увеличил ассортимент товара, начал ездить за товаром сам, приобрел много клиентов, расширил место деятельности. В будущем планирует приобрести место с хорошими условиями и увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: Move the business to a place with better conditions

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sukarmi

texts.id:
Wayan Sukarmi’s husband works as a skilled construction laborer whose monthly income is unpredictable. To pay for food and her children’s education she needs Rp 700.000 (about USD80) per month. With her pig breeding business she is able to supplement her husband’s income. Currently, she has 1 breeder sow, each birthing produces 10 to 12 piglets every 4 months, worth Rp 250.000 (about USD30). With this loan of Rp 1.300.000 (USD150), she intends to purchase feed increase the number of breeder sows thus increasing her income to cover her family’s expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Suami Wayan Sukarmi bekerja sebagai seorang buruh tukang bangunan yang memiliki penghasilan tidak tetap setiap bulannya.Untuk Biaya makan dan biaya sekolah anaknya dalam satu bulan memerlukan dan Rp 700.000 dengan usaha inilah Wayan Sukarmi dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya yaitu menjalankan usaha beternak babi.Saat ini Wayan Sukarmi memelihara 1 Ekor induk babi yang sekali melahirkan anak bisa mencapai 10 sampai 12 ekor per 4 Bulan yang harga perekornya Rp 250.000. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000,- ini Wayan Sukarmi pergunakan untuk membeli pakan dan juga rencananya ingin menambah jumlah induk babinya agar jumlah pendapatannya bertambah untuk bisa menutupi biaya kebutuhan kelurganya setiap bulan.

loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow (female pig) and feed (Membeli induk babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a small booth selling pork/beef rice, porridge, and noodle soup in front of her home, where she can generally earn around $3 each day. Her husband is employed at a private company as a driver, earning $3 per day as well. One of her children works in a company and two attend school. All in all, Mrs. Kim S. hopes to use this loan to invest in a stand selling provisions and vegetables to generate additional profit for her family’s savings.

loans.use: To invest in a stand selling provisions and vegetables, to generate additional profit for her family’s savings

loans.name: I Putu Suryadi

texts.id:
I Putu Suryadi is a pig breeder. Currently, he rear 2 piglets, the local Bali breed. The expectation from this diligent activity is that when the piglets are 4 to 5 months will be sold for Rp 800.000 (about USD90) each. Due to insufficient funding, Putu is only able to rear 2 pigs, which is too few. Putu needs funding of Rp 1.300.000 (about USD150) to buy 4 more piglets. Hopefully, the numbers reared will grow thus increasing his income to support his family; wife and child who had just turn 6-month old.

Translated from Indonesian to English By Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

I Putu Suryadi adalah seorang peternak babi. Saat ini Putu Suryadi memelihara 2 ekor bibit babi jenis lokal Bali. Kegiatan ini ditekuni dengan harapan setelah anak babi yang dipelihara berumur 4 sampai 5 bulan akan dijual kepada penggepul dengan harga Rp 800.000 per ekornya.Bagi Putu Suryadi memelihara 2 ekor babi terlalu sedikit itu dikarenakan kurangnya modal yang dimiliki.Putu Suryani membutuhkan modal sebesar Rp 1.300.000 untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi lagi. Harapan kedepanya ternak yang dipelihara semakin banyak dan dapat menambah pengasilan keluarga untuk membiayai kebutuhan hidup istri dan seorang anaknya yang baru ber umur 6 bulan.

loans.use: Membeli Pakan dan bibit Babi

loans.name: Saniyem

texts.id:
Saniyem has 3 grown-up children and although some are already married, she is not freed of her responsibility because they are still living with and dependent on her. She is burdened with the responsibilities of her family. But currently, she managed her store diligently since 1996 sufficient to support the daily-required expenses of Rp 35.000 – Rp 40.000 (approximately USD4). With the load from DINARI of Rp 10.000.000 (about USD1,100), she plan to fund a restaurant for her son, Slamet because he has not had a permanent job. Besides that her home is strategic location for a restaurant. With an approximate profit of Rp 35.000 – Rp 40.000 daily from a capital of Rp 200.000.

Translated from Indonesian to English By Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Mempunyai 3 orang anak yang sudah besar-besar dan sebagian sudah menikah bukan berarti bebas tanggungan, buktinya ketiga anaknya tersebut masih tinggal dan menggantungkan hidup mereka bersama Saniyem. sehingga tanggungan atau beban keluarganya cukup banyak.Tetapi saat ini usaha warung yang telah ditekuninya sejak tahun 1996 cukup membantu memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-harinya sebesar Rp.35.000 - Rp.40.000.Dan modal yang diterima dari DINARI sebesar Rp.10.000.000.- rencananya akan dibuatkan sebuah warung makan untuk anaknya yang bernama Slamet, karena sampai saat ini anaknya tersebut belum mempunyai usaha yang tetap. Disamping itu tempat tinggal Saniyem cukup strategis untuk dibuka usaha warung makan. Dengan perkiraan keuntungan Rp.35.000 - Rp.40.000 perhari dengan modal Rp.200.000.

loans.use: Purchase household necessities/supplies (Membeli bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan rumah tangga)

loans.name: Endang

texts.en: Endang is 27 years old and married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, and fried snacks, as well as many other items. Her husband, Asep, is a musician in a group with a fluctuating income. Endang has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a $100 loan to buy some food and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Nurjanah

texts.en: Nurjanah A. is 30 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit, based on customers' orders. She goes door-to-door around her village to sell her products, working to supplement her family's income. Her husband, Anwarudin is a driver with a fluctuating income. Nurjanah usually earns $7.50 in profit per week. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business and improve her income. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase her income

loans.name: Bisanavbar

texts.ru:
Bisanavbar T. is married and has 2 children. She has high school education. With help of her daughter, Bisanavbar sells cosmetics and underwear. Her husband is away in Russia working as a seasonal laborer. In 2003, Bisanavbar received $30 loan from MicroInvest. Then, her business assets totaled $50, and Bisanavbar was selling only cosmetics. She used the loan to expand her business and added underwear to her assortment of goods. Bisanavbar is one of the exemplary clients of MicroInvest. In the future, she plans to expand the variety of products she sells.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тухтаева Бисанавар мать двоих детей, замужем, образование среднее. Занимается торговлей косметики и нижним бельем. Муж на заработках в России. В её деятельности помогает ей её дочь. В 2003году получила займ в размере 30$, тогда её активы составляли 50$, и она продавала только косметику. После получения займа она расширила место деятельности, добавила в ассортимент нижнее бельё. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» она является одним из примерных клиентов. В дальнейшем хочет увеличить наименование товара.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Aldi Candra Wijaya

texts.id:
Aldi is an industrious, able, and hard-working man. After being unsuccessful in the city he returned to the village to channel his efforts toward rearing pigs and simultaneously sells livestock. His efforts commenced with raising 2 sows (female pig) and setting a retail stall. Initial capital of Rp 5.000.000 (about USD550), plus loan from DINARI of Rp 5.000.000 is used to fund supplies for raising livestock, animal feed and medication for livestock. From the sale of such supplies Aldi made a profit of Rp 700.000 (USD77). The profit is used to cover living expenses and fulfill breeding the sows.

Translated from Indonesian to English By Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Aldi merupakan pria yang ulet dan pekerja keras. Setelah gagal hidup di kota Aldi kembali ke desa untuk merintis usaha beternak babi sekaligus berjualan pakan ternak. Usahanya ini diawali dari memelihara dua ekor induk babi sekaligus membuka sebuah warung untuk tempat berjualan. Modal awal Rp 5.000.000.- ditambah pinjaman dari DINARI sebesar Rp 5.000.000.- digunakan sebagai modal untuk menyediakan berbagai jenis kebutuhan pakan ternak. Mulai dari dedak padi, dedak gandum, konsentrat hingga obat obatan untuk ternak.Dari usaha berjualan pakan tersebut Aldi dapat memperoleh keuntungan hingga Rp. 700.000 . Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari –hari sekaligus untuk memenuhi kebutuhan pakan dari babi yang dipeliharanya.

loans.use: Purchase livestock supplies (Membeli pakan ternak)

loans.name: Yeyet

texts.en: Yeyet is 37 years old and is married. She has no children and lives with her nephew. She is a tailor. She usually earns $7 a day and it's just enough for her daily needs. Her husband Dedi is a driver with a small income. She is a member of MBK, though which she requests a $100 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yanih

texts.en: Yanih is 40 years old and married. She raises fish as a business and along with her husband, she is also a tailor. She usually earns a small income and it's just enough for their daily needs. During the summer-time, her potential profits increase. Yanih requests a $100 loan to expand her business, which will provide income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
M. Elbrus is 28 years old. He is single. He was born in the Gubadi region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. It is also the site of the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict.  He started his business in 2003. He runs a fruit stand. He purchases the fruit from the wholesale market Salyan city and he sells it with his friend at his stand. In 2004, Elbrus borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded his business by buying grapes. Next, he borrowed $600 to repair his car (which he uses to transport the fruit)  and increased the number of clients and his income.

Now Elbrus is applying for a loan of $1000 to increase his capital and the volume of his business. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to increase the volume of his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat V. is a happy mother of 3 children. Nazokat is married and has a college degree. Nazokat’s husband works at a collective farm and her children attend school. After school, the kids help Nazokat to take care of the animals at the farm. Nazokat has been breading cattle since she was little. In 2006, she received a MicroInvest loan to increase livestock. Nazokat used the money to purchase a few animals and a supply of animal food. In the future, Nazokat plans to continue the expansion and purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобова Назокат счастливая мать троих детей. Замужем, образование высшее. Муж работает в колхозе, дети учатся в школе, и после школы они помогают матери, то есть присматривают за скотами. Занимается животноводством с малых лет. В 2006году она получила займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», для увеличения поголовья скота. После получения займа и целевого использования она приобрела несколько видов крупнорогатого скота, запасалась кормом для скота. В дальнейшем планирует приобрести и другие виды скота.

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Umri

texts.ru:
Umri S. sells clothing for women. She is married and has 5 children. Umri has high school education. Her children are all have grown up and live with their own families. Umri has been in business for 5 years. She started the business as a way to feed her family and get out of hardship. In 2002, Umri received a $70 loan from MicroInvest. She used the money to expand her business and to acquire many new clients. In the future, Umri plans to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Самадова Умри занимается продажей женской одежды. Замужем, имеет пятерых детей, образование среднее. Дети взрослые и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Занимается торговлей вот уже пять лет. Начала свою деятельность с того что жить стало трудно и чтобы прокормить семью она решила заняться торговлей. В 2002 году она получила займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», в размере 70$. После получения займа она величила товарооборот, расширила место деятельности и приобрела много клиентов. В будущем планирует открыть ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open a new sales location

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 20 years old and is unmarried. She lives with her family. Selling clothes on credit has been Lia's business recently. She has to finance her family and help her parents to cover their daily needs. She usually earns $10 per week and requests a $50 loan to expand her business. She works energetically and hopes she can afford to send her brother to school. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
R. Gulnara is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the west partern of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Right now, she lives in the city of Sumqayit. As she has a low-income, she is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. Gulnara has a small flock of sheep. She buys lambs and raises them for half a year. She sells the sheep in the local market and then buys new lambs to reaise.  She spends the profit providing for her family's necessities. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than she has. Her husband helps her.

Timely investments are important for Gulnara. In 2004, Gulnara borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded her business.  Currently, Gulnara would like to borrow a $1,500 loan in order to acquire five small sheep and raise them. She will repay the loan within 16 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business and that it will further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to acquire 5 small sheep and raise them

loans.name: Neni

texts.en: Neni is 32 years old and a mother of a child aged 10. She sells household appliances and clothes on credit as well as having a small kiosk as her business. She always goes around to other places besides to her own village to find customers to sell her products to. Her earnings from this business usually total around $7.50 per day. Her husband has a fluctuating income, which is just enough to pay for daily needs. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
I am 27 years old and for a living, I do machine embroidery for a local boutique who in turn gives me $35 USD a month. I am the mother of only one daughter. My husband is an electrician and works for an electric shop in a nearby town for an income of just $30 USD a month. We are hardly surviving with this meager income.

However, as an adage quotes “luck favors the brave,” I know that I am brave and can change my circumstances. I am quite skillful at my work and now I wish to make a small boutique of my own. I therefore request you to provide me with a $325 USD loan.

loans.use: To start her own boutique

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
My husband runs a billiard shop and I stitch clothes on order for my neighborhood clientele. We have four children and all of them study.

In this expensive world, it is very hard to support the entire family with a mere income of $90 USD monthly. We now want to expand our billiard business by buying two more billiard games for our shop. I am sure our income will increase because our customers keep on telling us to bring additional games to the shop. This way, they do not have to wait long for their turn to play. Furthermore, customers will be able to play with the games before they decide to purchase them to take home.

We are asking for $325 USD to buy more games.

loans.use: To buy games for their shop

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Olinda was born in the province of Inhambane. She is married and has 4 children. She started in the FDM credit prgram in 2006. She used her first loan of $125 to invest in her business. Now she is in her second loan cycle and she needs a $275 loan to buy food and vaccines for her chickens to be able to sell them to her clients. Her business is growing and with her income she is able to cover her household costs and further wants to finish construction on her home. All of her children attend school.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Olinda e natural da Provincia de Inhambane. Ela e casada e tem 4 filhos. Entrou para o programa de credito do FDM em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $125 para investir no seu negocio. Agora ela esta no segundo ciclo e vai tomar $275 para poder adquirir racao, vacinas para os frangos enquanto os clientes nao os compram. O negocio dela esta a crescer. Com os rendimentos para alem de comparticipar nas despesas da casa ela quer contribuir na conclusao da construcao da casa. Todos os seus filhos vao a escola.

loans.use: To buy food and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
I am 39 years old and the mother of six children - five sons and one daughter. To earn a living, I knit sweaters and socks and then stitch them on my sewing machine. My husband takes these sweaters and socks to the market and sells them to various shops at a good profit.

We both have managed some how to enroll our three elder kids to school. But now I fear we will not be able to send all of our children to school. This is due to the already difficult circumstance we are in to meet our expenses and now we feel the need for additional income.

I am requesting $300 USD as a loan to invest in my knitting business so that I can produce a greater number of sweaters and socks to increase my profits.

loans.use: To expand her arts weaving business

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
My name is Kaneez B. and I have three children who all study. My husband has been a rickshaw driver (local three-wheeled taxi) for the last 20 years. He bought the rickshaw a few years back on installments and prior to that, he used to drive another individual's rickshaw. The purchase of our own rickshaw enabled us to send all three of our children to school.

A few days ago, our rickshaw was damaged in an accident. Luckily, my husband came out safely with a few minor injuries, but the rickshaw is damaged badly. We need to repair our rickshaw immediately so are asking for a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
My name is Razia B. and I am the mother of seven children. I used to stitch clothes on order but now, due to my eldest sons’ good business, I do not stitch anymore. My husband is a daily wage employee on a property dealer shop. Together, we did not earn enough to educate our oldest children.

However, my eldest son was ardent enough that he would not let the same fate befall his younger brothers and sisters. Therefore, he started providing musical band services (drum, flute, musical deck, etc) at various local weddings with the help of his friend. With his income, I was also able to marry off one of my daughters and send four of my younger kids to school.

Currently, my son wishes to expand his business and buy some new musical instruments in order to cater to larger orders. He does not have enough money yet, though he has some savings. Please lend us $200 USD in loans that we will pay back over 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the instrument business

loans.name: Helena Carlos

texts.pt:
Helena is president of the Teka Naha group. The group began in 2006, when she was elected president. The group sells firewood and vegetables for market. The group needs a loan to buy and transport the firewood from the area that it is cut to the market and to buy the vegetables for resale. The group is growing rapidly and they plan to expand the business in the future. All of the group members are women and they are all married and have children. All of their children attend school.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Helena e a presidente do grupo Teka Naha. O grupo foi formado em 2006, tendo ela sido eleita a presidente. O grupo dedica-se a venda de lenha, e horticulas. Assim o grupo precisa do valor do emprestimo para pagar a compra e o transporte de lenha do local do corte ate ao estaleiro e poder comprar horticolas aos produtores para a revenda. O grupo esta a prosperar e pensam no futuro alargar o negocio. Todos os membros sao senhoras e todas elas sao casadas e tem filhos. Os seus filhos estao a estudar.

loans.use: The purchase and transport of merchandise.

loans.name: Shakhkaram

texts.en: Mr. Shakhkaram is 25 and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus.  Shakhkaram owns and operates a small place near his hometown. He constructs and repairs water tanks, iron gates as well as water supply systems. Shakhkaram has been working in this business since 2000 and knows his trade very well.  However, the quality of his work is low because the welding equipment he uses leaves much to be desired.  Shakhkaram applied for $700 to Normicro Saatli branch to invest in renovation of his equipment.  This investment will improve his lifelihood as he earns very little income.

loans.use: to renovate equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
My husband runs a kiosk where he sells eggs, bread, and other similar items. I make paper envelopes for a nearby shopkeeper, who provides me his own paper, for minimal wages. I have four children in total and three of them go to school whereas the youngest one is not of school going-age yet.

We both work very hard to support our family, pay for our rented house and educate our children. With each passing day, our needs are increasing and so are our expenses. Therefore, I require to purchase the paper myself and produce envelopes that I will sell to various big shops in the city. This will in turn increase our monthly income. In addition, my husband also needs to increase the range of items for his shop. In total, we are requesting a loan of $200 USD.

loans.use: To buy paper for envelope making

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Both my husband and I work full-time, hard-working jobs in order to support ourselves and our four children.

I stitch outfits for a local boutique. I get $1 USD in profit for every outfit I make. In a given month, I am able to produce only 25 to 30 dresses. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. The income we earn is just enough to sustain our basic needs.

My husband’s rickshaw is in a very deteriorating condition so we need to replace it with another second-hand rickshaw. Please lend us $325 USD to help us buy another rickshaw.

loans.use: To replace the old rickshaw

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
My husband and I make paper envelopes. We purchase the raw materials from the local paper market on credit and sell the finished goods to various markets.

We are barely managing to send all three of our children to school. The reality is that our income is dwindling in comparison to our expenses. We wish to expand our business by purchasing paper using cash as it will be relatively cheaper .We are thus requesting a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To further expand business by purchasing paper on cash

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
I am Yasmeen M. and I have been embroidering cloth since my teens. I have two children whom I wish to educate.

These days, embroidered clothes are in fashion, so I wish to operate a small boutique of my own. To open such a business, I will require $175 USD of start-up capital. By investing this amount, I will be able to earn enough income to support my family. In addition, I will not have to worry so much about food and clothing anymore.

loans.use: To open her own boutique

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
My husband and I work hard to provide for our three children. We both work side-by-side making paper envelopes. At the end of the day, the money we earn from this business is not enough to sustain our family of five.

We are hoping to expand our business and thereby increase our income by buying paper from a local paper market in bulk at a low price. We are thus requesting a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To buy paper in bulk for envelope making

loans.name: Maimuna Ibrahimo Uss

texts.pt:
Maimuna sells paintings to tourists who visit the city of Inhambane, which is a zone with great tourism potential. She is married and has 3 children. They joined the credit program in 2006. She initially took a loan of $200 to invest in her business selling paintings to tourists. Since the business went well, she decided to sell soft drinks and cigarettes as well. She also managed to do work onher home. All her children are studying.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Maimuna vende quadros pintaodos para os turistas que visitam a cidade de Inhambane que e uma zona com um grande potencial turistico.Ela e casada e tem 3 filhos.Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela tomou inicialmente$200 para investir no seu negocio de venda de quadros aos turista. Porque o negocio corria bem ela resolveu vender tambem refrigerantes e cigarros. Conseguiu tambem reabilitar a residencia dela. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar.

loans.use: Purchase of more paintings and more boxes of soft drinks

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
My husband and I have been making paper envelopes for several years now. We both work extremely hard to meet our expenses and to provide for our eight children.

We now want to expand our business by taking on more orders. This requires us to buy a larger amount of paper and to hire an assistant for us. This expansion will help us to provide better food and clothing to our children. We are thus asking for a loan of $325 USD.

loans.use: To expand the envelope making business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
To earn a living, Iknit woolen caps and my husband makes plastic reels used to wind threads. The income from these ventures is just enough to send our children to school and meet the cost of living.

Winter is right around the corner, hence, I would like to take a loan of $175 USD to buy greater amounts of raw materials. These materials will allow me to make woolen caps in sufficient quantity. With this loan and ability to produce more, our income will increase and we will be able to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy wool required in making sweaters

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
Mukadas S. raises cattle. She is married and has three children. She has a middle school education. She began raising cattle as soon as she has moved to a new area. She decided to get a loan from MicroInvest in order to increase the amount of cattle she has. In 2006 she obtained a $270 loan, which she used to buy a milk cow and improve the location where the animals are fed. Currently she has doubled the amount of cattle she has. In the future she is planing to buy several milk cows and start selling milk products. Her daughter in law is on the picture.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Шуайбоева Мукадас занимается животноводством. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Начала заниматься животноводством, как только переехала в новый участок. Для увеличения поголовье скота она решила получить займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест». В 2006году она получила займ в размере 270$. После получения займа она приобрела дойную корову, улучшила место для откорма скота. Сейчас поголовье её скота увеличилось в два раза. В будущем планирует приобрести несколько дойных коров и заняться реализацией молочных изделий.На фото ее невестка

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Matea

texts.en: Matea is 27 years old and has lived with her partner for eight years. They have three sons aged 7, 5 and 3, and her partner also has a beautiful 11-year-old daughter.  All of their children go to public school in the township, except for the 3-year-old boy, who attends kindergarten. Matea owns a beauty salon that she started a year ago. Demand for her services is very high, and she is seeking a loan of $325 to buy more products and offer new services to her customers.  The loan will be repaid in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more products to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Askarchon

texts.ru:
Askarchon I. is 24. He is married and studies at a university. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2003. He sells different types of cooking oil. When he began working in this business his assets amounted to $150. It is up to him to take care of the family because his father went to Russia to earn some money and his mother is retired. Thanks to his great efforts and loans from MicroInvest, he was able to increase his selection of goods and even hire a sales person. Currently he continues investing into his business while attending a university. In the future he is planing to open another sales location. His sales person is shown on the photo

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исматов Аскарчон –24 года. Женат, учится в университете. Кредитуется в Микроинвесте с 2003-го года. Занимается продажей разных видов масла. Начал эту деятельность с активами на 150$. Все заботы и проблемы о семье лежат на его плечах, поскольку отец уехал на заработки в Россию, а мать пенсионерка. Благодаря трудолюбию в своей деятельности и целенаправленности кредитования перед программой МЗФ Микроинвест он расширил ассортимент товара и даже принял на работу продавца. Сейчас он активно кредитуется, по сей день и заодно учится в университете за свои доходы. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку. На фото его продавец

loans.use: to obtain another activity place

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia, 30, a very laborious woman, is married, with four children.  Her husband helped her start a grocery store to sell basic foodstuff to the people of the community.  Otherwise, they’d have to walk more than one hour to buy any goods in other zone.  Currently, she is in need of US $325.00 to purchase a larger stock of products and be able to give the clients more variety.   She also wants to increase her income to continue providing her four children with a good education.  The loan will be completely repaid in six months.
(The picture shows Basilia's husband working in the grocery store, as she was not present when our personal visited her house for the Kiva report).

loans.use: To purchase a larger stock of products

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru:
Rahmatullo K. is 44. He is married and has three children. He has a middle school education. He has been in the business of selling fruit for 13 years now. After the Soviet Union fell to pieces, he lost his job and began selling in small quantities and random locations. In order to enlarge his business he needed more capital, which was the reason why he became a client of MicroInvest. He is one of the first clients of the organization and over the course of these past few years (since 2003 util now) has been quite successful. He was able to increase turnover, secure a sales location and diversify the variety of food he has for sale. His brother is shown on the picture.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Каландаров Рахматулло – 44 лет. Женат, отец троих детей и образование у него среднее. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания вот уже 13 лет. После распада союза остался без работы, а чтобы прикормить семью начал продавать в небольшом количестве в неопределенных местах. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес ему не хватал оборотный капитал, что привело его в МЗФ Микроинвест. Он является одним из первых клиентов организации и за эти годы (с 2003 года по настоящее время) показал себя с лучшей стороны. Он увеличил товарооборот, приобрел постоянную торговую точку и добавил в свой ассортимент товара и другие виды продуктов питания. На фото его брат.

loans.use: To increase assortment

loans.name: Sokina

texts.ru:
Sokina O. has been selling underwear for 17 years. She is a widowed mother of one child. Sokina has a high school education. In 2003, when she received a $70 loan from MicroInvest, Sokina’s business assets totaled $100. She used the loan to expand her business and make improvements around the store. Sokina used the extra profits to send her son to college. Sokina doubled her business assets and plans to open a new retail spot for her son.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Очилова Сокина занимается реализацией нижнего белья вот уже. Вдова имеет одного ребёнка, образование среднее. Начала заниматься торговлей нижнего белья 17 лет назад, поскольку все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах. В 2003году она получила займ в размере 70$, тогда её активы составляли 100$. Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования она увеличила ассортимент товара, расширила место деятельности. Получив прибыль от торговли, она устроила сына в Университет. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза, и в будущем она планирует открыть торговую точку для сына.

loans.use: Open a sales location for her son

loans.name: Giselle Delice

texts.en: Giselle is 28 years old and has three children aged 11, 9, and 7.  Her husband works as a salesman in a town grocery. She would like to go into business selling women's clothing, and has come to us for a loan of $225 to purchase products such as T-shirts, pants, dress shirts and underwear.  Giselle wants to do this so that she can save money to help educate her children and improve the life of her entire family.  She’ll repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To start a small business selling women's clothing

loans.name: Santica

texts.en: Santica, 28, sells jewelery for a living. Three times a week, she walks around the streets of her town, selling her merchandise. From time to time, people also go to her house to buy products.  Santica started her small business two and a half years ago as a way to support her three sons and two daughters. A year ago, she separated from her husband and is now her family's sole means of support.  She would like to expand her business by acquiring new products to sell.  This will help her increase her income and better support herself and her five children.  She is requesting a loan of $250 to make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru:
Obida V. is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a middle school education. She has been selling food products for the past 6 years. Her husband is currently in Russia earning some extra income for the family. Her children help her in her work. Before she became a client of MicroInvest, she would have to borrow the money necessary to increase turnover from local illegal moneylenders that asked for high interest. She was thrilled to hear about interest free borrowing that MicroInvest has to offer. Currently, she was able to increase turnover and secure a permanent sales location in one of the central parts of the region. In the future she is planing to secure another sales location and start selling products wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Вохидова Обида – 42 года. Замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей продуктами питания вот уже 6 лет. Муж в Российской Федерации на заработках. Дети помогают ей в торговле. До того как стала, кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест, брала необходимую сумму для расширения товарооборота у местных нелегальных кредиторов подпись большие проценты. Услышав о без залоговой программе Микроинвест для предпринимателей примчалась в организацию. Сейчас она увеличила товарооборот, приобрела постоянную точку деятельности в одном из центральных районов области. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну точку в городе и заниматься оптовой продажей.

loans.use: to open another activity place

loans.name: Nicia Figueora

texts.en: Nicia is 26 years old and lives in the town of Guanuma with her beautiful 5-year-old daughter.  Her husband lives and works in another part of the country for a company that sells chickens wholesale. In order to help her family pay for the cost of housing, she wants to start a small business selling clothes and other items to women, such as bed sheets, bed spreads and window curtains. She plans to sell her goods in the capital, Santo Domingo, and acquire them in Elías Piña, a frontier town near the Hatiian border where products can be purchased cheaply.  To meet these goals, she needs a loan of $250 to acquire goods to sell. She will repay her loan over a period of six months.

loans.use: To start a small business selling clothes

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru:
Latofat H. is 44 years old, she is the mother of 2 children and has a high school education. Her husband trades goods, her older daughter is married and her son studies in school. Latofat has been selling children’s and men’s clothing for 12 years. She started her business by selling children’s clothing. Slowly after receiving a loan and using it fully she expanded her product line by adding men’s clothing and expanded her place of business. Today her assets have doubled.

Latofat plans on using the new loan to add shoes to her product offering.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Холматовой Латофат 44года, она мать двоих детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей старшая дочь замужем, сын учиться в школе. Заниматься торговлей детской и мужской одежды 12лет. Начала свою деятельность с продажи детской одежды. Постепенно после получения займа и целевого использования она расширила ассортимент товара, то есть добавил мужскую одежду, расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза, в будущем она планирует добавить в свой ассортимент и обувь.

loans.use: to add shoes to product offering

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred N. is a 59-year-old nurse who manages his own private facility in Chuka, in the eastern part of Kenya. He lives with his wife and five of his children at his Kathigirithini home.

He qualified as a nurse in 1976, and worked for the government for 22 years. In 1998, he retired and set up his own clinic, Sunrise Medical Clinic, in the town of Chuka. He offers a wide range of services, including general curative, family planning, maternal and child health services, and also has a pharmacy and a laboratory.

N. attributes his success to hard work and assistance from two previous microfinance loans from K-MET. He requests another loan of US $1200 so he can increase his stock of drugs and integrate other services in his facility.

loans.use: Buy drugs and integrate other services in the clinic

loans.name: Ravshanniso

texts.ru:
Ravshanniso M. is 36. She is married and has a college degree. Ravshanniso’s husband works in collective farm, her children attend school. For 8 years, Ravshanniso has been selling tablecloths, towels, etc. In the past, she had to borrow some of her inventory from the suppliers. Since becoming a MicroInvest client, Ravshanniso increased the volume of goods, paid off to creditors, and started to pay cash for her goods. In the future, she plans to eliminate the middlemen and purchase her goods directly.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муллочоновой Равшаннисо 36лет, замужем, образование высшее. Муж работает в колхозе дети учатся в школе. Равшаннисо занимается реализацией скатерти, салфетки и д.т., вот уже 8лет. Раньше кроме своих активов она брала товар у поставщиков в долг. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» она решила получить займ и тем самым расшириться. Постепенно после получения займа она увеличила товарооборот, расплатилась с поставщиками и стала брать товар за наличные. В будущем она планирует ездить за товаром сама.

loans.use: To move into wholesale business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is a 44-year-old general practitioner who runs his own private facility in Kibirichia Meru, in the eastern part of Kenya. He is married and lives with his wife and two school-aged children in Meru.

He trained and qualified as a nurse at Meru Medical Training College in 1987, and then worked in a goverment hospital. In the year 2000, his used his small amount savings to establish a clinic at Kibirichia market in Meru.

The clinic serves between 15 to 25 patients a day. To cope up with the increased number of patients, he has employed 1 person to help him run the facility. He offers a number of services, including family planning, curative and preventive medicine, a laboratory and a pharmacy.

Daniel K. attributes his success to support from K-MET. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers, and improve the quality of care he provides. To further expand his facility, he is applying for a loan of US $1200.

loans.use: Expand his facility to cope with increase of demand for services

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar A. is a divorced mother of 3 children. She has high school education. Dilbar sells clothing for men and children to feed her family and to be able to give her children good education. In 2003, she received $70 loan from MicroInvest. Gradually, Dilbar increased her line of credit and used the money to expand the variety of goods and make some store improvements. In the future, she plans to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмадова Дилбар разведенная, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Занимается торговлей детской и мужской одежды. Раньше она продавала только мужскую одежду. Начала заниматься этой деятельностью, поскольку все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах, чтобы дать детям хорошее образование и улучшить уровень жизни. В 2003 году она получила займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», в размере 70$. Постепенно она увеличила сумму займа и стала расширять наименования товара, улучшила место деятельности. В будущем планирует открыть ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open a new sales location

loans.name: Izattoy

texts.ru:
Izattoy G., 46 is divorced. She has an associate degree. Izattoy has been selling for 20 years. In the past, she sold clothing, but then she gradually switched to selling fabrics. When she learned of MicroInvest, Izattoy applied for a loan to expand the volume of goods. The loan helped Izattoy to increase the inventory and add curtains to her assortment of goods. Izattoy’s business continues to expand, so now she wants to expand the store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ганиева Изаттой 46 лет, разведенная, образование среднее специальное. Вот уже 20летзанимается торговлей. Раньше торговала одеждой, постепенно перешла на продажу материи. Узнав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» она решила получить кредит и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. После получения займа она постепенно величила товар, добавила в свой ассортимент занавески. Сейчас её активы увеличились, в будущем она хочет расширить место деятельности.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano S., 49, is a married mother of 3 children. She has high school education. Rano’s husband earns a living as a handyman. Each of Rano’s adult children has their own family. For 18 years since closing of the factories, Rano has been engaged in sales. At first, she sold clothing for children, but gradually Rano switched to selling men’s shoes. Her previous MicroInvest loan, Rano used to expand her store, gain new clients, and increase the assortment of shoes. In the future, to reduce her costs, Rano plans to buy her goods directly from the suppliers in neighboring countries.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Саидова Рано-49лет, замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Муж разнорабочий, каждый из детей имеют свою отдельную семью. Рано занимается торговлей уже 18лет, после того как заводы и фабрики закрылись. Раньше она продавала детскую одежду постепенно она перешла на продажу мужской обуви. После получения кредита она расширила место деятельности, приобрела много клиентов и увеличила ассортимент. В дальнейшем планирует ездить за товаром сама в соседние страны.

loans.use: To increase assortment of shoes

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Firuza H., 37, married mother of 4 children. She has an equivalent of associate degree. Firuza’s husband is working in Russia as a seasonal laborer. To make a living, Firuza sells cotton oil. After school, Firuza’s children help their mother to sell. In 2003, Firuza received a MicroInvest loan to finance oil purchase. The loan helped Firuza to increase the sales volume, acquire new clients, and improve the quality of her life. In the future, Firuza plans to purchase and offer for sale other types of oil.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамробоева Фируза 37лет, замужем, мать четверых детей, образование среднее специальное. Муж Фирузы на заработках в России, дети учатся в школе, после школы они помогают матери в торговле. Чтобы улучшить уровень жизни она решила заняться продажей хлопкового масла. В 2003году она решила получить займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест» и тем самым увеличить товар. После получения займа и целевого использования она достигла своей цели, увеличила товарооборот, приобрела много клиентов, улучшила уровень жизни. В дальнейшем планирует приобрести другие виды масла.

loans.use: To increase product assortment

payments.comment: Firuza today made her payments without any problems as her business is going well and she is very thankful for KIVA lenders for their loan and wishes them good luck at their own life.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela started her small business selling toys three years ago after recognizing an opportunity to fill a market niche. She has a great location at the central outdoor market in Nikopol with many potential customers passing by. Her little kiosk keeps her very busy and rarely gives her time to slow down. Anjela is a stable, hard working entrepreneur with definite goals. She’d like to continue growing her business and increasing her income. In the future she hopes to be able to do some remodeling on her home and start a small farm. 

Anjela has requested a loan of $500 to purchase new inventory for her business. With a new toy selection, she would be able to continue developing her business and pursuing her goals.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya owns a little grocery kiosk in the busy central market in Nikopol, Ukraine. Lidiya started her business about ten years ago. She decided to sell groceries because it is a profitable area to be in. In a typical month, Lidiya makes around $600-$800 in profit. Her business has been characterized by stability and growth.

Lidiya has requested a loan to help her purchase additional inventory and make some needed repairs to her sales kiosk. Increasing her sales activity should lead to increased profits for Lidiya. She has an optimistic spirit as she looks to the future and works hard to do the best she can with her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and repair kiosk

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is a hard-working, persistent entrepreneur from Stryi, in western Ukraine. Six years ago he decided to try opening his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Stepan has requested a loan of $500 so that he can purchase sandwich-making materials to sell in his kiosk. He plans to increase the variety of items he has available for customers to use in making this ever-popular delicacy.

Stepan is married and has grown children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as he can. We are happy for this opportunity to assist this responsible, dedicated business owner as he works to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase Sandwich supplies

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya owns a small clothing sales business at an outdoor market in Pavlograd, central Ukraine. Uliya is an experienced entrepreneur, having own her business for 10 years. She tries to maintain a good selection of clothing in her kiosk that would be in demand by passing shoppers. Uliya’s business is a large source of income for her, her husband, Victor, and their 16 year old son. She  makes  $700 profit in a typical month which is a good middle class income for Ukraine.

Uliya has requested a loan of $1200 to purchase new inventory of 50 men’s coats before the upcoming cold season. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Uliya as she works to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase men’s coats

loans.name: Yuanita

texts.en:
Yuanita H. is a 45-year-old practitioner who runs her own private facility at Ahero Kisumu, Kenya. The image shows her examining a patient.

Yuanita H., a widow, lives with her five children, who all attend school and college. Since she trained and qualified in clinical medicine in 1990, she has worked at a government hospital.

She also runs a private clinic in the middle of a market. The clinic serves the mostly very poor community in the area. She is also an HIV AIDS coordinator in the Nyando district in Kenya. Her facility offers a wide range of services, including family planning, curative and preventive medicine, counseling, and includes a laboratory and pharmacy. The clinic also links paediatric ARVs to health facilities.

The community appreciates her work, which she can provide with the financial support she receives from K-MET. To further expand her clinic, she requests a loan of US $1200.

loans.use: Establish a more spacious and comprehensive clinic

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir has a business selling audio and video equipment at a busy market in Nikopol, Ukraine. He loves music and brings cheer to others with his products. Vladimir is a sharp business man who always tries to keep updated products that will be in demand with his customers. Business growth is one of his biggest goals for the future.

Vladimir has requested a loan to increase his available working capital. This will allow him to purchase new inventory and continue his business development while serving many grateful customers.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Yuanita

texts.en: Yuanita H.(examining a patient) is a 45 year old  practitioner who runs her own private facility at Ahero town in Kisumu, Kenya. She is a widow and leaves with her five school/college going children.  She trained and qualified in clinical medicine in 1990. She has since worked in a government hospital but also runs her own private clinic in the middle of Ahero town serving the community around.She is also an HIV Aids coordinator in Nyando District kenya. Her facility offers a wide range of health services including family planning, curative and preventive, laboratory, pharmacy, counseling and also links paedritic ARVs to other health facilities. She attributes her success to hardwork and two previous microfinance loans from KMET.To further expand her facility and services, she requires US $1200.

loans.use: Establish a comprehensive medical unit

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy S. is a general practitioner who manages his own private facility in Kisumu, Kenya. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He was employed by Mario-stopes Kenya after completing his nursing course.
