In 2002, he established Gods Will Medical Centre, which serves the community in the Manyatta slums. He has focused his efforts on building a larger out-patient facility at this location. Besides general curative services, his facility offers a pharmacy, a laboratory, and maternal and child health services.

Sammy has established a very good reputation from his many years of good work in Kisumu. He attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and the assistance he has received from K-MET. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers, and improve the quality of care he provides. His practice continues to grow as he attracts more clients. He plans to further expand his facility, so he has applied for a loan of US $1200 to finance this expansion.

loans.use: Expand the facility and Increase the services offered at the clinic

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a 34 year old woman. She is a mother of 2 boys and 1 girl (7, 5 and 1 year and half). Hafiza has more than 10 years of experience in child care services and has owned her own kindergarten in the area of Moussaitbeh, Beirut for the past seven years.

Hafiza has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past six years and has an excellent record of payment on her loans. With the consecutive loans she has received, she enhanced the security features, regularly changed the carpets, wallpaper and furniture in her kindergarten.

She now needs a loan of $1,200 in order to change the wallpaper and to buy new educational toys for the children.

loans.use: Change the wallpaper and buy new toys for her child care center

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul O. is a trained nurse/midwife, who manages his own private facility in Manyatta Kisumu, Kenya. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children.

He worked with a government facility until 2002, when he opened his own clinic in Manyatta, where most of his clients live. He offers a wide range of services, including general curative services, family planning, maternal and child health services. The clinic also has a pharmacy and a laboratory.

Paul attributes his success to hard work, perseverance, and the financial assistance he received from K-MET. He is requesting a loan of US $1200 to purchase more drugs and integrate other services in the facility.

loans.use: Purchase more drugs for the clinic

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: Abu is a petty trader in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before his previous loan, his shelves were almost empty.  With his four previous loans, he managed to build up capital and increase his stock.  He said, he deployed the loan into sales of agricultural products where he made a huge profit.  He proudly told the team that, with the profit from the business, he built a four bedroom corrugated sheet house for the family.  Forty seven years old with seven children, Abu is concerned about their education and therefore would like to expand the business for more profit.  He is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Expansion of stock in his general store.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is married to a subsistence farmer who cannot produce enough food for both sale and consumption.  With little savings she started her business soon after the civil war in Sierra Leone, but could not do much due to insufficient capital.  Her previous loan helped her expand her business and she invested part of the loan to assist with the farming.  Thirty five years old, with six children, Mabinty has to work hard to provide them with an education. Her plan is to obtain a loan of $350 to purchase agricultural products and store them for the off season and also expand the current business.   She plans to invest the profit in the farm where they can grow rice for consumption and sales.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural products to sell for higher profits in the off season.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama F. is a widow with seven children, two of whom are married. She is forty eight years old and runs a small business in the open market in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone.  She started her business before the death of her husband eight years ago.  With the meager profits, she was able to bring up her children, and her business grew with her previous loan.  The loan transformed her business to a profitable one; she is therefore requesting an additional loan of $175 to increase her profits and to be able to meet her children’s educational requirements.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es: Ligia Argentina G. H. is from Bluefields. She is 25 years old, and is a single mother with two children, who are 9 and 6 years old. For the past five years, Ligia has been selling shoes for people of all ages. The advantage of this business is that sales are good and shoes don’t change styles as quickly as clothing. With this business, this young mother has been able to get ahead on her own, with her two children who are currently studying. She buys women’s shoes at $12.00 per pair, men’s shoes at $16.00 per pair, and children’s shoes at $5.00 per pair.   Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer. Ligia Argentina G. H. es originaria de Bluefields,tiene 25 años, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 9 y 6 años respectivamente. Ligia se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de calzados para todas las edades. Este negocio tiene la ventaja que el calzado se vende mucho y casi no cambia de moda tan rapido como la ropa. Con este negocio esta joven madre a podido salir adelante sola con sus dos hijos quienes en la actualidad se encuentran estudiando. Los pares de zapatos de mujer los compra en 12 dolares cada uno, los pares de zapatos de hombre los compra en 16 dolares cada uno y los tenis de niños en 5 dolares cada uno.

loans.use: This loan is needed for the purchase of 8 pairs of women’s shoes, 8 pairs of men’s shoes, and 8 pairs of children’s tennis shoes.

loans.name: Ligia Argentina

texts.es: Ligia Argentina G. H. es originaria de Bluefields tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad. Ligia se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de calzados de todas las edades. Este negocio tiene la ventaja que se venden muchos zapatos y estos a diferencia de la ropa casi no pasan de moda. Con este negocio Ligia a podido mantener hasta el momento a sus dos hijos a los que mantiene estudiando. Los pares de zapatos de mujer los compra en 12 dolares cada par, los zapatos de hombre en 16 dolares cada par y los tenis de niños en 5 dolares cada par.

loans.use: Para comprar 8 pares de zapatos de mujer, 8 pares de zapatos de hombre y 8 pares de tenis de niños.

loans.name: Ousman

texts.en: Ousman is a thirty-six year old married man with two children. His business provides communication services to the public of Makeni town in Sierra Leone.    He sells phone cords and simple mobile phones. Using his small generator, he also provides the service of charging mobile phones for those without electricity in their homes. Ousman is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase more phones and phone cards so he can expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additonal stock for his wireless communication business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is married, thirty-three years old, and has four children. Her husband is a teacher whose income is inadequate to meet the family's expenses, so Isatu used her previous loan to start a business selling beans, sugar and other essentials. This income is mostly used to meet school fees and feeding expenses for her family.  Isatu is requesting a loan of  $250 to increase her stock and enable her to earn more income.

loans.use: To increase her stock at her market stall.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en: Lamrana is thirty-eight years old and a widow with four children.  She lost her husband four years ago, and is solely responsible for her family.  Lamrana has had four loans from SMT and  these loans have given her hope for a better future for her children and enabled her to diversify her business. She sells beans, locally produced rice, sugar and millet in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Lamrana is requesting a loan of $250 so she can buy stock from the villages and stores and resell them in the off season  to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale goods for selling during the off season for greater profits.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is forty-five years old, married, and has five children. Because her husband is unemployed, she is the main bread winner for her family. She owns a stall in the market town of Makeni. Her previous loan enabled her to buy more stock and attract more customers.  She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can continue to expand her business. Fatmata is determined to provide quality education for her children and to become a role-motel in the community.

loans.use: To increase her stock for her general store business

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu is forty-eight years old and has six children.  She sells locally produced cooking pots and spoons in Makeni town.  The pots are produced by blacksmiths using aluminum scrap metals.  Pot producing is one of the booming local technologies that generates income for producers and sellers and creates employment for the youth.  As many women in Sierra Leone, Umu’s dream is to have educated children who will deliver themselves from poverty in the future.  Umu says, “My vision is to see the future of my children poverty free”.  She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can purchase more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more locally made household utensils for her business.

loans.name: Isheka

texts.en: Isheka is forty-seven years old, married, and has four children.  He owns a small stall where he sells plastic sandals in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Since he joined SMT’s loan program, his life and business have changed dramatically.  Isheka now has enough stock to provide him the earnings he needs to meet his family’s basic expenses.  Isheka says his business is like having land where he can grow food, and the loans from SMT are like seeds he can plant to produce food for his children.  He is requesting a loan of $275 so he can expand his business and extend his sales to far villages during village market days. This will help his family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To increase his stock of plastic sandals for his shoe shop.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa B. is twenty-nine years old, married, and has three children. She operates a small food stall in the market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone.  She sells cooking oil, onions, peppers, salt, and tomato paste, and vegetables.  Before her previous loan, Hawa could only purchase supplies in small quantities on a daily basis. She had to purchase these items mainly from other retailers and middle men.  Her previous loan increased her purchasing power.  Now Hawa is requesting a loan of $250 so she can purchase her stock directly from the wholesalers which will increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is twenty-nine years old, married, has one child and is expecting a second. Because her husband is unemployed, her family depends upon her income for their basic needs. Originally her business was selling soft drinks and canned beer. Her previous loans enabled her to expand to selling candies and soft drinks wholesale. She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can increase her stock. This will provide enough merchandise to require her husband help in the business, and they can work together to make a better future for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more items wholesale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is twenty-six years old, married, and has one child.  She is a member of ROSCAs (Village Rotating Savings Clubs) and sells palm oil in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market and both work hard to earn an income for the family.  She is requesting a loan of $250 so she can expand her market business and increase her income.  Her savings with the ROSCAs club will enable her to repay her loan on time and help her save for future investments.  She and her husband dream of building a house for their family.

loans.use: Epansion of her business in the market.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 24 years old and he is single. He opened his own business more than five years ago. Previously, he was working with his father from whom he learned the trade. Carlos is a self-sacrificing young man, who goes to university at night; he is studying the third year of Accounting, thanks to his work and effort. He fixes electronic articles like TV sets, computers, radios, etc. His business is well located and he already has a good clientele, he also does home repairs to generate a bigger income. He needs the loan to buy a tester to improve his service and cover to the demand of the clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, hace más de cinco años que habilitó su propio negocio anteriormente estuvo trabajando con su padre de quien aprendió el oficio. Carlos es un joven muy sacrificado, quien a la noche estudia en la facultad, está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo. El se dedica a componer artículos electrónicos como televisores, computadoras, radios, etc. Su local está bien ubicado y tiene clientela formada, también realiza trabajos a domicilio para generar más ingresos. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un tester para mejorar su servicio y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes.

loans.use: Buy tools and a tester

loans.name: Cástulo

texts.es:
Cástulo, 64, is a shoemaker and married to Guillermina Reyes, 67, a retired schoolteacher. They have two sons, who are both grown up professionals. Fortunately, they've come this far because of their parents' hard work. Cástulo learned the trade in Argentina where he worked for more than 10 years; later he returned to his family to be together with them and was able to start his own shoe-making business in his home, becoming one of the most recognized cobblers in the community. He needs a loan to buy a new machine for sewing on leather, since the one he has no longer works.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Cástulo tiene 64 años de profesión zapatero, está casado con Guillermina Reyes de 67 años, ella es docente jubilada. Tienen dos hijos, todos mayores de edad y profesionales gracias a los esfuerzos de sus padres. Cástulo aprendió el oficio en Argentina en donde estuvo trabajando por más de 10 años, luego volvió junto a su familia y habilitó su propia zapatería en su domicilio logrando ser uno de los zapateros más reconocidos de su comunidad. Necesita el crédito para la compra de una nueva máquina recta para costura en cueros, debido a la que posee ya no le sirve.

loans.use: to buy a properly working machine

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. His father is a policeman and his mother a teacher; he inherited the business from his father. Thanks to his grocery store, today he is doing the 3rd year of college at the faculty of philosophy. He has a sister who is 17 years old and helps him in the business.

He has been managing the business since five years ago. The business is well located since there aren't many other similar businesses in the area. He needs the credit to buy products such as sugar, flour, rice, noodles, bread and others.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Edgar tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con sus padres, su padre es policía y su madre docente; heredó el negocio de su padre. Gracias a la despensa, su negocio, hoy día ya está cursando el tercer año en la Facultad de Filosofía. Tiene una hermana de 17 años quien le ayuda en el negocio. Hace cinco años que administra el negocio el cual está bien ubicado debido a la poca cantidad de negocio existente en la zona Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.

loans.use: Purchasing oil, sugar, noodles, flour and spices  / Compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, yerba.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio, 60, is a butcher and his wife Irene Contreras is a homemaker. They have four sons; all of them have finished high school and help their father on the farm. Eladio works hard to sell beef that he himself raises. He starts his day early. He can be found in the butcher's shop while his sons gather the herds and feed them. The family unites their efforts in their daily work.

Eladio plans to use the loan to purchase more cattle to breed. He will be able to improve his standard of living and support his children to go to college since they wish to study genetic engineering.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Eladio tiene 60 años, de profesión carnicero, está casado con Irene Contreras quien es ama de casa. Tienen cuatro hijos, todos ellos terminaron sus estudios secundarios, ayudan en la actividad ganadera al padre. Eladio se dedica a la venta de carne de vaca que el mismo faena, inicia sus actividades a primera hora de la mañana, mientras él se encuentra en su carnicería, sus hijos ordeñan sus vacas y dan alimentos a sus animales vacunos, la familia es muy unida y comparten el trabajo diario.

Proyecta invertir el crédito en la compra de animales vacunos para faenarlos, con ello mejorar su nivel de vida y poder ayudar a uno de sus hijos a que ingrese en la universidad ya que desea estudiar Ingeniería Forestal.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
Elena is 42 years old. Since separating from her husband six years ago she has raised her children alone. To provide for the family, and especially the children's education, she took to cooking and selling food on the street.. Thanks to Elena's hard work, two of her children are now pursuing their studies elsewhere in the country. So that they can continue to study without worrying about finances, Elena has decided to open a small restaurant in Huancayo. Her youngest child is in cooking school and can help her at the restaurant. Everything was going well until a health crisis struck Elena. She had to have a gall-bladder operation which kept her from returning to work for three months. Elena's health has since improved and she still dreams of opening a restaurant. She is asking for a loan of $175 to outfit a kitchen. Today you have the opportunity to help her make this dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Elena es una señora de 42 años y durante mucho tiempo ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos; después de haberse separado de su esposo; hace 6 años. Desde entonces se dedicó a la venta de comida ambulatoria; esto la ha ayudado a otorgarles una adecuada educación a sus cinco menores hijos. Fruto de este esfuerzo es que hoy dos de ellos cursan estudios superiores en otras ciudades de su país; por tal motivo trabaja más arduamente con el propósito de que puedan realizar esta actividad sin deficiencias..Con el tiempo se ha visto en la necesidad de obtener nuevos ingresos e inició la implementación y posteriror apertura de un restaurante en la ciudad de Huancayo con ayuda del pequeño que estudia cocina en esta ciudad.. Todo marchaba bien hasta que una dolencia que la aquejaba tiempo atrás se agudizó, cayo enferma y tuvo que practicarse una operarse de la vesícula y guardó reposo por tres largos meses; a consecuencia de este hecho su proyecto se vio frustrado. Hoy ha recobrado su salud y aún mantiene vivo el anhelo de poder concretar su proyecto; para ello necesita de un capital de 175 dólares con el comprará utensilios de cocina para implementar su actual negocio y posterior micro empresa. Hoy tú puedes ayudarla a comenzar su proyecto haz que su anhelo se convierta en realidad.

loans.use: To buy kitchen implements.

loans.name: Erdulfa

texts.es:
Erdulfa is 67 years old and she is a widow. She has had her grocery store for more than 30 years. It was one of the first grocery stores in her area. It is well located right next to a textile factory. She has three children, all of legal age and professionals, thanks to the work of their mom. Now, she lives with a 16-year-old granddaughter who helps her with the business and Erdulfa pays for her studies. She needs the loan to buy a freezer that will be very uselful during the summer to sell cold drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Erdulfa tiene 67 años, es viuda, tiene su despensa hace más de 30 años es una de las primeras de su barrio está bien ubicado, al costado de una fábrica textil. Tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, y profesionales gracias al trabajo de su mamá, con ella vive ahora una nieta de 16 años quien le ayuda en el negocio y ella le costea sus estudios. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un congelador que le será de mucha utilidad en el verano para la venta de bebidas frescas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana is 44 years old and married. Her husband is José Escobar, who is 50 years old, employed in a pipe factory in the city of Paraguarí, and contributes to the household income. They have one son, who is 23 years old, who is studying in his third year to become a teacher, thanks to the efforts of his parents. During his free time, he also helps his mother sell milk.

Feliciana is a very sacrificing woman who wakes up every day very early to milk their cows. She deals with a lot of clients due to the high quality of her product. She needs the loan to buy a milk cow to increase her production, since she has such a high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Feliciana tiene 44 años es casada, su marido es José Escobar quien tiene 50 años es empleado en una fábrica de tubos que es de la Gobernación de ciudad de Paraguarí y aporta con los ingresos de la casa. Tienen un hijo, de 23 años, quien está cursando el tercer año de formación docente, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres, que también en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a su mamá en la venta de leche. Feliciana es una persona muy sacrificada se levanta todos los días muy temprano para ordeñar su vacas, cuenta con mucha clientela por la buena calidad de su producto. Necesita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su producción ya que cuenta con alta demanda.

loans.use: Buy a milk cow

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa has worked hard since she was a little girl. She has survived despite difficult circumstances thanks to her optimism and strives above all to care for her seven children. Rosa and her husband had worked in agriculture, but when he passed away fourteen years ago, she struggled to provide her family alone. To supplement her income, she rented a small store on the main street of her neighborhood and stocked it with groceries. The store has been a real boon for her family, yet the cost of raising this large family prompts Rosa to seek other ways to apply her talents. She has been knitting shawls in her free time and this brings in much-needed income. Rosa feels that with more working capital the shop could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of $325 to jumpstart the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this incredible mother give her children a brighter future.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosa desde niña fue una mujer muy trabajadora que ha sabido sobrellevar gracias a su optimismo muchas circunstancias difíciles, con el único objetivo de poder apoyar a sus siete hijos. Sufrió la pérdida de su esposo, hace 14 años y la dura tarea de satisfacer todas y cada una de las necesidades en su hogar la llevaron a perseverar con el trabajo agrícola que había emprendido junto a su esposo cuando consolidó su matrimonio. Poco tiempo después adicionalmente al desarrollo de esta actividad pudo iniciar un negocio de venta de abarrotes alquilando un local cerca de la avenida principal, este pequeño espacio le ha generado muchas satisfacciones familiares sin embargo a pesar de contar con este ingreso adicional los gastos siguen siendo muchos por esa razón continúa incansable y aún sigue explotando sus talentos. La elaboración de ponchos en sus horas libres se ha convertido en una importante ocupación para incrementar el ingreso familiar.De esta manera y a través de innumerables actividades trata de satisfacer completamente las necesidades de su numerosa familia. El incremento de capital para su desempeño en la pequeña tienda podría generarle sumas de dinero importantes por esta razón solicita 325 ´dólares para impulsar su pequeño negocio, con el objetivo de seguir incrementando la calidad de vida familiar. Ayudemos a esta increíble madre la posibilidad de brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 38 years old and she is married to Isabelino Chávez who is 47 years old. He works for a road construction company. Thanks to his revenue, he is able to help his wife with the house’s expenses and their children’s school tuition. They have two children, one of them is 10 years old, who is in school and other is 15 years old who helps her in the business and at night he is in school. Francisca has had this business for more than 5 years. Thanks to her effort, a good administration and the help of her husband; she has been able to expand the business since she has a good clientele due to the good her location. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise as sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca tiene 38 años, está casada con el Sr. Isabelino Chávez de 47 años quien trabaja en una empresa constructora de rutas, gracias a su ingreso ayuda a su esposa para los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos. Tienen dos hijos, uno de 10 años quien está estudiando en la escuela y otro de 15 años quien le ayuda en el negocio y a la noche estudia en el colegio. Francisca hace más de 5 años tiene su negocio, quien gracias a su esfuerzo, a la buena administración y a la ayuda de su marido pudieron agrandar el negocio ya que cuenta con una clientela formada por la buena ubicación que tiene su local. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, bebidas, panificados, embutidos, etc.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, noodles, pastries, sausages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gladis Mercedes

texts.es:
Gladis and her husband Pedro are very hard-working and entrepreneurial. They have strived to impart these qualities on their children and despite their advanced age, continue to work so the children can finish high school. In addition to working every day in the shop, they knit colorful sweaters which they sell in Lima in the winter. Recently, when the family was away on such a trip, thieves broke into the store and stole everything. Nonetheless the family has not lost hope. They are asking for a loan of $200 to restock the store and rebuild their lives.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Gladis y Pedro son una pareja D. esposos y desD. siempre se han caracterizado por su diligencia y empeño, en el trabajo, aún ahora y a pesar D. su avanzada edad se manifiestan ágiles y emprendedores, estos valores se lo han transmitido a sus hijos y fruto D. su eficacia ahora cursan exitosamente estudios superiores.Trabajan a diario en su pequeña bodega y se esfuerzan al máximo para producir coloridas chompas que comercializan durante la temporada D. invierno en la ciudad D. Lima. Esta actividad sumada a su ocupación diaria en el pequeño establecimiento D. ventas se han convertido en importantes generadores D. bienestar familiar, sin embargo, en uno D. los asiduos viajes que realiza la familia completa, unos ladrones irrumpieron en su casa y se llevaron todo aquello que tenia valor, dejándolos sin nada. A pesar D. este duro golpe no han perdido la esperanza y por ello solicitan la suma D. 200 dólares para iniciar una vez más sus actividades y poder reponerse D. esta situación.

loans.use: To stock a small store and buy yarn for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Gill

texts.es:
Gill, 58, is an auto tire servicer, and married to Saturnina Lesme, a teacher. They have two sons: one is a police officer and the other is a first-year law student at college. Gill has had a tire shop for more than 20 years; he learned the trade from his uncle, whom he worked with many years. Later, Gill got married and with his savings, he found his shop in an area where there were no other competing tire services. Together with his wife, they have been able to provide an education for their children. With the loan, he plans to buy a compressor. His services are in high demand and without it, he is unable to fully satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gill tiene 58 años, gomero de profesión, casado con Saturnina Lesme quien es docente y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Tiene dos hijos, uno es policía de carrera con ingresos, y la otra estudiante del primer año en la Carrera de Derechos de Universidad. Gill tiene una gomería hace mas de 20 años, aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien trabajó por muchos años, luego se casó y habilitó su propia gomería, con su ahorro logro comprar un terreno bien ubicado, sin competencia en la zona que en la zona no había ninguna gomería que prestaba servicios. Gracias al esfuerzo de él y su esposa logaron educar a sus hijos. Con el crédito proyecta comprar una compresora, tiene una alta demanda y no logra satisfacer plenamente a sus clientes.

loans.use: buy a compressor

loans.name: Idelio

texts.es:
Idelio is 35 years old he is single and he’s a baker. He lives with his parents. More than a year ago he started his own bakery. Before opening his own business he worked at a bakery in Asuncion where he learned the trade. Currently, two of his neighbors work as his apprentices working for him and gaining money to sustain their families. Idelio needs the loan to buy flour, baking powder, and vegetable fat that are his main ingredients, for the great demand he has.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Idelio tiene 35 de edad, soltero, de profesión panadero, vive con sus padres. Hace más de siete años que habilitó su propia panadería, anteriormente estuvo trabajando en Asunción en una panadería por más de 15 años donde aprendió el oficio. Actualmente trabaja con él dos vecinos a quienes les enseña el oficio y al mismo tiempo son remunerados para el sustento de sus familias. Necesita el crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, manteca que son materia prima, por la gran demanda en el mercado.

loans.use: Compra de  harina, levadura, manteca.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, married and father of two children, lives in Dora, in the northern suburbs of Beirut. Robert owns a small Lebanese traditional bakery and a snack delivery business. He has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years. He has received several loans in increasing amounts as he rapidly expands his business. He has made a number of smart investments, such as buying a traditional but sophisticated bread oven, a new flour mixer, etc. Robert now needs a loan of $1,200 to enhance the equipment of the snack shop by purchasing a deep fryer for potatoes.

Robert has a lot of financial responsibility towards his family. Not only does he provide for the needs of his wife and children, but he also allocates some money on a monthly basis to his retired parents. He recently helped his unemployed brother open a small business and he covers the university fees of his sister.

loans.use: Buy a a deep fryer for his small snack shop to prepare large quantities of french fries

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa, 39 years old, is the owner of a small tailoring business in the area of Sid Al Bauchrieh in Beirut. Sanaa has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years. Before knowing Al Majmoua, Sanaa was employed in a clothing factory, being paid $1 to $2 per piece of clothing she was tailoring. With the first loan from Al Majmoua, she bought her own sewing machine - the one shown in the picture - quit the factory and opened her own business.
Since then, she has tripled her monthly income and is currently the main source of income for her family (her retired parents have no income).  
Sanaa needs a loan of $1,000 to buy a large stock of fabrics and accessories for her business.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and accessories to tailor new pieces of clothing

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, married, and mother of one child, is 31 years old. She is an ambitious woman. She owns a small gifts and perfumes shop in Bourj Hammoud, in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut.

Jacqueline has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and used the 2 consecutive loans she received to increase her inventory. Jacqueline is very good in marketing and has excellent communication skills. She has a solid base of loyal clients, observes the market trends, and is able to answer her clients needs before they even ask.

Jacqueline wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy new varieties of perfumes and some trendy but affordable pieces of jewelery to expand the inventory of her shop.

loans.use: Purchase new fragrance bottles, "faux-bijou", small toys and gadgets for her gifts and perfumes shop

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished work of construction since I lack money, but now I have recuperated a little and I want finish it so that I can live in those rooms. Also, I need to put in a floor, a door, and the windows. I am requesting $1,200 to finish the construction."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar ya que me falto dinero pero ahora me he recuperado un poco y quisiera terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos, también necesito poner el piso, una puerta y las ventanas. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: Finish construction and put in the floor.

loans.name: Pipa

texts.en:
Pipa, 29 years old, mother of 2 children, owns a small clothing shop in Bourj Hammoud, in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut. Pipa has been a client of Al Majmoua for one year and has a very clean repayment track. Pipa has very good selling skills and a good base of loyal clients.

With the shift between summer and winter season, Pipa has sold out her inventory of summer clothes by offering sales to her clients. She now needs a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase, at a very good price, a large inventory of clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Mirian Vanesa

texts.es:
Miriam is married and she is 32 ears old. She has two children - the eldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. She is expecting her third child. Currently, they all live together. Miriam and her husband support their family with income generated as rural area teachers. Additionally, they run a transportation company and a small store in their neighborhood. Their transportation business serves the LA BELGICA-WARNES-LA BELGICA loop. Rented motorcycles are used to take passengers due to its swiftness and fuel efficiency. There is a fair amount of competition in the area, but thanks to high demand, its impact is not felt. The loan being sought will be used to pay for the repair of a larger vehicle used for bigger hauls. Miriam's credit history demonstrates that she has timely and responsibly made her payments .

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Miriam es una señora casada de 32 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, el mayor tiene 8 años y la segunda tiene 4 añitos, actualmente esta esperando el tercer hijo. Todos actualmente viven juntos, Miriam y su esposo sustentan a su familia con los ingresos que le generan sus sueldos de profesores rurales. Adicionalmente se dedican al transporte y a la atención de una pequeña tienda de barrio. Respecto al negocio de transporte hacen los tramos de LA BELGICA-WARNES-LA BELGICA, también tienen motos que rentan todos los días, esto debido a que el medio de transporte preferido en estas zonas es la motocicleta por su ahorro en combustible y practicidad. La competencia en los diferentes rubros es media, pero la misma no afecta mucho ya que la demanda es bastante elevada. El presente crédito es para reparar el motor de uno de sus vehículos que utilizan para hacer los transportes grandes. El historial crediticio de Miriam es bueno ya que siempre cumplio sus obligaciones de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Reparación del motor de su movilidad

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida is a 49-year-old mother of four children. Currently, only her youngest child, a 13-year-old boy, lives with her. Brigida works at the Red Cross from Warnes' front desk, which is also home to a kindergarten school. Besides the front desk position, she also sells candies and beverages to students, teachers and employees. She does not have direct competition there because others street sellers are prohibited from entering the premises where she sells her products. She will apply this loan to file for her property's title registration. The property is located in Warnes, in the city of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Brigida, previously, has taken out two separate loans from our institution, and repaid them correctly; that is why she does not expect any problems committing to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Brigida es una madre D. 49 años D. edad, bajo su custodia se encuentran sus 4 hijos D. los cuales sólo el hijo menor vive con ella, él tiene 13 años D. edad. Brigida trabaja como portera D. la Cruz Roja D. Warnes, donD. también funciona un Kinder Infantil. Adicionalmente a su trabajo D. portera, ella se dedica a vender dulces y diversos refrigerios a los niños, maestras y empleados. Actualmente no tiene competencia directa ya que en el turno que atienD. no permiten que ingresen otros vendedores ambulantes al interior del establecimiento. El presente crédito es para podder legalizar la documentación D. su vivienda que se encuentra en la localidad D. Warnes D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Brigida anteriormente solicitó dos créditos en nuestra institución y los cancelo D. manera excelente, es por ello que se prevee un buen cumplimiento con la solicitud actual.

loans.use: Conclusión de documentos de su domicilio en Warnes

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela C. T. is a businesswoman who knows the value of diversification in her income streams. She traditionally has made and sold ice cream products such as helados, Gelatinas, and choco covered bananas. She realizes selling these kinds of foods has had limited opportunity for her so she is taking out this loan with Friendship Bridge to expand into selling men’s and women’s casual clothing. She will use the loan to buy new clothing and resell it in the local market. She is strongly committed to providing a complete selection of desirable clothing to please her customers.

Her dream of growing this business little bit by little bit is now becoming a reality. She feels very satisfied that she now has the resources to work hard at her new business, which will result in improved quality of life for herself and her family. She can develop a growing business and pay off the loan simultaneously, a reality that signifies her dreams are being realized. She is very pleased with her prospects for the future.

Her personal life has its ups and downs. She is 51 years, she is married and has 7 children ranging in age from 17 to 32 years. Although she cannot read or write she knows the importance of education. She is committed to insuring that the two youngest ones living at home complete their studies. One is currently studying technical drawing and the other one is a student in high school. Currently her health is her biggest challenge. She suffers from gall bladder problems, for which she is currently undergoing treatment. However, the trips to the National Hospital in Chimaltenango for the operations take much out of her because the two-hour ride by “chicken bus” over a bumpy dirt road is quite painful.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase women's and men's casual clothing for resale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
" I have some construction that I need to get done. I need to install the roof, doors and windows so that we can use these rooms since our house is very small and my family is starting to feel uncomfortable." I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $500 USD to install the roof, doors and windows.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar, me falta solo poner el techo, puertas y ventanas para poder habitar esos cuartos ya que mi casa es muy reducida y mi familia ya esta muy incomoda”. Solicito 500.00 dlls para poner el techo un cuarto, una puerta y las ventanas

loans.use: To install a roof, doors and windows in extra rooms

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. Matzir, age 54, has for many years sold bread by going house to house and currently has a spot on the sidewalk of Yepocapa where she sells fruits and vegetables.

Even though it is a little scary and has taken a lot of initiative, Maria is taking out this loan from Friendship Bridge to expand her business activities to selling bedspreads and ponchos. She will walk the streets with her products and sell them to interested buyers. She will continue selling bread, fruits and vegetables along with the new bedspreads and ponchos. The markup for these items is better than that for fruits and vegetables so she hopes to save a little to get ahead in life.

Maria is not married and has 8 children. The 3 youngest children live with her and attend school. Schooling is something Maria never had the opportunity to do. Like many of her peers, she cannot read and signs her name with a thumbprint impression. She is very proud to see her children better themselves through education as she betters herself by participating in the Friendship Bridge microfinance group. As a member of the women's group, Flor de Liz, she benefits from the informal education portions of each monthly meeting. Informal education for the clients is one of the missions that Friendship Bridge has incorporated as a key objective.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 48 years old. For more than 17 years, she's had her own business. Before that, she worked with her mother, from whom she inherited the business. Juana is a single mom and has one son, who is now older. Thanks to her continuing business, she was able to help her son finish his dental studies in the city of Asunción. Currently, he is married and partly supports her.

Her business is situated in the city center and has a well-established customer base. She needs the loan to buy more goods like sugar, coffee, milk, bread, vegetables, fruit, etc having been very busy.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana tiene 48 años. Hace más de 17 años que habilitó su propio negocio, anteriormente estuvo trabajando con su madre de quien heredó el negocio. Juana es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo ya mayor, que gracias a su constancia en el negocio le ayudó a terminar la carrera de odontología en la ciudad de Asunción. Actualmente está casado y la ayuda con los ingresos de la casa.

Su negocio está bien ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad y tiene una buena clientela formada. Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, café, leche, panificados, hortalizas, frutas, etc., ya que se encuentra en el periodo de mayor venta.

loans.use: to buy goods like sugar, coffee, bread,  milk, vegetables, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Olga Violeta

texts.en:
Olga Violet G., age 56, owns and operates a general store called "The Estrellita" (little star) where she sells everyday foods and household needs. Olga explains she started her business as mini-store years ago with just a few products and has been able to grow her tienda to a well stocked neighborhood grocery store. Despite the many small tiendas that have sprung up around her, she continues to grow her business little bit by little bit. With this loan she will buy more supplies for her store and also purchase pigs to raise to sell when fully grown. She admits working with pigs is difficult and one needs to have a lot of love to work with these animals. She knows how profitable raising pigs can be and because of this good business sense she has been able to stay one step ahead of her growing competition.

She is married and is able to read and write. Her children are all grown and living on their own. Her dream is to continue growing her tienda and raising pigs because knows how much they have helped her and her family increase their quality of life. If only the chronic arthritis in her hands and feet had a cure, her quality of life would be even better. But despite her painful arthritis she continues walking and working every day.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase pigs and also inventory for her small store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a 56 year old merchant, she’s married to 47 year old Felipe Torres. He is a carpenter and he is in charge of polish wood and sells it. They have two adult professional sons thanks to the help of their parents. Felipe learned the trade by his father since a very early age, then he became independent and he started his own business more than 15 years ago. His business is thriving thanks to his effort and Lucila’s hard work at home and on selling the products. They will use this loan to buy a brushing machine because this time of the year there is much demand and the machine will be used a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Lucila tiene 56 años, comerciante, está casada con Felipe Torres de 47 años de edad, el es carpintero quien se encarga de pulir las maderas para ponerla en venta. Tienen dos hijos mayores de edad quienes son profesionales gracias al trabajo y sacrificio de sus padres. Felipe aprendió el oficio de su padre con quien trabajó desde muy temprana edad, luego se independizó y puso su propio negocio más de 15 años, lo cual le va muy bien gracias a su esfuerzo y al trabajo incansable de Lucila quien se encarga de la venta y de los trabajos de la casa. Destinará este crédito para la compra de una maquina cepilladora, en esta época del año tiene alta demanda y le será de mucha utilidad en el negocio.

loans.use: compra de una cepilladora

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 39 years old; she’s married to Oscar Fretes a 40 year old construction worker who helps her with the house expenses. They have two daughters, one 17 and the other 14 they are both in high school. Norma started with her own initiative and Oscar’s economic support, because she noticed that her neighborhood did not have a small store, this way she could gain some income and also increase the quality of life of her family. She needs the loan to buy sugar, flour, rice, noodles, breads, dairies and other products, she has a broad client base and she wants to meet their demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Norma tiene 39 años, está casada con Oscar Fretes de 40 años de edad que se dedica a la albañilería, quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijo una de 17 años y otra de 14 años, las dos están cursando la secundaria. Norma empezó por iniciativa propia y el respaldo económico de Oscar, percatándose de que en el barrio no había una despensa, logrando de esa manera aportar ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida tanto de ellos como la de sus hijos. Necesita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, arroz, fideos, panificados, lácteos y otros productos, ya que actualmente cuenta con una numerosa clientela y desea satisfacer la demanda de los mismos.

loans.use: Compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, panificados, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
Oscar is 26 years old; he is single and he comes from San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon. His desire to succeed propelled him into starting his own business six years ago. He started out by selling sandals that were sent by a friend from the United States. Soon after that, he added clothing retail to his venture and that move made his business grow further. Fortunately, sales increased steadily and he was able to open up a store while maintaining outlets at local street markets.

Oscar wishes to keep his business growing and now he requests a loan in the amount of US$1200.00. It will be used to purchase furniture and fixtures that will improve his store's appearance and to purchase the structure necessary to continue attending street markets. He commits to repaying this loan within 6 months. Oscar sincerely appreciates the trust and support received.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Oscar tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero y es originario de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, los deseos que tiene de salir adelante lo motivaron a emprender su propio negocio hace seis años, comenzó vendiendo sandalias que un familiar le enviaba desde Estados Unidos y poco después incorporó la venta de ropa, con lo que hizo crecer su negocio, afortunadamente sus ventas se incrementaban constantemente y logró abrir una boutique, además continuar instalándose en los mercados rodantes.

Oscar desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mobiliario para poder darle un mejor aspecto a su local, así como adquirir una estructura para el puesto que tiene en el mercado, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Oscar agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mobiliario

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina is 58 years old; she’s married to Felipe Vargas who works on agriculture. They have a daughter and a son, he’s a policeman and she’s a teacher, they both have professions because of their parents hard work and effort. Pablina learned how to work with her mother, who taught her to manage the business and with the help of her husband they could expand to meet the client demand and this way get more income to help her mother out and give a better life to their children. Now her children are independent thanks to the help she gave them before. Pablina needs the loan to buy oil, sugar, noodles, flour, dairies, breads, beverages, and other products now that she has a solid client base.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Pablina tiene 58 años, es casada, su esposo se llama Felipe Vargas quien se dedica a la agricultura. Tienen dos hijos, uno es policía y la otra docente, ambos ya cuentan con profesión gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres. Pablina aprendió a trabajar con su madre, quien más adelante le cedió la administración del negocio y con el aporte de su marido pudieron crecer para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes y de esa manera obtener más ingresos para mantener a su madre y brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos, que actualmente ya se independizaron de ellos, gracias a la formación que les brindó. Necesita el crédito para la compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, lácteos, panificados, bebidas y otros productos, ya que cuenta con una clientela formada.

loans.use: Compra de aceite, azúcar, fideos, harina, panificados, etc.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
Jose Luiz is 29 years old. He is married and has three young children. For the last seven years, he has been part of his family's business - electronics retail. When his second child was born three years ago, he decided to set forth on his own using the experience he had gained from his family business. His hard work and willingness to succeed have unable him to support his family and expand his business.

In order to increase product variety, he asks for a loan in the amount of US$550.00, that will be used to purchase more merchandise. He commits to repaying it within 6 months. Be the one to sponsor Jose. Along with his family, he truly appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

José Luís tiene 29 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos. Desde hace siete años José empezó a trabajar en el negocio familiar, donde venden artículos electrónicos, al nacer su segundo hijo, hace tres años, decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio, aprovechando la experiencia que había adquirido continuó con el mismo giro. Gracias al buen trabajo que realiza y a sus deseos salir adelante con su familia ha podido crecer con su negocio.

Para incrementar la variedad de artículos que comercializa, José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a José, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta M. y M., 39 years old, makes and sells hand woven mats. These traditional mats are used as beds or as a place to sit. Berta learned this age-old tradition from her mom. and believes it is important to pass on the art to her children. She dedicates her time to creating the mats and can produce up to a few dozen per week if that's all she's working on. Her children help with the weaving, and Berta is pleased to have money and not be dependent on her husband's meager earnings.

Berta is married and lives with her husband, who works in the fields. She explains that as a campesino he does not make a lot of money so her income is very important as it helps support them and their 10 children. The children ages range from 4 to 22. Her goal is to teach her children the art of making mats and provide each one with an educational opportunity. She glows as she explains how pleased she is that her oldest child has successfully completed her high school degree.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen became a widow 9 years ago. She has a son and she lives in the town of Reinosa, Tamaupilas. Three years ago, she needed to finance her family's economic growth with a small amount of cash. She decided to invest in her own taco outlet. Slowly, her product became popular, thanks to its great quality, and her business began to grow. She has added new products to her menu that have pleased her customers.

In order for her business to continue to grow she needs to stack up more ingredients and pay for location improvements. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$650.00. She commits to pay it back in 6 months. Today, you can help someone that really needs assistance. Maria truly appreciates it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Carmen enviudó hace 9 años, tiene un hijo y viven en la localidad de Reynosa en Tamaulipas, para sacar adelante a su familia con el poco dinero que tenía Maria decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de tacos desde hace tres años, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y la buena calidad de sus productos le ha permitido crecer con su negocio, ahora ha incorporado la venta de novedades, obteniendo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, comprar insumos y mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra su local Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Maria te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y remodelación

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is a 56 year old butcher, he is married to Suni Benitez who is 48 years old and she is a housewife, she helps him out at the business also. They have two sons who go to school in the city. Pedro’s mother in law lives with them because of her old age and health issues. Pedro starts his activities very early, at 5am he is already in his business which is located in the city market, at this time his wife milks the cows and feeds the cattle. He needs the loan to buy more cattle to work on the land; he does not plan to sacrifice his animals, because they are not apt for sacrifice.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Pedro tiene 56 años, de profesión carnicero, casado con Suni Benítez tiene 48 años, ama de casa, también le ayuda en el negocio. Tiene dos hijos, quienes estudian en el colegio de la cuidad, también vive con ellos la mamá de su esposa, quien debido a su edad avanzada se encuentra enferma. Pedro inicia sus actividades muy temprano, las 5 a.m. ya se encuentra en su puesto de trabaja que se ubica en el mercado de la ciudad, mientras en esa hora su esposa ordeñar su vacas y da alimentos a sus animales vacunos. Necesita el crédito para la compra de animales vacunos para faenarlos, ya que los animales que posee en su campo no pretenden sacrificarlos, ya que aun no son aptos para el sacrificio.

loans.use: Compra de animales vacunos

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador is 45 years old and married to Norma Bordón, who is 47 years old and a housewife. They have two children, a daughter who is 15 years old and a son who is 12 years old. The two of them are enrolled in secondary school thanks to the work of their parents. Salvador learned the trade of auto-body repairman from his uncle, with whom he began working when he was very young. Later he became independent by setting up his own garage of auto repair with a lot of effort. The garage does well for him thanks to his good service and guaranteed work. The hope of the loan is to buy a compressor that will be of much use for his job and the satisfaction of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Salvador tiene 45 años está casado con Norma Bordón quien tiene 47 años de edad, ama de casa. Tienen dos hijos una de 15 años y otro de 12 años, los dos están cursando la secundaria gracias al trabajo de sus padres. Salvador adquirió el oficio de chapista de vehículos, de su tío, con quien empezó a trabajar desde muy temprana edad luego se independizó y puso su propio taller de chapería con mucho esfuerzo, lo cual le va muy bien gracias a la buena atención y su trabajo garantizado. El destino del crédito para la compra de una compresora que será de mucha utilidad para su trabajo y para la satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy a compressor

loans.name: Elio Obet

texts.es:
Elio is a very responsible and hard working man. He has been living in a civil union for three years and moved to Reynosa, Tamaulipas seeking for better opportunities. Motivated by the lack of employment and a desire to give the best to his young daughter, he opened his own grocery store. Fortunately he was able to pull it through and make it grow little by little increasing the variety of products he sells.

In order to continue growing and serve the demand of his clientèle, Elio needs a loan for $250 which he is committing to pay back in 4 months. Today is the time to help. Elio needs of your help and is thankful for the trust you give him.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Elio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en unión libre y desde hace tres años, en busca de mejores oportunidades llegó a Reynosa, Tamaulipas e inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes motivado por la falta de empleo y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija que acababa de nacer, afortunadamente logró sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco incrementando la variedad de productos que comercializa.

Para poder continuar creciendo y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Elio necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en un plazo de 4 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, Elio necesita de tu ayuda y agradece la confianza que le depositas.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 63 years old and married to Señor Ramón Cañete, who is 62 years old and dedicated to farming for family consumption. Teresa has had her little grocery store since thirty years ago, when she inherited it from her mother. It is in a good location where there are a lot of businesses. She deals with an established clientel because her little grocery store is the oldest in the area. Teresa has two sons who are professionals. One is a teacher and the other is a police man. With the loan she plans to buy a freezer because in the very hot seasons she sells a lot of beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Teresa tiene 63 años está casada con el Sr. Ramón Cañete que tiene 62 años se dedica a la agricultura para consumición familiar. Tiene su despensa hace treinta años, quien la heredó de su madre, y que está bien ubicada, la misma se encuentra en una zona de mucha su negocios y cuenta con clientela formado ya que es la despensa más antigua de la zona, tiene dos hijos que son profesionales uno es docente y el otro policía. Proyecta con el crédito comprar un congelador ya que en temporadas de mucho calor vende muchas bebidas.

loans.use: Buy a freezer.

loans.name: Cristian Jonathan

texts.es:
Cristian is 20 years old, single and lives in Apodaca, Nuevo León. Since his father’s salary was not enough to cover the high expenses of his household, Cristian has worked since he was little to support the family. Two years ago, taking advantage of his expertise as a professional embroiderer, he decided to start his own business. He started embroidering jerseys for an amateur soccer team but, thanks to the good quality of his work, was able to get more clients and has had plenty of work.

Cristian wishes to continue growing and for that purpose he needs a loan of $325. He’ll invest the money in the purchase of an overlock machine, which will allow him to increase production as well as the quality of his work. He commits to repay the loan in four months. Make up your mind to help him. He and his family are very grateful of the opportunity you are giving them to improve and make the business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristian tiene 20 años de edad, está soltero y vive en la localidad de Apodaca, Nuevo León. Los gastos de su hogar eran muchos y sólo con el salario de su padre no se podían cubrir, por lo que Cristian ha trabajado desde pequeño para apoyarlos. Aprovechando los conocimientos que tiene del bordado profesional, hace dos años decidió emprender su propio negocio y comenzó bordando playeras para un equipo de fútbol amateur, pero gracias a la buena calidad de su trabajo pronto logró hacerse de más clientes y afortunadamente ha tenido mucho trabajo.

Cristian desea continuar creciendo y para esto necesita un préstamo de $325 dólares, que empleará en la compra de una sobre hiladora, que le permitirá incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de su trabajo. Se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Decídete a apoyarlo. El y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of machinery.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is 56 years old, a produce merchant, and married to Eric Escobar, who is 47 years old and a professional chauffer. They have three children who are older now and don't live with them.

Teresa has had her position selling fruits and vegetables in the city market of Paraguarí for over 20 years. Before then, she was selling them from her home. Later she took action and opened her own shop, which has a good location since it's found in the most important market in the city. She trades with an established clientel. Thanks to her work, all her sons are professionals.

She needs a loan to buy a freezer that will be very useful in the summers.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Teresa tiene 56 años, comerciante, está casada con Eric Escobar de 47 años de edad de profesión chofer, tienen 3 hijos todos mayores de edad ya no viven con ellos. Teresa tiene su puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Paraguarí hace 20 años, anteriormente vendía en su casa, luego se animo y abrió su propio local, la cual tiene una muy buena ubicación ya que se encuentra en el mercado más importante de la ciudad; cuenta con clientela formada. Gracias a su trabajo todos sus hijos son profesionales. Necesita el crédito para la compra de un congelador que es de mucha utilidad para ella en época de verano

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás is 57 years old, a shoemaker, and married to Gladys Godoy, who is 48 years old. They have two sons; one who is 27 years old and one who is 24 years old. They are professionals now thanks to the work of their parents. Tomás has two nephews who are working with him, to whom he is teaching the trade and paying so they may contribute to their family expenses.

Tomás learned the trade from his uncle, who he worked with when he was very young, and after ten years he was able to own his own shoe business in his home. With the loan he plans to buy leather, soles, thread, and glue to make shoes in bulk, since he has received a lot of orders from his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tomás tiene 57 años, zapatero de profesión, casado con Gladys Godoy de 48 años de edad. Tienen dos hijos uno de 27 años y otro de 24 años, profesionales gracias al trabajo de sus padres. Tiene dos sobrinos que están trabajando con él, a quienes les enseña el oficio y les remunera para contribuir con los gastos de su familia. Tomás aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien estuvo trabajando desde muy joven y después de 10 años habilitó su propia zapatería en su domicilio. Proyecta con el crédito comprar cuero, plantillas, hilos, pegamentos para realizar trabajos en gran cantidad, ya que ha recibido bastante pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase leather, soles, threads, and glue.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en:
Sra. Rosalba, 39, owns a cell phone shop in Luque, Paraguay, a small town outside of Asuncion. She is a married mother with two elementary school children. She opened her shop two years ago with her husband Sr. Jorge Dominguez. Before opening their business Sra. Rosalba worked selling cloth. During this time she and her husband were able to save up enough money to start their own business. Their first inclination was to open a shop that sold cloth, similar to her old trade. However, through research they realized that this was not profitable and therefore they looked into other more forward-thinking options. In the end they decided to open a cell phone store.

Today their shop is thriving. As a result of their success they have been able to save money. With every dollar earned they are able to put a portion away for their children’s education. They want to give their children the opportunity to attend university, a privilege they had never dreamed of. Their ultimate hope is for their children to carry on their legacy and become professional entrepreneurs in the business world of today.

They will use the loan to augment their stock of cell phones and cell phone accessories. This is especially important with the upcoming holiday season. They need to have a variety of options to please their wide consumer base.

loans.use: To buy cell phones.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen Churac X., 38 years old, sells fruits and vegetables in front of her house and at the market. She learned the ropes of buying and selling fresh fruits and vegetables by working alongside her mother for 22 years. When she got married, she started her own business called "La Guadalupana fruit sales". She sells fruits both wholesale and retail, including apples, mangos, pineapples, and papayas. In the summer she specializes in selling fruits that grow in coastal low lands, and in the fall she sells elote, cooked corn on the cob. She travels every Saturday to the main market in the regional center of Santa Lucia Cotzumalguapa to purchase her whole week's inventory and then returns back to her home where she sells the fruit.

Carmen is married and has 6 children ranging in age from 19 to 4 years old. Her husband works in the fields cultivating crops and brings home very little money due to the poor wages and seasonality of his work. So her income is an important part of supporting her family, and she is very proud to have the wherewithall to earn it. Her dream is to provide an education to all of her children. So far she has been successful. Her oldest daughter has already graduated and now is employed as a teacher. Paying back the loan monthly is another important goal which because of her own commitment she has been successfully doing. She realizes that by being in this program she can grow her business a little bit at a time and better herself and her family slowly but surly.

She is a religious person and calls upon God to help her resolve the lingering problems with her first husband. She decicates her free time to working in her church and hopes that with God's help she can find her way though this challenge.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina A. T. Chip, 24 years old, runs a small neighborhood food store. When she and her husband started their lives together, they opened up this little tienda called "Evelyn". At first they started off selling drinks and snack foods and now it is a well stocked neighborhood grocery. She is a motivated person and works hard at growing the business with her husband and raising their young family. Currently they have 4 young children who are too young for school but it is her dream that they go to school and thrive with their studies.

The credit with Friendship Bridge will provide more opportunities for growth and decisionmaking as well as responsibilities. She is excited about the influx of investment capital which will help further growth of the business, and she also is fully committed to the responsibility. of paying the monthly installments on time and in full.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her little store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Sra. Juliana and Sr. Teodolfo Blanco are married with two boys. They are living in Barrio Santa Rosa, Paraguay. Teodolfo works as the foreman of a company in the region of Ybycuí and Juliana owns a small store in their community. Thanks to the efforts of the two they have been able to buy their own house and provide for their two school-aged boys. Juliana began her business as a way to supplement the income of the family. From her own house Juliana runs a small store in which she sells basic staples to people in her neighborhood.

Juliana began her business with what little capital her husband was able to set aside for her. Little by little Juliana began to acquire products such as sugar, rice, noodles and oil which are available in her store. In this way Juliana has been able to help maintain their house and put her boys through school.

Juliana wishes to use her loan to acquire a refrigerator allowing her to offer a greater selection of merchandise as well as better quality goods. In the interest of growing her business Juliana has asked for this loan.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (rice, sugar, flour)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more fabrics and goods for sale

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
Nuri R. sells clothing for women. She is married and has 4 children. Nuri has high school education. She has been in business for 9 years. In 2003, Nuri took a $70 loan from MicroInvest. She used the money to expand her store and add underwear and shoes for children to her assortment of goods. Thanks to the lenders like you, Nuri doubled her business assets. In the future, Nuri wants to open another sales location.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахмонова Нури занимается торговлей женской одежды. Замужем, имеет четверых детей, образование неполное среднее. Занимается торговлей уже 9лет. В 2003году она решила получить займ в размере 70$. После получения займа и целевого использования она добавила в свой ассортимент детскую обувь и нижнее белье, расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза больше. Этим она благодарна МЗФ «Микроинвест». В будущем она планирует открыть ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: Open another sales location

payments.comment: Today she made her payments and said that her business is going very fast.She has good stream of clients as she bought many modrern clothes for them.She thinks that soon she will finished her loan from KIVA and she is very thankful for their trust and help.

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru:
Azimchon I. sells children's shoes and men's clothing. He is married and has two children. He has a specialized middle school education. His wife helps him with with his business. The children are in school. He began working in sales 3 years ago. Borrowing money allowed him to significantly increase the diversity of goods he has for sale and secure a sales location. In the future he is planing to secure another sales location where his wife will be working as a sales person.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмоилов Азимчон занимается торговлей детской обуви и мужской одежды. Женат, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее специальное. Жена помогает мужу в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Начал заниматься торговлей 3года назад. После неоднократного кредитования и целевого использования Азимчон увеличил наименования товара в несколько раз больше, приобрел новое место деятельности. В будущем планирует открыть ещё одно место для торговли, где будет торговать его жена.

loans.use: to open another activity place for his wife

loans.name: Shahrbonu

texts.ru:
Shahrbonu G. is 43 years old and has three children. She also has a high-school education. Her business is making piroshki (little cakes). Her daughter helps her with it. Before taking out the loan she had to borrow ingredients from the local suppliers. In 2004 she decided to get a loan in order to increase her assets. Borrowing and investing the money in her business she was able to start purchasing supplies for cash, transporting the goods herself and opened up a sales location. She employs several workers. In the future she is planing to increase the amount of goods she sells. Her daughter is shown on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer.

Гаффорова Шахрбону – 43года, имеет троих детей, образование высшее. Занимается услугой, то есть приготовлением пирожков. В её деятельности помогает ей её дочь. До получения займа она брала сырьё в долг у местных поставщиков. В 2004году она решила получить займ и увеличить активы. После неоднократного получения займа и целевого использования она стала брать сырьё за наличные, стала привозить товар сама и открыть торговую точку. В столовую наняла рабочих. В будущем планирует увеличить товар. На фото её дочь.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
Nuriniso K. has been selling shoes for children for 4 years. She is married and has 3 children. Nuriniso has a college degree. Nuriniso’s daughter helps her to sell. Her first MicroInvest loan of $150, Nuriniso invested in expanding her business. Since then, Nuriniso doubled her business assets. In the future, she plans to continue expanding the store and assortment of shoes.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Холботурова Нуринисо занимается продажей детской обуви вот уже 4года. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование высшее. В её торговле помогает ей её дочь. Первый займ получила в МЗФ «Микроинвест», в размере 150$. После получения займа и целевого использования она увеличила товарооборот, расширила место деятельности. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза больше. В будущем планирует расширить место деятельности и увеличить активы.

loans.use: To expand the store and increase assortment of shoes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 57 years old, lives with his wife -next to him on the picture- in the area of Ain El Mraysseh in Beirut. Ali has been concierge in the same school for the past 24 years. 8 years ago, he had the opportunity to buy 2 school buses for a very good price and used his life savings to do so. Ali heard of Al Majmoua through a friend who is a borrower. With the 4 consecutive loans Ali took from the Institution in the 5 last years, he was able to buy extra buses - he now owns 5 of them- and to purchase accessories and spare parts. Ali employs 4 drivers and has a yearly contract with the school to transport the students. This contract is being renewed every year. Ali is now trying to convince his elder son, who lives abroad, to come back to Lebanon and take over the business.
Ali needs a loan of USD 1,200 to buy spare parts for 2 of the buses, paint one of them and do the mechanical check up of the buses before school starts.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and mechanical check-up of the 5 school buses he owns

loans.name: Bissan

texts.en:
Bissan lives in Baalback, North East of Lebanon. She owns a small packaging business and is specialized in chocolate packaging especially for speciA. occasions like a birth, a wedding, parties. Clients bring the chocolate to her and she packs each piece of it with very originA. and nice accessories.
Bissan has already taken 7 loans from A. Majmoua and has a very clean record of on time repayments. When we first met Bissan, she was working from home. After 3 years, she was able to open a small shop and work kept expanding since then. Her living conditions and the one of her family improved tremendously in parallel to her business expansion.
Bissan needs a loan of USD 1,200 to buy some materiA. and accessories as she is expecting a high season ahead with numerous holidays coming ahead.

loans.use: Purchase of basic decoration material and accessories for her small packaging business

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia, 31 years old, lives in the city of Baalback in the Bekaa. She runs, from home, a small business of cosmetics and perfumes retail.
Samia already borrowed twice from A. Majmoua and has a very clean record of repayment. Since the first time we met her, we knew she is very ambitious.
A couple of months ago, Samia made her mind: she thinks she is ready to open a small shop and she needs the amount of USD 1,000 to prepare for the shop opening. She has to install shelves and stands, do a little bit of decoration and buy some inventory. We wish you could be with us for her grand opening.

loans.use: Opening of a perfumes and cosmetics products shop

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh and her husband own a small butcher shop in the village of Ain Bourssay in the Bekaa. Fatmeh has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years and his an excellent client. Before knowing Al Majmoua, she was staying home and her husband was a daily worker.
