With the consecutive loans, they were able to open the butcher shop where Fatmeh is the cashier and handles the accounting issues.
The shop has been a breath of air for her. It played a very important role in empowering her at home and encouraged her to participate more with her husband in the decision process.
Fatmeh and her husband need a loan for USD 1,000 to purchase a new meat shopper and a meat grinder.

loans.use: Buy a meat chopper and meat grinder machine for the butchery

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en:
Moustapha, 34 years old, married and father of two, runs a blacksmith business in the city of Tripoli in the North of Lebanon. He has been a borrower of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years and has a very clean history of on time repayments.
Moustapha is a hardworker whose only concern in life is to provide his children with the best life he can.
Moustapha needs the amount of USD 1,200 to buy a stock of steel that he as negotiate for a very good price. When our beneficiaries tell the suppliers they can pay cash for the goods, this is usually a great power of bargain and they benefit from substantial discounts.

loans.use: Buy a stock of steel

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese, 39 years old, married and mother of one child owns a small tailor shop in Bourj Hammoud in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut. 
She has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 3 years and has a very good record of on time repayment. Before opening the shop a couple of years ago, Therese was working from her home. With time, she understood that if she wants to get more exposure and expand her business, she needs to open a shop and offer a better visibility for her work.
As expected, since the opening of the shop, she enlarged her clients base  and increased her monthly revenues in a substantial way.
This time, Therese needs a loan for an amount of USD 750 to buy a stock of fabrics and sewing threads. Indeed, she has received from 2 schools in her neighborhood a request to provide them with a large number of students uniforms.

loans.use: Purchase of a large stock of fabrics and sewing threads

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 48 years old and the mother of 3 children. She owns a small fruit and vegetable shop in the area of Nabaa in Beirut. Before opening her own shop, Mariam rented a stand at the vegetable market. With 3 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua, she was able to open her own shop and ensure a stable daily income for her family.

Mariam needs a loan of US$350 to buy a larger stock of fruits and vegetables than usual. She expects a higher volume of sales in the coming weeks due to the approaching holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for her small fresh food shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make a new tricycle cart for his sales

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa, 50 years old, mother of 2 children owns a small business of wedding and evening dresses renting in the area of Nabaa in Beirut. Sanaa has borrowed 7 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua. This very enthusiastic and dynamic woman has been constantly expanding her business since the first time we met her. She has very nice taste in picking the dresses she buys and amazing marketing skills in convincing her clients about the dress they should rent.
Sanaa has been for a long time the main breadwinner of the family. Through her work, not only was she able to help her husband opening a small shop, she did the same for her daughter in helping her opening a small business.
Sanaa needs a loan of USD 1,200 to buy new evening dresses and therefore increase her shop inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of new evening dresses for her small business of wedding and evening dresses renting

loans.name: Karamshaboh

texts.en:
Karamshaboh, 45 years old, father of 3 children, owns a car spare parts and accessories small shop in the area of Al Mazraa in Beirut.
This is the first time Karamshaboh borrows a loan from Al Majmoua. Like many other micro-entrepreneurs, he heard of our Institution by word of mouth.
Karamshaboh needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to buy a stock of car spare parts and accessories.

loans.use: Purchase a stock of spare parts and car accessories.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji, 34 years old, father of 2 children, owns a small games and internet cafe in Bourj Hammoud, in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut. 
This is the first time Naji requests a loan from Al Majmoua. Like many other micro-entrepreneurs, he heard about our Institution through word of mouth. 
Naji's cafe is located in a highly populated area and he needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to expand his business. Indeed, in order to answer the demand, he wants to buy 2 new computers.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 new computers for his games and  internet cafe

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 33 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is unemployed. She is living with her family in a rented house. She has a small general store. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more new goods for the store. She also wants to renovate the shop by painting it and making new shelves. She wants to increase her income and improve her living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more new goods

loans.name: Asadllah

texts.en:
Asadllah lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He was unfortunately not able to get any schooling. He is married and has 2 sons who both are married.

Asadllah has a small restaurant, so he wants to take out an individual loan to use to enlarge his restaurant. That way, he will be able to earn more profit to continue taking care of his family, especially helping his wife, and to make a better future for their family.

Asadllah is happy for the help AFSG is giving him, and he would like to thank those who make a small loan possible for him.

loans.use: To enlarge his little restaurant

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Dr. Nathan M. is an obs/ gynecology practitioner managing his own private facility in Kitale, Kenya. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children. He initially set up a small clinic in the center of town but gradually moved to a larger facility to cope with increased clientele from the initial 10 clients a day to 30.

Dr. M. offers a wide range of health services including general medicine, family planning, maternal and child health services. He also has a pharmacy and a laboratory.

Dr. M. attributes his success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s two previous microfinance loans. He has received and fully paid back a total of Kshs 500,000 (approximately US $ 7140). As he plans to further expand and integrate other services in his facility, he has applied for a loan of US $ 1200.

loans.use: Facility expansion

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela is a living example of a hardworking and diligent woman. After her husband’s death 15 years ago, she had to work a lot in order to take care of her three sons. Currently, she considers herself satisfied with her commitment, since her sons are working in other parts of the country and can earn their own living. She’s now living with her three grandsons.

People in Guanuma are facing a serious water scarcity. If it doesn’t rain, they have to walk about 8 km to reach the public tap to collect water daily. Michaela thinks she can have a positive impact in her community and has decided to do something. She plans to buy a second-hand motorcycle and some five-gallon bottles. She also wants to buy a pack saddle to put behind the motorcycle to carry the bottles.

As Michaela is an elderly woman, she’ll let her 19-year-old grandson tend to the business. Daily, the boy will go all around the streets to sell water to people in the community. To start this business, Michaela is asking for a US$ 225 loan which will be repaid in a period of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle so as to distribute water in the community.

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en:
Rabiha is 34 years old and lives with her younger brother. She runs a very small grocery shop out of her home in the village of Barghlyeh in south Lebanon.

This is the first time that Rabiha has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. She wants to diversify the products she sells in her shop and needs US$300 to buy some school stationery and school uniforms.

Rabiha is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "A. Ata", meaning,"the sharing". A group is usually made up of female volunteers living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending system is based on incrementA. increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment.

The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community as the group has to work together to ensure that every loan is paid off. It is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women in Lebanon.

loans.use: Purchase of school stationery and school uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different types of animals

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham, 40 years old, lives with her parents in the village of Barghlyeh in the south of Lebanon. She works in a nearby school as a cleaning employee. Siham does not earn much but helps her parents as much as she can with the daily home expenses. This is the first time that Siham has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs US$300 to paint her parents' home as well as make some sanitary improvements to it.

Siham is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "A. Ata", meaning,"the sharing". A group is usually made up of female volunteers living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending system is based on incrementA. increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment.

The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community as the group has to work together to ensure that every loan is paid off. It is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women in Lebanon.

loans.use: Undertake home painting and sanitary improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more medicines straight from wholesalers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand the inventory of his general store/bike repair shop

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima, 20 years old, lives with her parents in the village of Barghlyeh in the south of Lebanon. She is currently employed in a beauty salon and earns a very small salary that is not enough to help her parents as her father is physically disabled and Fatima is the main household breadwinner.

This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. She is asking for US$300 to buy basic equipment to open her own hairdressing business. This will allow her to earn more and help her parents with the household expenses.

Fatima is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "A. Ata", meaning,"the sharing". A group is usually made up of female volunteers living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending system is based on incrementA. increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment.

The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community as the group has to work together to ensure that every loan is paid off. It is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women in Lebanon.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment to open her own hairdressing business at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase iron for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar carpas y mesas para su local

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase live pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Business description

Ana started her business a year ago. The products she offers are: perfumes, cosmetics and chickens. She pays personal attention to her clients every day between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m.

Loan use

Ana needs a loan to purchase new fragrances, make ups and materials to fix up her store. From this, she'll be able to offer a fresh look and a variety of products to her clients.

Personal information

Ana is 46 years old. She has a young son who is in school. Her husband works at an auto repair shop. She started her business with a small amount of capital and works out of her home. She needs the loan to be able to set up her store better and offer her clients a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Ana inicio su negocio hace 1 año. Los Productos que ofrece son: Perfumes, cosméticos y pollos. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a.m. -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Ana necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de nuevas fragancias, maquillajes y materiales para arreglar el local de su negocio. De esta manera ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ana tiene 46 años. Tiene 1 hijos menor que esta estudiando .Su esposo trabaja como operario en un taller donde arreglan chapas y elevadores de vidrios de los autos. Ana inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital .El trabajo lo realiza en su domicilio. Por lo que necesita del crédito para poder acondicionar de mejor manera su local y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Invest in new fragrances and other merchandise

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Business description

Jacinta started her business five years ago. The products she offers include: women's undergarments, perfume and candies. She pays personal attention to her clients every day between 8 a.m. and 9 p.m.

Loan use

Jacinta needs the loan to purchase new dress models, new fragrances and additionally fix up her small flock of chickens, which she sells every eight weeks. Through this, she'll be able to offer a new variety of products to her customers.

Personal information

Jacinta is 39, and her youngest daughter is still in school. Her husband works in construction. She started her business with a small amount of loaned capital, and she sells her items in outdoor areas near her home. She's requesting the loan to set up a space for her business in her home and to create a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Jacinta inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los Productos que ofrece son: ropa interior para damas, perfumería y confites. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Jacinta necesita del préstamo para adquirir: Nuevos modelos de prendas de vestir, nuevas fragancias y adicionalmente arreglar su pequeño criadero de pollos los que los vende cada 8 semanas. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Jacinta tiene 39 años. Tiene 1 hija menor que estudia. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero en la construcción. Jacinta inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital prestado .Su trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulante por lugares cercanos a su casa. Por lo que necesita del crédito para poder acondicionar un espacio en su casa y crear un bazar.

loans.use: Invest in new models and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investing in the purchase of an industrial kitchen, tables and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business description

José started his business two years ago. The products that he offers include: breakfasts, lunches and snacks. He pays personal attention to his clients every day from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.

Loan use

José needs a loan to purchase materials to fix his diner and to acquire tables, plates and kitchen utensils.

Personal information

José is 23 years old and single. Through his business he helps relatives. He started his business with his own capital. The restaurant is part of his mother's home. With the loan he hopes to make repairs to the diner and make his business more mobile. Through this he'll be able to improve his customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

José inicio su negocio hace 2 años. Los productos que ofrece son: desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas la atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6-a.m.-a -9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de: materiales para arreglar su local y en la adquisición de mesas, platos y de utensilios de cocina.

Información Personal

José tiene 23 años. Es soltero .En la atención de su negocio le ayudan sus familiares .José inicio su negocio con capital propio. El local ocupa una parte de la casa de su madre. Por lo que necesita del crédito para realizar arreglos de su local e implementar más mobiliarios. Para de esta forma mejorar el servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Repair restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase product variety and quantity.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Business Description

Miss Isabel has owned a pharmacy for two years. She started this business thanks to a credit she got from a financial institution. Nowadays, her sales have grown considerably since she is located at a very commercial sector. Four months ago, the business had grown to the point that it was necessary to open a second pharmacy. Isabel's mother helps her at the pharmacy. Her biggest clients are the neighborhood's doctor's offices

Loan Use

Isabel wants to use this credit to purchase more merchandise and a display cabinet. She will use the display cabinet to better display her products and increase sales because she has new plans for her future.

Personal Information

Isabel is 20 years old and she is single. Her home is built out of cement and her goal is to extend her business. Currently, she is helping one of her brothers who has autism. Isabel always does her best to satisfy her clients. She wants to have a larger income so that she can share it with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señorita Isabel tiene una farmacia desde hace 2 años, ella empezó su negocio gracias a un crédito de una institución financiera del sector, hoy en día sus ventas han crecido notablemente ya que esta ubicada en un sector muy comercial a tal punto que ha abierto otro local hace cuatro meses atrás, en el negocio le ayuda su mama y sus mayores clientes son los consultorios médicos de estos sectores.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar su crédito para comprar mas mercadería y también una vitrina para de esta manera poder exhibir sus productos mejor y así tener mas ventas ya que tiene nuevos planes para su futuro.

Información Personal

Tiene 20 años y es soltera, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es ampliar su negocio ya que en la actualidad ella ayuda a uno de sus hermanos que tiene un problema de autismo y siempre se esmera para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y poder tener mas ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and invest on a  display cabinet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and improve the premises

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Gregoria is dedicated to the sale of bleach and disinfectant to institutions and factories. She also sells other products, such as softeners and aromatizers, that have been requested by her clients. She presently counts with the help of a salesman, who travels to the countryside to offer the products that Gregoria elaborates.

Loan Use

She needs the credit in order to buy more raw materials and thus have more products to offer. She is also considering opening a store at her house as, until now, she has only been selling door to door.

Personal Information

She is 48 years old and has four children, one of which is in school. Her house is made of cane and her main goal is to build a concrete house and ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Gregoria se dedica a la venta de cloro y desinfectante a instituciones y fábricas. Además vende otros productos, como suavizantes y aromatizantes, que han sido solicitados por sus clientes. Actualmente le ayuda un vendedor que viaja a los campos a ofrecer el producto que Gregoria elabora.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para poder comprar más materia prima y así poder tener más productos que ofrecer. Además ella ha pensado en poner un local en su casa, pues hasta ahora la venta la realiza puerta a puerta.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 48 años y cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno estudia. Su casa es de caña y su principal meta es poder construir su casa de cemento y asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to elaborate cleaning products.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Business Description

Mariana has a grocery store, very well located on a main street, which she opened nine years ago with the help of her savings. She presently sells all kinds of basic needs products, and also has installed video game machines next to her store.

Loan use

She needs this loan to buy merchandise at a wholesale price, and to be able to renovate her store, which is long overdue.

Personal Information

She is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom study. Her house is made of concrete and her main goal is to make her business grow and ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Mariana tiene una despensa, muy bien ubicada en una calle principal, la que abrió hace 9 años con la ayuda de unos ahorros. Actualmente vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y además tiene video juegos que ha colocado junto a su tienda.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería a precio de mayorista y poder así reacondicionar su local, que hace tiempo no lo acondiciona.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 32 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian. Su casa es de cemento y su principal meta es crecer en su negocio y asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child. They live in the village of Barghlyeh in south Lebanon. She offers housekeeping services but earns a limited monthly income. This is the first time Abir requests a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs USD 300 to do some sanitary improvement and maintenance work at home before the winter starts.

Abir is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "A. Ata", meaning,"the sharing". A group is usually made up of female volunteers living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending system is based on incrementA. increases in loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment.

The strength of the group loan is that it encourages a collaborative approach in the borrowing community as the group has to work together to ensure that every loan is paid off. It is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women in Lebanon.

loans.use: Do some maintenance work in her home before the winter season starts

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad, 36 years old, father of 3 children runs a small fish selling business in the area of Chyah in Beirut. Everyday, he installs his mini van in a different location and sells the fish in the street. Imad has been a client of Majmoua for the past 3 years and has a very good record of on time repayments. He hopes to increase his daily revenues and be able to save enough money in order to open a small shop.
Imad needs this loan of USD 1,200 to buy a small freezer and a small generator that he will keep in his van to store the fishes at cold temperature.

loans.use: Buy a small freezer and a generator to keep the fish inventory at cold temperature in his van .

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid, 26 years old, owns a small travel agency in Tarik Jdideh, in Beirut. He worked for several years in a ticketing company but received very small wages. 3 years ago, he decided he wanted to be on his own and opened the travel agency. 
This is the first time Hamid requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Like the majority of micro-entrepreneurs who contact us, he heard about Al Majmoua through word of mouth from other borrowers.
Hamid needs a USD 1,000 loan to purchase a new computer for his business.

loans.use: Buy a new computer for his small travel agency.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This valiant woman of 45 lives with her husband and their four children. The couple owns a confectionery (pastry-making business) in Herrera, a secluded area of Santo Domingo. As an excellent confectioner, Francisa prepares different kinds of succulent sweets like pies, buckwheat cake, pudding, and so forth. At the midday, her confectionery shop is turned into a cafeteria where food is sold to a number of people.

Presently, Francisca has a well-established clientele which continues expanding. Due to that fact, she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials so she can offer her customers more variety. Francisca is requesting a loan of US$ 325.

loans.use: To invest in her business in order to offer more variety to the customers

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil, 47 years old, married and father of 3 children, owns a small tailoring factory in the area of Salim Slim in Beirut.
Jamil, who is a hardworking person, has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years. When we first met, he was working alone in his business. With the consecutive loans he received from Al Majmoua, he was able to expand his business, buy more machines and employ 3 women to help him with the tailoring.
This time, Jamil needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,000 to buy fabrics, threads and other accessories such as new needles for the sewing machines.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, threads and accessories for the business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 43 years old and is married with two children, ages 24 and 22. She lives with her family in one of the Bateyes, which are migrant camps owned by the nationalized sugar-cane industry in the Dominican Republic. She hopes to use her portion of her group's loan to sell small food items to her community, such as chicken and rice. She is going to name her small business ¨Creciendo Juntos¨ (Growing Together). Edita has dreams of buying her own house one day and not having to live in the company barracks.

NOTE: This $600 loan will fund Edita's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy food items such as chicken and rice for resale

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is 27 years old, single, and supports her 5 children, aged 8, 6, 4, 2, and 3 months. She lives with her children in one of the Batey community houses in the province of El Seibo. In addition to her children, she shares the barracks with 8 other people. This is her first group loan from Esperanza; there are four other women in her group.

Altagracia hopes to use her portion of her group's loan to sell clothing items and shoes to her community. She is going to name her small business ¨Mercancía de Altagracia¨ (Altagracia´s Merchandise). Eventually she has dreams of buying her own house, and not having to live in the company barracks. She spoke of wanting to save her money so she will have the opportunity to do this.

NOTE: This $600 loan will fund Altagracia's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a lively, funny, community-oriented woman. She is 41 years old and has three children (ages: 16, 19, 21). She has two grandsons, one who is 4 and one grandson who just turned nine months old. All her children and grandchildren live in her house with her and her husband.

Olga is pictured here with her handicrafts, including the stand, which she makes and sells to her community. She makes most of her goods out of clay. She has been an Esperanza client for one year and has already successfully paid back two loans (both for 120 USD). Now she is applying for a third loan. She is going to use the third loan to buy more materials from which to make her crafts. She wants to use the profits from her sales to make improvements on her home.

NOTE: This $600 loan will fund Olga's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba is 59 years old. She has seven children and five grandchildren. This is her second loan from Esperanza. She successfully paid back her first loan which was for 5000 pesos (150 USD). She used her first loan to build her Colmado (convenience store) and buy some products to sell, such as cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks. She is going to use this next loan to buy an additional storage unit for her goods, so she can keep more products and continue expanding her small business.

Elba has been living with her father who is 80, her younger children, and two of her grandchildren since her husband died. Before she got the loan from Esperanza she was selling small items by the side of the road. She eventually wants to use the profits from her Colmado to make repairs on her house. Her son and his wife also have a loan out with Esperanza.

NOTE: This is a group loan; there are four other women in Elba's group. This $1200 loan will fund Elba's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase a larger storage unit to keep her inventory in

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and has three children (ages: 11, 10, 8). She is married and the whole family of five live in her house. She runs her business out of her house, selling fabrics, primarily bedding (i.e., sheets, pillow cases, curtains, etc.) Ana has already successfully paid back one loan from Esperanza for 5000 pesos (150 USD). She is requesting this second loan to buy a sewing machine, so she can make her own products out of cloth.

Ana was born crippled. Her legs are badly deformed, but she still walks on them and is able to work to proviD. for her family.

NOTE: This is a group loan, there are four other women in her group. This $900 loan will fund Ana's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be maD.. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to manufacture the bedding products she sells

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: -She is 45 years old and has three children who are 26, 20, and 18 years old. -She and her husband are separated, but she does not have the resources to move out of his house with her two children -All her children went to school -This is the second loan that she is taking out from Esperanza. She successfully paid back the first loan, which was for 4000 pesos (120 USD) -Her business involves buying household items (i.e. shampoo, clothes, and small electronic items) from Santo Domingo and delivering them to people in her community and the nearby communities. When someone makes an order for something from Santo Domingo she can get it for them and sell it at a small profit for delivery service. -With her loans, she eventually wants to be able to have her own house from which she can sell her wares.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca comes from Apodaca in Nuevo León, is married and has two children. Due to the country’s high unemployement rate, Francisca and her husband had no source of income, so they decided to start their own business, elaborating and selling cakes for special events. In the beginning, they worked only by orders but, thanks to their clients’ recommendations, the demand for their products grew and they soon incorporated a delivery service and opened a bakery store.

Francisca wishes her business will continue growing. In order to provide a good service to her clients, she needs a $1200 loan, which she’ll invest in the purchase of a bigger oven, that will allow her to increase production. She promises to repay the loan in six months. Take part in the development of this business. Francisca and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ante la falta de empleo del país, Francisca y su esposo se encontraban sin ninguna fuente de ingresos, así que decidieron emprender su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de pasteles para eventos especiales. Al principio sólo fue sobre pedidos, pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes, la demanda por sus productos se incrementó mucho y pronto incorporaron la entrega a domicilio e iniciaron una panadería.

Ahora Francisca desea que su negocio continúe creciendo y para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes necesita de un crédito de $ 1,200 dólares, que empleará en la compra de un horno más grande, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción. Ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio; Francisca y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Sonia Araceli

texts.es:
Sonia is a hard working enthusiastic woman, married and mother of two children. As her husband’s salary is insufficient to cover the family’s needs, for the past two years Sonia has dedicated herself to cosmetics, shoes and bijouterie sales. Having associated with a neighbor, together they have managed to increase their clientele and offer a good service.

Presently Sonia has requests that she has not been able to meet. In order to buy more merchandise, she is requesting a $250 loan, that she promises to repay in four months. Take part in the development of this business. You can make this family’s life better. Don’t give it a second thought.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que, desde hace dos años, Sonia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, zapatos y joyería. Se asoció con una de sus vecinas y juntas han logrado incrementar sus clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio.

Actualmente Sonia tiene pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio; tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia; no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: Yayah is a 25 years old mother of a child aged 4. Selling clothes on credits is Yayah's business. Apart from this business, she sells various foods, vegetables, mineral water etc in her small shop. She usually earns $3 per day. Her husband is a driver with small income.She request a $50 loan to expand her business with hope to complete her small shop  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months

loans.use: To complete the business

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en: Kiki is 32 years old and is maried. Selling flower is her business. She has been running  her business since she became a member of MBK. Her husband is a worker with small income. Kiki has to work hard to cover her family's needs. She wants to have a $50 loan to expand her business and earn more income so that she could finance her children education. She is willing to repay this loan in period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Iis

texts.en: Iis is 23  years old and is married.  She has been running her business by selling  snacks, household, noodles etc. She usually earns  $10  per day as an income. She opens her small kiosk  from 07.00 until evening everyday. Her husband Muklis is a driver, earning of $16,5 per week. She is a member of MBK and requests $100 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is 36 years old, mother of a child aged 19. She has been running her business by selling household goods such as milk, rice, kerosene, cooking oil, etc.  She has to work hard to supplement her family's needs since her husband has passed away. She opens her shop from 7.30 to 19.00. Since she has joined as a member of MBK, her income increased gradually.  She expects to have $50 loan to have her shop bigger. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make her shop bigger

loans.name: Esih

texts.en: Esih is a 45 year old mother of 4 children. She has been mining gold since she become a member of MBK. She very much needs to receive a $50 loan to buy more goods, so that she can earn more income. Her husband Adih is a farm laborer. The income from him is so small and just enough to cover her family's daily needs. She expects to earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Kokom

texts.en: Kokom is 28 years old and is married. She buys and resells vegetables at her house and usually earns $10 per day. She is a member of MBK and wants to receive a $50 loan and intends to use it to buy more vegetables, and therefore earn more income per day. Her husband, Uding, sells vegetables at the market and earns $16.50 per day. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en: Eneng is 20 years old and is married. She has no children yet from her marriage, but she lives with her big families. She has been mining gold traditionally since she became a member of MBK, and usually earns $3 per day. She needs a $50 loan to expand her business and hopes to earn more, because it is their livelihood.  She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Atih

texts.en: Atih is 42 years old, and is the mother of a child aged 8. She sells some snacks, beverages, household goods, etc. in her small kiosk. She has to work hard on her own to cover her family's daily needs. She is a member of MBK and really wants to receive the $50 loan to expand her business. She hopes that she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Eti

texts.en: Eti is 24 years old and is married with one child aged 5. She sells flavoured blended fruit ice and her husband Ahmad is a driver. He can earn $4 per day. Eti can earn $2.50/day but the profit is only $1 per day. She very much needs this $50 loan to make her shop bigger and more sustainable. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To make her shop bigger

loans.name: Awat

texts.en: Awat is 45 years old and lives with one of her children aged 21, while her other children are married and live separately. She sells snacks, beverages, household goods, etc. Her husband, Samin, does odd jobs and has an unfixed income. Therefore, this business is the source of their livelihood. She really would like to receive the $50 loan to complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Juju

texts.en: Juju is a 30 year old mother of two children aged 8 and 1. The first one is a girl and the last one is a boy. She collects and then sells waste and scrap materials together with her husband. It is the only source of their livelihood.  She usually earns $5 per day. She very much wants to receive a $50 loan so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Ni Wayan Winawar

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Winawar – Bu Win – is a housewife. Since she is aware that her husband's income is on the borderline as a seasonal tenant farmer, she with her husband staerted this business. Two years ago, with a capital of Rp500,000.00 (about US$55) she bought 2 pigs that she raised the traditional way - leashed under a tree. She feed them talas roots and kankong leaves obtained from nearby areas. From that she obtained Rp800,000.00 (about $88) in 3 months. With that result, Bu Win added her raised pigs by buying 2 more mother pigs, with a capital from DINARI. With 4 mother pigs, Bu Win expects her sales to reach Rp2000,000.00 (about $220) per 3 months. Bu Win expects that this way she could fulfill daily family needs that reached Rp400,000.00 (about $44)/month. Even to buy woven bamboo (gedhek) to replace her hut's wall that started to fall apart.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Winawar – Bu Win – adalah ibu rumah tangga. Karena sadar akan penghasilan suaminya yang pas-pasan sebagai petani musiman. Bersama suaminya dia merintis usaha ini. Dua tahun yang lalu dengan modal Rp 500.000,00 dia membeli 2 ekor babi yang dipelihara secara tradisional - mengikatnya di bawah pohon. Makanan yang di berikan berupa ubi umbi talas / daun kangkung yang ada di sekitarnya. Hasil yang diperoleh Rp 800.000,00 /3 bulan. Melihat hasil yg diperoleh tersebut, Bu Win menambah jumlah peliharaannya dengan membeli 2 ekor bibit lagi dengan meminjam modal dari DINARI. Dengan 4 ekor induk babi yang Ibu Win miliki saat ini, maka hasil penjualannya mencapai Rp 2.000.000,00 / 3 bulan. Bu Win berharap dengan usaha ini dia dapat membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari - hari yang mencapai Rp 400.000,00 /bulan, bahkan bisa membeli bambu anyaman (gedhek) untuk mengganti dinding rumahnya yang sudah lapuk

loans.use:
To buy feedstock and build a stall

Membeli bibit dan membuat kandang

loans.name: Ikah

texts.en: Ikah is 35 years old and is married with two children. She buys fruit from the nearby market and then, together with her husband, resells it. She could earn more income in the festive season. They usually earn $20 per day as an income, but the profit is about $5 per day. She very much needs to receive a $50 loan to buy more fruit. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Ojah

texts.en: Ojah is 29 years and is married. She sells vegetables, and her husband Soleh also sells them at the market. He usually earns $10 per day.  She wants to receive a $50 loan to expand her business and the rest will be used for her husband's business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
MARIA Mary Magdalene X., 34, began selling drinks and snack foods in her store called "Paola" after coming to the realization that her husband's income was not sufficient to support their growing family. Slowly but surely the word got around and the customers started to come. Now her corner store is firmly established but it is not quite enough to make ends meet so in the afternoons she sells sweet drinks made of corn called atol and also lunch food called tostados. She works hard from early morning to late at night caring for her family, preparing the food for the day and running the two businesses. She is one busy person.

Maria also cares for her oldest daughter (age 15), who suffers from cerebral palsy resulting in mental and physical disability as well as speech problems. The daughter no longer receives treatment at the Fundabien Institution so the burden falls on Maria's shoulders Sometime she gets depressed and feels overwhelmed. But she has 6 other children that need her love and care, so she carries on the best she can. Her dream is to make sure the rest of the children get an education so they can get a good start in life. So she tends the store in the morning and sells her prepared food in the afternoon and cares for her family. Every day is a struggle; but, for the sake of her family, she fights on knowing someday things will get better.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the store

loans.name: Guljamol

texts.ru:
Guljamol has been a MicroInvest client for 3 years. She sells food products on the central market of Isfara. Guljamol is 37. She is married and has 1 child. Besides her sales business, Guljamol has a government job. On the days when Guljamol works for the government, her mother runs the sales business. Prior MicroInvest loans helped Guljamol significantly expand the sales volume. Guljamol wants to use this loan to expand her business further.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулчамол является клиентом Микроинвест уже 3 года. Она продает продукты питания на центральном рынке города Исфара. Гулчамол 37 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Кроме торговли она работает на государственной службе. В эти дни на рынок выходит торговать ее мать. Полученный займ в Микроинвест помог Гулчамол значительно увеличить товарооборот. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng is 29  years old, and is the mother of  two children aged 12 and 5. She has been mining gold traditionally since joining MBK as a member. Her husband, Edi, is a motorbike taxi driver earning an unfixed income. She wants to use the $50 loan to keep her business sustainable. She earns income every day to supplement her husband's income. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: I have been living in Vehari since I was born. I am a widow and have six children, four boys and two girls. Three of my sons are married and working and my daughters are still in school. My youngest son paints buildings and makes $3 to $4 per day. Last year, he took a loan to purchase buckets and some materials. Although he was able to pay back the loan, he has not been able to make too much profit because he still did not have enough equipment to help him work faster. Now he wants to take a loan  so that he can expand his painting business and obtain more contacts. His income helps feed the household and he plans to take care of me in my old age.

loans.use: expand the painting business

loans.name: Kamar

texts.en: I was born in Multan, a mid-sized city but moved to Vehari, a small town after my marriage. I am a mother of six, three sons and three daughters. Two of my daughters are married. Last year, one of my sons started a butcher shop with the help of his father. Now, my son wants to buy some tools and related equipment for his shop, for which he is asking for a loan of $175.  I think he can do well in this business because his elder brother is already running a butcher shop and has been assisting him in conducting his business successfully.

loans.use: need to buy tools used in butcher shop

loans.name: Liah

texts.en: Liah is 26 years old and is married. She mines gold traditionally, and since she became a member of MBK has been able to add to her capital. Her husband, Dedi, is a motorbike taxi driver earning $2.50 per day. However, she needs a $50 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: I am Shamim B.. I was born in Multan, a mid-sized city located in Southern Punjab, in the province of Pakistan. I moved to Vehari, a small town nearby when I got married. I am the mother of three boys and five girls. Three of my daughters are married and two of them are still studying. My husband and I are too old to work so all of my sons are currently working in different parts of the province and send money back home. One of my sons has a jewelry business in Dera Ghazi Khan, a town a few hours away. My son was employed at a store last year, but started his own business this year. There is fortunately great demand for the kind of jewelry he sells and he requires cashflow to purchase stock. A loan of $325 will help him to purchase more stock and make a greater profit in his shop.

loans.use: wants to invest in jewellery business

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is a 30 year old mother of 2 children. She sells clothes on credit and is a member of MBK. With her business, she can now make her own money without depending on her husband's help anymore.  Her husband, Selamet, is an informal labourer. His income is only enough to pay electricity and cover their family's daily needs. She usually earns $5/day and she expects to use the $50 loan to buy more other goods such as electrical goods. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some goods

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: I was born and raised in Multan, a city in Pakistan with great history. I now live in Vehari with my husband. I have nine children and all my sons are currently working as laborers. One of my daughters sews cloth for the neighbors. I am a housewife and am not allowed to work outside my home because I live in a community where it is not considered acceptable. Last year one of my sons, Ali Raza, started a pan (beetle nut) shop. His business did not do too well and he had to close it down due to lack of working capital. Next he started working in a jewelry shop and is doing well. Now he wants to start his own business purchasing jewelry from Lahore and selling for profit in Vehari. He has experience in the business and I think he would do well. For this purpose, he needs a loan of $250 to start his business successfully.

loans.use: open a jewellery shop

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: I am Khadija B.. I was born in Vehari. I am a widow and I buy and sell garments from my home, which helps provide for our family. I have four children; three boys and a daughter. My youngest son and daughter are still studying and my other two sons are in the livestock business. One of my sons wants to buy a goat or cow before Eid (religious festival). As prices of animals will escalate during Eid, he will make a good profit from it. He will pool in some savings with the loan to purchase the animal and requires a loan of $325 to support him in this venture.

loans.use: wants to purchase a cow

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: I am a mother of three, one son and two daughters. I have been living in Vehari since my childhood. One of my daughters is a teacher and the other is married. My son works with his father supplying stamp papers (a kind of official document used for making agreements or other important documentation) to a local bank. A few days ago, my husband broke his arm while working and my son must now work alone. There are quite a few vendors around doing the same business and if we could invest more we might be able to get some good returns. For this, I need a loan of $175 so that he can buy more stamp papers to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase stamp papers

loans.name: Cucum

texts.en: Cucum is 33  years old and is married. She runs a business selling clothes on credit, and usually goes around the village to sell her products. Her husband, Upandi, is a bus driver in Jakarta. She is happy to be a member of MBK because she can expand her business. She wants to get a $50 loan to be used to buy more goods. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kurnaesih

texts.en: Kurnaesih is 44 years old and is married. She prepares and sells coconut milk rice, and some fried snacks. She usually earns $4 per day. Her husband Samsudin is a driver with a small salary. She needs a $50 loan to complete her business and wants to earn more income to pay for her child's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: I am Kausar B. from Okara, an agricultural area located in the heart of Punjab, the most populated province of Pakistan. I moved to my husband’s hometown two years ago when we got married. I have a daughter who is nine months old. I completed 5th grade and hope that my daughter will be able to complete her education. My husband works as a tailor at a store, but his salary is not enough to meet our needs. As our needs are increasing with time, he has decided to start his own business. He is planning to rent a store and purchase some sewing machines. We will pool in our savings and are looking for a loan of $175 to start this new business.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Sukaesih

texts.en: Sukaesih is 32 years old and is married. She has a small shop together with her husband, that sells rice, cooking oil, noodles. She can earn $27 per day and needs a $50 loan to complete her business and earn more income because it’s their livelihood. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: I am Ruksana B. and was born in Vehari, a small town located 300km from Lahore in the heart of Punjab. I have eight children, six of which attend school. My husband sells herbal medicines to various stores in Vehari. In order to supplement our income, last year my husband took out a loan and bought a snooker table, which we kept at home. Boys from the neighborhood come to our house to play. Since Vehari is a small town, entertainment is scarce and renting out the snooker table proved to be successful, yielding $2 to $3 per day.  Now, we want to expand our snooker venture and purchase another table as demand for playing snooker is increasing among young boys. To purchase a new table I need a loan of $250. I think this loan would be very helpful, not only for the family, but also for my childrens' education.

loans.use: To buy a second snooker table

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: I am Nazia N. from Pakistan. My husband died a year and a half ago and since then I have been having a very hard time financially. I am the mother of three children and want to secure their future. Since my husband’s death, my mother has been helping me financially but she cannot be there forever. Therefore, I have started my own business selling wood for cooking fuel. Since I am selling from home, I am able to offer women in my neighborhood the convenience of buying wood at their doorstep. To continue this business and purchase more wood, I need a loan of around $175.  The income that this business will generate will help me to meet the  needs of me and my children.

loans.use: To buy wood for her business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am originally from Sahiwal but moved to Vehari after my marriage. I have three children.  One of my sons and my daughter are currently in school in 2nd and 3rd grade respectively. Education has been our first priority for our children. Last year, I took a loan and bought a Rickshaw (a three-wheel vehicle), which my family and I rented out to a driver for a fixed daily income. My husband has been running a small hotel for the last three years and is doing quite well. The hotel has been able to give us $3 to $5 per day. Since our hotel business is improving we need a freezer so that we can purchase food in bulk and reduce some of our running costs. With a freezer, we can diversify our hotel menu and offer products such as ice-cream in the summer, which is one of the longest seasons in this region. I am looking for  a loan of $325 to help us expand our business.

loans.use: To buy freezer for our hotel

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en: I am 55 years old and live in a small town in Pakistan. I have two daughters. One is married and the other is in 10th grade. I have been making crocheted items since I got married. I make table mats and cushion covers to order, which take from one day to a few days to make depending on the amount of effort involved. I make a reasonable profit from each piece but I could expand my business by purchasing more raw materials such as thread, needles and hiring women to work for me. This expansion would require an initial investment of $250 and need a loan to make it happen.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and hire staff

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: I am Razia P. and have been living in Vehari for the last fifteen years. I have four children, two boys and two girls. Three of my children are studying in school. I have been sewing clothes for my neighbors since I got married and last year, my husband started selling sweets in winter time. However, due to the seasonal nature of the business, we need to make an additional income and my husband now sells maize during the summer months. He buys maize from the local market and sells it in nearby villages. Through this business he can easily make around $5 to $7 a day, which is sufficient for our family. To expand this business, he would like to purchase his own cart instead of renting, and also to purchase additional stock. This business will allow us to continue to send out children to school  and to fulfill our household needs. We are requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: To expand our business

loans.name: Sheema

texts.en: I am Sheema and I was born here in Vehari, a small town 300 km away from the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore. I am nearly blind and cannot work. I have ten children, three boys and seven girls. My husband has a heart condition and is old, which makes it hard for him to do any physical work. Four of my daughters are married and two of my sons are working. Last year, I took a loan for one of my sons who owns a wholesale clothing business, where he purchases clothes from the city and sells in nearby villages at a higher price. He would like to expand and purchase more clothes to sell in the villages. Therefore, he needs $175 to expand his business. He is expecting that he can make up to $7-$8 per day if he can expand his microenterprise.

loans.use: buy clothes for the business

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en: I am Iffat Z. and I have been living in Vehari for the last eight years. My husband died five years ago from tuberculosis. I have four children, two boys and two girls. All of them are attending school and I myself have studied up to 10th grade, which is why their access to education is so important to me. I have been embroidering clothes since my childhood and supply these clothes to an owner of a boutique in Multan, a nearby city, which pays me well. Now, I want to buy a special stitching machine, known as a Peko machine, which will help me to make my clothes faster and be able to help me generate more income. Hence, I am requesting a loan of $250.

loans.use: To purchase a stitching machine

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: I am the mother of five children, two boys and three girls. I have been living in Vehari since my childhood. All of my children are in school and they would like to continue it. My husband has a family garment business and sells clothes in the surrounding villages of Vehari. Last year, we took a out a loan and made enough profit to repay the loan and invest in our house. Now, he is trying to expand further by purchasing more stock and we need a loan of $325 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand business our clothing business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nariwati

texts.id:
Ibu Nariwati started rearing pigs after marrying to Pak Temon. From this activity, she the mother of two manage to earn about Rp 20.000,00 per day. Every 3 months, from her sales she manage to earn about Rp 1.200.000,00. And every year she manage to earn up to Rp 4.800.000,00. Part of her capital comes from the financial assistance from Dinari. Her plan now is to increase her number of pigs. She depends very much on this business, because her husband's salary as a sand carrier is seasonal.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Nariwati sudah menekuni usaha ternak babi sejak menikah dengan Pak Temon. Dari usaha ini - ibu dua orang anak ini - bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-hari yang mencapai Rp 20.000,00 /hari. Tiap tiga bulan Ibu Nariwati memanen babinya, hasil panen terakhir ini keuntungan yang diperoleh Rp 1.200.000,00 sekali panen. Dalam satu tahun Bu Nariwati melakukan panen 4 kali sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp 4.800.000,00 /tahun. Sebagian modalnya merupakan hasil pinjaman dari Dinari. Rencananya dia akan menambah jumlah bibit babinya. Tentunya, dia sangat bergantung dengan usahanya ini. Karena usahanya ini jelas dengan pendapatan yang jelas. Sedangkan penghasilan suami yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk pengangkut batu/pasir - yang baru dapat hasil kalau ada order

loans.use: Menambah bibit babi - Buying piglets.

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
I am from Vehari, a small town located about 300km from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband and I are under a great deal of stress as we have nine children to feed, clothe and educate. My two elder sons work and my daughter stays at home as we cannot afford to send them all to school. 

I stay at home to take care of the children now. I used to sell some fruits and vegetables in my neighborhood, but that was unprofitable as neighbors liked to buy things on credit, which led to bad debt. My husband sells fruits and vegetables in the local market after purchasing them from nearby villages. Last year he was employed and made only $3 per day, but he has just set up his business. A $250 loan would help me and my husband to buy and sell more produce in the market and make $6 per day. With the additional profits, we will have more to eat and possibly be able to send our younger children to school.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun, 45, is a wedding planner and earns $10 a day. She has 4 children, two of whom are students, one is a garment worker and one is a photographer. Her two working children earn a combined income of $10 a day. Her husband, 48, is a fisherman who earns $7 a day.

She would like to borrow $400 to purchase more decorations for her wedding planning business to meet growing client demand. Her future goal is to open a photography shop to complement her wedding planning business.

loans.use: To purchase more decorating tools to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Ming

texts.en:
Mrs. Ming, 44, sells fish at the local market and earns $4 per day. The photograph shows her husband, 45, who earns $3 per day as a farmer. The couple has one child who earns $100 per month working at a hotel.

Mrs Ming is requesting this loan to purchase more fish to increase her inventory at the market and thereby increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to increase her inventory and revenue.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Mr. Qalib is a low income vulnerable person. He is 56 and married with three children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Qalib owns a herd of milk cows. Every day he sells milk to the local milk processing shop. His children help him to breed cows and to graze the herd. However, the income from four cows is too low to support the family or to save enough to buy more cows. The price of a milk calf is $300, and the cost of breeding it is $100. Galib applied to Norwegian Microcredit's Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow. This will help to make his monthly income higher. He plans to save the other $100 for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng, 35, is a housewife. She assists her farmer husband to work a plot of farmland to grow vegetables. She earns $5 per day in revenue. She has 5 children, one of whom is a student while the other 4 are employed. Two of her children earn $5 per day selling water, and two are construction workers earning $4 per day.

Mrs Seng is requesting this loan in order to dig a well and purchase a water pump to water her family's crops. She will also use the loan to buy seeds. Her husband is pictured in the photo on their plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a water pump for a newly dug well.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Seng Hoeung and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Amid

texts.en:
Mr. Amid is a low income vulnerable person. He is 23 and lives with his family in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Amid rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful and needs investment to increase the daily turnover. However, Amid has no collateral and so he cannot apply to the commercial banks for a loan. Therefore, he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a $500 loan. This loan would help him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods and to provide better for his family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Ray

texts.en: Mrs. Ray S., 27, lives with her husband and two school-going children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband are currently employed at a hotel, earning a combined income of about $7 each day. Mrs Ray S. is applying for a $1,000 loan to help repair her house, which normally leaks during a rainy season. Now that the monsoon season is approaching,  it would be better for her family if she could repair the house.

loans.use: To help repair her house, which normally leaks during a rainy season.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Mr. Zakir is a low income vulnerable person. He is 50 and married with 3 children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Zakir owns and operates a small food market in the local bazaar of Saatli town. He has had his shop for 15 years. The business is stable because Zakir has collected loyal customers. However, he needs to invest in the shop to diversify the assortment, increase the turnover and therefore the income. This will help to provide all the necessities for his life and for his children. Most commercial banks demand collateral to give Zakir credit, but he has nothing to mortgage. Therefore, he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch, which disburses credit free of collateral, for a $500 loan. This loan will help him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods, and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Phut

texts.en: Mrs. Phut S., age 40, is a housewife. Her husband, also 40, is employed as a bus driver earning $5 per day. The couple has 4 children, 2 of whom are students. Mrs. Phut is requesting a $1,000 loan to finance the purchase of a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Mirzammad

texts.en:
Mr. Mirzammad is a low income vulnerable person. He is 52 and married with two children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Mirzammad has a herd of milk cows and sells 100 litres of milk a day to the local milk processing shop and to the super market. The milk trade is good, and Mirzammad can see that he can sell more milk. This would require more cattle in the herd. Therefore, Mirzammad decided to buy two calves to breed and eventually increase his monthly turnover.

Mirzammad has applied for a $500 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch to buy two cows and increase the number of cattle in his herd.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Mr. Rafael is a low income vulnerable person. He is 38 and married with three children. He lives in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Rafael owns and operates a mini shop in Saatli. He sells spare parts, oil, and other supplies for cars. But, as you see in the picture, the working capital he has is very limited; he has no opportunity to diversify his assortment. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch and now is waiting to receive a $400 loan.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mr. Phuong Y., 37, lives with his wife and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To meet his family's living expenses, he works as a teacher, earning around $2 each day, while his wife sells sugar cane juice to the people in her area and generally earns about $3 each day. The couple has applied for a $1,000 loan to help them purchase a cart to allow them to travel faster -as well as further- for their juice business.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to aid transportation for their fruit juice business

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Mr. Kamran is a low income vulnerable person. He is 40 and married with two children. He lives in Saatli town, in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Kamran has seven pedigree milk cows. He sells 150 litres of milk a day to a local milk processing shop. His children help him to graze the herd. The income is not sufficient for Kamran to save enough money to renovate his cow-shed. For that purpose, Kamran applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of $500. After he expands his cow-shed, he plans to apply for another loan to increase the number of cattle in his herd.

loans.use: To renovate his cow-shed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs. Huon Sokun, 45, lives with her husband and three children in SiemReap province, Cambodia. To service her family’s expenses, Mrs. Huon Sokun sells fermented and live fish at an open-air market, where she earns about $5 each day. Her husband, works as a blacksmith, also earning around $5 each day.

Mrs. Huon Sokun and her husband are requesting a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle used for their business’s transportation and also to buy more fish to help expand Mrs Sukon's inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to help with transportation for their business, as well as to purchase more fish to expand their inventory.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Mrs. Roun, aged 37, sells fish in her community and earns $5 per day. Her husband, aged 44, is a motor-taxi driver who earns $10 per day. They have 2 children.

Mrs. Roun is requesting a $1,200 loan to fund the purchase of farmland so that she can grow and sell vegetables alongside fish, thus diversifying her business and increasing the profits she can earn.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to grow and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay S., 43, is married to Mr. Mik Mun, 43, (pictured because Vay S. is unavailable) with five children and live in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together on their plot of land raising pigs, ducks, and chickens. They earn on average about $3 each day from selling the poultry they raise. The couple hopes this loan will help them to expand their livestock of pigs and chickens to enable them to generate additional profits for their household.

loans.use: To increase their livestock of pigs and chickens to generate additional profits.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Vay Sou and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru:
Bashorat, 42, married and has 4 children. She sells rice. Bashorat buys the wholesale rice from the local farmers and then resells it retail. Her husband helps Bashorat to sell. The profits from selling rice constitute Bashorat’s family income. Bashorat has been a MicroInvest client since 2006. She plans to use this loan to finance expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Башорат 42 года, она замужем и у нее 4 детей. Она занимается продажей риса. Башорат покупает рис у местных фермеров и потом продает в розницу. В ее бизнесе помогает ее муж. Доход от бизнеса составляет их семейный доход. В Микроинвест Башорат получает займы с 2006 года. Она планирует получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng N., 46, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband, 66, earns $2 per day as a village chief. The couple has 6 children. One of their children is a student and three of the others work in a garment factory earning $80 per month each.

Mrs. Heng N. would like to borrow $500 to finance the purchase of a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.ru:
Mukkaram, 31, is married and raising 2 children. For a few years, she has been selling fabrics. Mukkaram started with cheaper fabrics and then gradually added more expensive ones to her assortment. Now, she rents a sales spot at the central market of Isfara. Mukkaram buys her products at a wholesale market in Karosu, Kirgizstan. Her business demands significant investment of money. In addition to her personal resources, Mukkaram has been relying on MicroInvest loans for a year and a half. Now, she plans to receive a new loan to finance purchase of the Fall fabrics collection.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муккарам 31 год, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Муккарам уже несколько лет занимается продажей тканей. Она начинала свой бизнес с продажи простых тканей и постепенно перешла на продажу более дорогих тканей. Сейчас она арендует торговое место на центральном рынке города Исфара. За товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок города Каросуу, Кыргызстан. Ее бизнес требует больших денежных вложений. Кроме своих собственых денег Мукаррам получает займы в Микроинвест, с которым сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Сейчас она планирует получить новый займ для закупки осеннего ассортимента тканей.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: I Ketut Wibawa

texts.id:
Working as farmer at Tadah Hujan, Pak Ketut Wibawa has many extra time. He wants to use them to find earn extra income, by rearing pigs, and taking working odd jobs workers. With this extra income from rearing pigs, he has manage to send his only daughter Putu Ayu till finishing her SMEA education. The two pigs he currently own produce can produce up to 20 pigs every 4 months. Each piglet after every 4 months can be sold for p 150.000,00 each. With the extra financial income, he intend to buy another pig, and pig feedings.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai petani sawah Tadah Hujan, Pak Ketut Wibawa memiliki banyak waktu luang. Dia berusaha mencari tambahan penghasilan dengan beternak babi, kuli bangunan, bahkan sampai menjadi tukang batu. Beternak babi sudah menjadi penghasilan tetap keluarganya sejak menikah Dengan usaha ini pula dia bisa memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah putri tunggalnya Putu Ayu hingga tamat SMEA. Dua ekor induk babi yg dimiliki Pak Wibawa setiap 4 bulannya rata – rata bisa memproduksi anak mencapai 20 ekor. Setelah berumur 1,5 bulan, akan laku dijual Rp 150.000,00 /ekor.
